story:
Our Story

We are Oskar and Viggo, two brothers working together to bring back an old shoe and launch our brand, Bay & Wall.

A couple of years ago we received a box with a few items from our late grandad, who passed many years before. Among the belongings were a pair of woven leather shoes. Oskar was more than a bit disappointed to note that the shoes were several sizes too small. Viggo tried them on, reluctantly admitting that it was a perfect fit.

When summer came, Viggo was falling in love with the shoes. He used them more and more often. They were simply the most comfortable shoes he ever wore.

Time passed, and with increasing envy, Oskar saw Viggos love for his inherited shoes. He also noted how well they worked with all kinds of outfits. Big feet isn’t always a plus. To calm his feelings, Oskar decided to buy a pair for himself.

Years passed while roaming stores and the internet for the perfect woven leather shoe. Oskar was devastated to conclude he was decades too late. Meanwhile, Viggo had walked many miles in the already worn shoes. Now they were barely holding up, with no replacement to be seen.

This brings us to today. It didn’t feel right that such an iconic shoe as this, should just pass into oblivion. Besides, we could hardly be the only ones with a beating heart for this sleek woven leather shoe. So, we set out to produce it. The last year we have worked hard to source a factory that can help us make a remade version of this gentleman’s shoe.

Now, we are two brothers, united and passionate to revive the shoe of our grandad. In loving memory, we will call it Einar after our grandfather. The shoe is ready for production.

Why we LOVE it

Ever since we got our grandpa’s old pair, we’ve been astonished at how easy the shoe is to combine with different outfits. Never too casual and never too elegant. And it’s super comfortable.

The SHOE

Einar is a luxury product made in Europe. It's a handcrafted leather derby with a soft, woven leather upper. It features a thin and very flexible leather sole. The upper and outer sole are stitched together using a special method for maximum comfort and durability.

Most shoes with similar features cost more than 4500 SEK (500 USD) in stores. Our goal is to match the price of a luxury sneaker, and we aim for a retail price of 3600 SEK (400 USD), without compromising the quality. However, during our crowdfunding period, we will offer you a far superior price, which we’ll never be able to match again.

Why leather in the summer?

Leather keeps your feet dryer. By using woven leather, there is more surface for the moisture to evaporate. Kind of like a heat sink. Moist leather wears more easily. Woven leather increases the strength of the material while still being really soft. A full leather shoe doesn’t get as smelly as a sneaker full of textiles. 

Production

We have chosen an excellent Portuguese factory, capable of delivering handwoven leather, to produce our shoe. Using the best Italian leather, we believe this is an outstanding combination of skilled craftsmanship and fine materials.

What sets us apart?

There are many woven leather shoes out there. What sets us apart is STYLE, QUALITY, and COMFORT. We’ve been searching for a shoe like ours for years, that's why we decided to produce it ourselves. We never found a shoe that really looks the way we want it to. What we’ve seen is that many woven shoes of high quality, are actually hard as wood. Their uppers are even more rigid than a non-woven shoe, and the soles are really stiff. Our shoe has a super soft upper and a flexible sole. They are comfortable from day one. Other woven shoes are falling apart after just a few days of wearing. Our shoe is handcrafted from high-quality leather, and the stitched sole makes sure it holds together. There are of course beautiful exceptions, but they often cost twice as much.

Size information

We are using European sizes for our shoes. Please note that all sizes below are men's sizes, but everyone can wear our shoes. If you are unsure, please, measure your foot from heel to toe. The soft construction adapts really well to your foot as long as you select the right length.

Delivery

For our Indiegogo backers, we'll  start shipping the shoes in November 2018.

For backers in the US: FREE SHIPPING applies to all preorders. No US import duty or fees on orders below 800 USD.

For backers in EU: FREE SHIPPING applies to all preorders. VAT is included in your pledge.

For INTERNATIONAL backers: Shipping is 15€, duties and local taxes will be charged by the appropriate authority at the destination country and are paid by the recipient.

Due to our limited margins, we will have to charge exchange shipping both ways for any exchanges that need to be made. This applies to all backers, US, Sweden, EU and international.

New to crowdfunding?

Here's a short introduction; Crowdfunding makes it possible for people and businesses to finance new products or projects by letting everyone who wants to, contribute financially and get a reward in return.

Since we're in a pre-market stage, we don't need to consider the markups required by retailers. This gives you a UNIQUE opportunity to get a pair of shoes before everyone else, at a price far below the future high street cost.

Risks and challenges

We are working with advisors from different parts of the industry to make sure we have all elements in place for a smooth delivery. We have a logistic pipeline already setup. The development and coming production of our shoe are supervised by a member of Portugals most premiere shoemaking families, to ensure construction and quality meets our standards.

We are confident that we will deliver a luxurious and high-quality shoe. However unlikely, there is a risk of delays due to high demand from some of the subcontractors of our factory, possibly delaying our delivery a few days.

About us

We're two brothers living in Malmö, south of Sweden. Shoes of all kinds has been a passion of ours for many years. Since summer can be very short in Sweden, everything summery is almost holy to us, so is summer shoes. 

Please, share any thoughts or questions with us! We’ll answer as fast as we can.

Thank you!

Oskar Lagerwall & Viggo Lagerwall

story:
The ear•1, part of a complete comfort connect system, allows the user to adjust the elastic on a mask for face size and comfort so that the ear•1 creates a snug seal allowing for the mask to be comfortably worn for extended periods of time. This prevents the irritation and pain that many people experience around their ears and behind their head when wearing traditional elastic face masks. 

Ear•1: What is it?

  • A small plastic piece in which the bottom half has two holes that work as access points to connect the elastic loop of the mask. The top half is angled to comfortably attach the mask to the inside curvature of the ear, otherwise known as the tragus. 
  • There’s no obstruction of sound or surrounding noise
  • Keeps mask at the front of the face with no adhesive or ties/straps around the ears or head 
  • Keeps masks intact and undamaged while also keeping straps from tangling in hair or jewelry

 

Benefits of ear•1:

  • Safer haircuts - Wearers won’t have to remove or touch their mask while having their washed, cut, dyed or styled making the interaction between client and stylist safer. 
  • Accessible and adaptable - The ear•1 is perfect for those with assistive technology devices like hearing aids, cochlear implants or those who wear glasses. Mask strings no longer need to tangle with other items that need to be worn over the ear or around the head and can keep the mask secure without obstructing vision or hearing. 
  • Easy on and off - Keep your mask assembly together without having to untangle your hair, earrings or other accessories each time you take a mask on or off.
  • Versatile - The ear•1 works with almost any kind of mask from n95s to homemade, the patent-pending design accommodates most thickness of elastic and ties and is fully adjustable to the wearers' preferences. It can be used by everyone and is a completely cleanable, biodegradable, and recyclable material.


 

Behind the ear•1™

Brandon Farone isn’t your average 23-year old. Unlike those who disregarded health warnings by going maskless and attending parties or going out to crowded bars, Brandon saw an opportunity to test his entrepreneurial acumen. He launched FAR•1 Solutions in mid 2020. 

As a result of faithfully wearing a face mask with elastic straps, Brandon identified several problems that he and others were experiencing and sought a solution to address the discomfort and inconvenience associated with wearing an elastic face mask. Problems such as behind ear pain and head strain in addition to the users’ hair, glasses, and earrings becoming tangled in the elastic are common user complaints. Moreover, with traditional elastic masks wrapping around the ears, it’s impossible for anyone getting a haircut to safely be able to keep their mask on during the procedure.

Brandon was intent on inventing a new way to connect a face mask, and the ear•1 does just that. Ear•1 is a universal face mask comfort connect system that easily attaches the mask to the front inside of the ears, rather than around the back of the ears or head like so many face masks do. The ear•1 connection allows the mask to secure in the front of the face.

Ear•1: Breakdown

The ear•1 utilizes a small plastic piece that has two halves. On the bottom half are two holes that work as access points as the user connects the elastic part of their mask through them. On the top half of the ear•1 is the angle that comfortably attaches the mask to the inside curvature of the ear, otherwise known as the tragus. By resting on the inside curve of the ear, there’s no obstruction of sound or surrounding noise.

 The ear•1 allows the user to adjust the elastic for face size and comfort so that ear•1 creates a snug seal that allows for the mask to be comfortably worn for extended periods of time and prevents the irritation and pain that many people experience around their ears and behind their head when wearing traditional elastic face masks. 

Benefits of ear•1

The ear•1 allows wearers to get a “safer” haircut since they won’t have to remove their mask as the stylist cuts around the ears, sideburns and back of the head.  Keeping the mask on makes the procedure safe for not only the user, but for the hair stylists too. The ear•1 can be used by everyone and is a completely cleanable, biodegradable, and recyclable material.

How to Use the ear•1

The ear•1 is easy to use and easy to assemble. We provide detailed instructions to ensure that your mask fits comfortably and securely. 

Stay Connected with Far•1 Solutions

We'll provide regular updates on here as this campaign moves along. Be sure to follow us on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn for additional updates and other great happenings.

He launched FAR•1 Solutions in mid 2020. As a result of faithfully wearing a face mask with elastic straps, Brandon identified several problems that he and others were experiencing and sought a solution to address the discomfort and inconvenience associated with wearing an elastic face mask. Problems such as behind ear pain and head strain in addition to the users’ hair, glasses, and earrings becoming tangled in the elastic are common user complaints. Moreover, with traditional elastic masks wrapping around the ears, it’s impossible for anyone getting a haircut to safely be able to keep their mask on during the procedure.Brandon was intent on inventing a new way to connect a face mask, and the ear•1 does just that. Ear•1 is a universal face mask comfort connect system that easily attaches the mask to the front inside of the ears, rather than around the back of the ears or head like so many face masks do. The ear•1 connection allows the mask to secure in the front of the face.Ear•1: BreakdownThe ear•1 utilizes a small plastic piece that has two halves. On the bottom half are two holes that work as access points as the user connects the elastic part of their mask through them. On the top half of the ear•1 is the angle that comfortably attaches the mask to the inside curvature of the ear, otherwise known as the tragus. By resting on the inside curve of the ear, there’s no obstruction of sound or surrounding noise. The ear•1 allows the user to adjust the elastic for face size and comfort so that ear•1 creates a snug seal that allows for the mask to be comfortably worn for extended periods of time and prevents the irritation and pain that many people experience around their ears and behind their head when wearing traditional elastic face masks. Benefits of ear•1The ear•1 allows wearers to get a “safer” haircut since they won’t have to remove their mask as the stylist cuts around the ears, sideburns and back of the head.  Keeping the mask on makes the procedure safe for not only the user, but for the hair stylists too. The ear•1 can be used by everyone and is a completely cleanable, biodegradable, and recyclable material.How to Use the ear•1The ear•1 is easy to use and easy to assemble. We provide detailed instructions to ensure that your mask fits comfortably and securely. Stay Connected with Far•1 SolutionsWe'll provide regular updates on here as this campaign moves along. Be sure to follow us on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn for additional updates and other great happenings.

story:
The Origin Story:

Styling and catered shopping all in one! QuikFit came to life over the question of what jacket to wear. Co-founder, Chris, was contemplating what type of jacket went with his outfit and while google can be helpful it is by no means efficient nor specific to his taste. That is when the idea for an app came to life, he shared the story with Co-Founder, Sarah, and everything took off from there!

What is QuikFit?

Whether you have a passion for fashion or simply trying to figure out your own personal style, QuikFit is a resource that becomes your “personalized styling tool”, similar to you looking into a virtual mirror and trying on clothes from your favorite shops, seeing yourself wearing those clothes and purchasing the perfect look that you love! We always like to say that you can #buythefit

Why Are We Making QuikFit? 

Our mission is for the user to feel confident and strong in every FIT they wear! QuikFit is a tool to show the world your individuality and confidence.

Have an important presentation at work, QuikFit it – got a hot date, QuikFit it – going to a special event, QuikFit it! Have us be your personal stylist. Time to #buythefit

How Do You Personalize Your Experience?

Two ways:

1. When you sign up with our app, you first create an avatar of yourself, similar to creating an avatar on Xbox, or Snapchat, you will be able to fine-tune your styling experience to your personal features.
 

2. All users fill out a detailed style quiz to help us create a catered and custom experience for you so we can recommend your favorite types of brands, colors, clothing, you name it. Based on this information QuikFit will cater all options based on your style. QuikFit will constantly check for new products to share with you and you get to see new products on your personal avatar!

Soon, our app will let you upload photos of your current clothing and we will be able to customize your experience even more.

How Do We Pull This Off? 

(Powered through Augmented Reality)

We are merging with the fashion industry through AR Technology (Augmented Reality). We want our users to not only pick their favorite outfits, but to be able to physically visualize it on a personalized avatar of themselves (similar to having a virtual mirror).

We are integrated with your favorite fashion outlets, small and large, including main national/international brands like Nike, Steve Madden, Tommy Hilfiger, Under Armour, and many of your favorite brands.

How can you help us?

Our team is so excited to get the app up and running but we need your help! Just like any new business, there are start-up costs and we can really use your help to make this a reality and show the world the first true personalized stylist tool. Our first initial costs will be going towards development efforts for the app. Any donation is greatly appreciated and there are perks for all early investors! Feel free to contact us at quikfitapp1@gmail.com for more information or questions!

story:
Sigma 50: The Worlds Toughest Hoodie. 

An Over-Built, No-Expense-Spared, USA Made Hoodie with hidden secret pockets. The heavyweight blended cotton fabric is reinforced with several feet of Kevlar threading, while the hood joint is further reinforced with a durable piped seam. Designed for Adventuring, Travel and Holding your expanded Everyday Carry items.

The Hoodie You’ve Always Wanted.

Ever Sigma 50 starts with a heavyweight, blended cotton fabric. After the fabric is hand cut, it is first sewn with ultra premium Corespun threading. This is regarded by many as the best quality threading in the world. When this step is completed, the seams are then overstitched with vertical runs of Kevlar threading. This hybrid matrix of Kevlar and Corespun creates the strongest seams ever put in a hoodie. All the hardware is premium aged brass, and feature an all weather ready, heavy-duty YKK Zipper.

 

Why Kevlar?

Kevlar is one of the most incredible materials ever created by humankind. It provides incredible strength, durability and resilience that is unmatched by nearly all other materials out there. It is trusted by explorers, the military, and is even used in space, notably in space suits and the International Space Station, helping to protect it from flying space debris. We thought it would be the perfect way to “level up” the durability of existing hoodies, while also creating the ultimate conversation piece among family, friends and co-workers. We source our Kevlar from legitimate / authorized resellers ensuring premium quality.

Travel Ready & Theft Resistant 

Sigma 50 is the ultimate travel hoodie. The hidden pockets make pickpocketing extremely difficult, and provide a safe spot for travel documents, tickets, passports, wallets and currency. When the hoodie is zipped up, the only way to get to these pockets is to reach quite a way up the hoodie from the bottom- which is something extremely noticeable. 

Perfect Fitting Passport Pocket 

Custom seams make Sigma 50 drape naturally over shoulders and prevent seam wear.

EDC Approved

If you’re a fan of Everyday Carry, then this Hoodie was made for you. All the additional storage space means you can increase what you EDC, or spread your existing carry among your pants and Sigma 50- lightening the load of your pant pockets. 

Shown below with a 7” flipper knife, Maglite Pro flashlight, charcoal toothbrush, titanium wallet, and iPhone.

The seam stitching to these hidden pockets are invisible when zipped up, making the hoodie like clean and traditional from the outside.

Awesome Color Options 

We are offering a  selection of 5 awesome color options that you can choose at any time. Standard is Charcoal, Midnight Blue and Jersey Grey. Hunter Green and Indigo are offered with a stretch goal of $45,000- which is less than either of our projects have raised…meaning there is a great chance these will get unlocked! All of these represent the most desirable and timeless colors in fashion. You cant go wrong with any of them!

Survival in Mind

The hoodie drawstring is made from 550 Paracord with brass tips. The eyelet hoops are oversized with heavy gauge brass, making it easier to take out / put in the Paracord drawstring. Every Sigma 50 comes with almost 5 feet of 550 Paracord. This can be a lifesaver in emergency situations in both urban and nature environments. Explorers, adventurers, and military personnel understand the versatility of Paracord, so we thought it would be the perfect addition to the Sigma 50.

Premium Quality

Every Sigma 50 is handmade in the USA. Our production manager has created clothing for some of the highest end luxury and boutique brands out there, and will be bringing that same quality to the Sigma 50 project. Not only are using premium fabric, hardware and thread, we are using self recovering elastic cuffing / ribbing which should eliminate those ugly baggy cuffs, while also keeping the cold out. The elastic content in these cuff make them resistant to over-stretching, which should keep your Sigma 50 looking great and fresh for years to come. 

Traditional Fit with 6 Size Options

Trust Us.

We are not new to this, and have been designing clothing for the past 4 years. We have other successful projects, which are currently being worn in over 40 countries worldwide. We entered the clothing world with a statement piece, the Half Century Coat- which we towed a car with in a demonstration. We spare no expense, and make the best stuff we can possible put together. Let us make you a believer, and pledge for your Sigma 50 today! We think you’re going to love it.

DISCLAIMER

KEVLAR is a Registered Trademark of DuPont de Nemours, Inc. which is in no way affiliated with the product. DuPont has neither partnered with or endorsed this product.

Comments? Feedback?

You can reach us at any time: CraftedWool@gmail.com.

story:
Meet the Uzangi girls!

We are four girls with a passion for fashion and for making a difference in women’s lives. Each of us happened upon the same idea and then one day by chance (wink! wink!) we met and realised we would make a great team. Meet Emma, Christie, Joyce and Leanne – we invite you to come on the journey with us as we launch our new fashion label!

We love well-designed clothes that become part of your wardrobe favourites. You know… that item of clothing that has lasted through all the fads and phases, while many of your tops and skirts have come and gone. We love creative and innovative design that allows you to show your true personality. We also love to design clothes that celebrate women’s value and worth – each one unique and special.

Our other passion is bringing change and transformation to people’s lives. As part of our fashion business we plan to create micro-business opportunities for women in Zambia. As well as taking our design inspiration from this country, we also want to incorporate into our very own business model, a way to practically make a difference in these women’s lives.  Not only an economic solution, but equipping and empowering for better health, relationships, family and community life.

It’s a big idea and we have so much to learn… but we truly believe in this project. This is about building a legacy that will out last us and touch women’s lives in many continents of the world.

 - Emma, Christie, Joyce & Leanne   www.ittakesthree.com.au

   

What We Need & What You Get

We want to be smart about this, so our initial focus is to establish a strong and viable business in 2014 that can then provide a consistent stream of support to One Light, our non-profit partner. One Light will oversee community projects in Zambia and Australia.

We are aiming to raise $10,000 as startup capital for our business. It will go towards things like:

  • Purchase of chitenge material in Zambia
  • Labour costs for our Zambian tailors
  • Purchase of sewing machines 
  • Establishment of online store in January 2014
  • Contributions to travel expenses to Zambia
  • Set up and equipment for fashion markets here in Australia
  • Resources for marketing (logo designed, good camera, computers, etc)

Perks! Yay!

We absolutely want to reward our supporters with some great perks. Right at this moment some of our team are actually in Zambia working hard on our first collection...and your perks!  

The Impact

Let me just say that there is a lot of passion and heart behind this project. Over the last 12 months we have realised this is not just about fashion, this is about working in a business in an innovative way that links the 'bigger picture' to the shopper.

We want women who buy our clothes - to encounter a message of value and worth - incorporated into the very garment itself and also through the stories we tell. These will be stories of women both in Australia and Zambia, being equipped to live a better life and boldly step towards living their own dreams.

The four of us girls bring such a huge range of experience to this project - business startup experience, marketing, fashion design, community work, nursing, project management, online fashion store, the list goes on! Suffice to say we feel we are equipped as a team to achieve our goal!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, we totally understand and we'd appreciate your support in other ways. Like...

  • Brag about us on your Facebook page and share a link to our blog www.ittakesthree.com.au
  • Email all your fashion lover friends and let them know an exciting new label will be launching early 2014!

Thanks for listening! We're excited.

story:
We are very happy you found our campaign page!

If you want to be part of a positive change and help us setting new standards for Fashion, you can participate by pre-ordering one or more of our garments or illustrations.

Even though Indiegogo offers a simple donation option (Back it button), we kindly ask you to not use that, because donations are not a legal option according to the Finnish law. Thank you for your understanding!


iluut’s first collection

iluut’s first collection is inspired by a soft and minimal approach to the brand’s Scandinavian roots. It embraces classical and timeless pieces with a playful twist to its prints and detailing to give it a fresh and modern approach. The pieces are very relaxed with a modern silhouette that fits well to various body types. They are great pieces to have time and time again from summer to transitional weather because of its breathable and sustainable fabrics.

The collection contains a relaxed lightweight denim shirt dress and a modern shirt in three colours (one white, two printed) and three sizes (S, M, L).

 

Nathalie wears the Cotton-Tencel shirt dress​

 

Nathalie wears the Linen-cotton dotted shirt​

 

Nathalie wears the Linen-cotton square shirt​

 

Nathalie wears the Linen-cotton white shirt​

 

 

Cotton-Tencel shirt dress 

 

Linen-cotton white shirt 

 

Linen-cotton square shirt 

 

Linen-cotton dotted shirt​ 

 

Illustrations

We cherish the beautiful design work and now you have a special chance to buy our sketches! Lovely interior elements to decorate your home or as a gift.

 

Our story

iluut was born from our Finnish founder, Elina (29), and her dream about a more sustainable fashion industry. She felt that our generation needed new fashion standards: beautiful and affordable clothes should be possible to make without compromising the working conditions and our environment. Pretty ambitious dream, isn’t it? Elina wanted to challenge herself and make it happen. So she shared a video on YouTube where she was looking for warm-hearted, international professionals to join the project.

Italian, internationally well-known print designer, Silvia (30), who has designed for established brands such as Zara, Topshop and Adidas, saw the video and sent an email to Elina. The young women started Skyping and noticed they shared the same vision about ethically and environmentally sustainable produced garments, designed for the modern woman.

The pieces fell into place when they found a fashion designer, Vj (25), living in London, who shared the same thoughts about sustainability and a value-led fashion industry. Vj has worked for both luxury and premium brands such as Simone Rocha and Self-Portrait Studio and currently designing dresses for Marks&Spencer.

Every now and then we meet face to face to have inspiring workshops or visit our partners, but our daily work is mostly done online using different innovative tools. For sharing inspiration we use Pinterest, for quick updates Whatsapp, for organizing and planning the work Meistertask and so on.

If you would love to know more about us, please feel free to email us at info@iluut.com.

We would love to hear from you!

 

We believe in

♥ Full traceability. We tell and show through our social media where every step of the production cycle is made because you have the right to know that. Transparent working decreases fashion’s biggest ethical and environmental problems like child labor, unsecured working conditions, dangerous chemicals and industrial pollution/impact.

♥ Constant learning. We constantly learn everyday while meeting inspiring and driven people. Receiving your comments also help us further developing our products whilst reading inspiring articles and books.  Learning and growing is super important because we want to achieve the best outcome for all of us.

♥ Low environmental impact. We try our very best finding materials that are eco-friendly and manufacturers who pay attention into water consumption and using green energy. Getting a lot of waste is one of the biggest environmental problems in fashion. That is why when cutting our fabrics, the leftovers will be used for making ethically produced, beautiful carpets. Also, our initial customers will be European women, so the clothes are made locally in Europe too! This greatly reduces both the carbon footprint and the environmental impact of iluut products!

♥ High quality. When both the manufacturing and the quality of the materials are outstanding, the product will last and will stay as one of your favorite pieces for a long time. We are committed to make timeless clothes!

♥ Affordable & fair pricing. Everyone in the production cycle needs to get paid fairly. This does not mean that sustainable fashion should only be available at a luxury price range, instead it should be available for everyone. That is why we have worked very hard to to offer high quality products at affordable prices.

♥ Your power. You have a key role in making a positive change in the fashion industry. By buying sustainable made clothes you support better working conditions and lower environmental impact.

♥ Your uniqueness. We cherish women’s variety and differences by investing time in making garments that fit well to as many body types as possible.

♥ Giving back. Our success will only be possible through your trust in us and in our products. A share of the profits we will receive will be invested to bring back something good to our future generations. We would like these profits to be profoundly beneficial for the education of children in developing countries and give them a chance to create future innovations. That’s why 5% of each product’s margin will go to help building a PoP school! Please check out their link here page to know more about them.


Looking for the right suppliers and couple of words about pricing                           

The biggest surprise along the way has been how hard it has been finding the right suppliers. Unfortunately, there are many certificated companies that offer only a couple of certificated products. We wanted to find partners, especially in fabric production, who are really committed into sustainable production all the way! After spending one and a half years finding actively great quality fabrics, we found an Italian family owned company, Albini Group, who produces high quality shirt fabrics and uses green energy in their mills. Their know-how and passion is beyond expectations! That, of course, also shows in the price; we learned that most of their fabrics are over 10€ per meter - far more expensive than the fabrics coming from Asia (they cost normally 1-4 € per meter). We learned that Albini is well known for its high standards and quality. Because we only want to offer the best for you, Albini’s fabrics were our choice for the first collection. Even though they are specialised in shirt fabrics, we were fortunate to find a beautiful, cotton-Tencel fabric for our shirt dress too.            

We talked a lot about printing. The biggest problem in the industry is the huge amount of water waste, and there are still many old printing machines that consume a lot of energy and have a high environmental impact. That is why we researched extensively to find GSL, an Italian printing company who uses the latest generation of energy efficient printers and water based inks. All our prints are hand drawn, and designed for a crisp, original yet timeless look.

In the clothing production the sewing is also very crucial in terms of the final product. We visited many ateliers before finding the ones we felt happy to co-operate with. We produced the sample items that you can see in the pictures in Turku, Finland, by lovely seamstresses. The production in Finland is very expensive and to be able to keep the final products’ price affordable, we decided to make the final production in Estonia.

The atelier is two years old and it was grounded for high quality workmanship. There are seven seamstresses working in the atelier and they are all paid 40% above the Estonian average seamstress salary. For us this specific aspect was crucial, because we want to ensure that the workers are fairly paid for their work.          

So, the choices we are making are not the cheapest. Great quality has a price. But that should not be too high. That is why we are cooperating directly with companies. The Intermediaries would take their share and that would show in the final price. We have worked very hard to ensure high quality without compromising our vision for offering beautiful, affordable, sustainable clothes. We want you to be very happy with the value you’ll get for your money!

Production Information

Shirt dress

Material & origin: 65% cotton  (Egypt),   35% Tencel lyocell  (Austria)

Fabric made by: Albiate Milano 

Spinning: ICA, Italy 

Weaving, Dyeing: Albini, Italy 

Finishing: TRT, Italy

Washing: Varr, Estonia

Reason why this material is chosen:

Innovative sustainable fiber (Tencel lyocell)  combined with a natural fiber, cotton. This material feels very soft and very comfortable on the skin.

 

Shirt

Material & origin: 63% linen (Normandy, France), 37% cotton (Egypt)

Fabric made by: Cotonificio Albini

Skutching: Terre de Lin, France 

Spinning: Linificio, Lithuania 

Weaving: Albini, Czech Republic 

Dyeing & Finishing: Albini, Italy 

Fabric printed by: GSL, Italy  

Printed fabric finished by: Seride, Italy

Reason why this material is chosen:  

The majority  of this fabric is linen, grown in  Normandy, France, which has a very low water consumption.

 

Samples & Production

Sample sewn in: Framila ompelimo, Finland   

Production takes place in: I-Studio OÜ, Tartu, Estonia

Pattern made by: Iti Tigas

 

Making one garment needs many people

This summer we travelled over 7.000 km across Europe to meet the people involved in the production. It was really eye-opening to see how many people and how much know how are needed to produce just one garment. That made us wonder how unsustainable is to pay 5€ for a t-shirt in fast fashion chains.

This picture will visualize the production cycle of our shirt (please note: inside these steps there are many different others):

  1. Designing
  2. Growing the fiber
  3. Skutching
  4. Spinning
  5. Weaving
  6. Finishing
  7. Printing or Dyeing
  8. Washing
  9. Pattern making the patterns
  10. Sample sewing
  11. Fitting
  12. Production sewing
  13. Sending the product to you

 

The crowdfunding campaign

When you will order our products during this campaign, you will help us to:

  • complete our first collection
  • start developing new organic woolen sample products
  • open our web shop by the end of 2016

We are raising 15 000€ to make this happen. If we will exceed our target, we will be able to start the organic woolen garments production and invest in researching further innovative materials for the spring 2017 collection.

 

Other ways you can help

We do not see iluut just as a brand, but mainly as a project of awareness towards sustainability in which we warmly welcome each European woman to be part of!

There are many ways you can participate:

  • PRE-ORDER our garments through this Indiegogo campaign (shirt, shirt dress)
  • INVEST in our campaign even if these first products are not your style but you share the same vision about sustainable fashion – you can order an illustration that will beautifully decorate your home, or as a gift for your friends.
  • SHARE this campaign with your family and friends on Facebook or Instagram
  • SIGN UP for our e-mail list at iluut.com
  • FOLLOW us on Facebook or Instagram

By spreading the word about sustainable fashion, we’ll send a strong message together to the fashion world: we’ll be able to show how many people demands new standards of fashion, and to know where and how the clothes are made.

 

Preliminary rewards timeline

 

After the campaign ends we will confirm for the pre-orderers when their orders are shipped.

Giving back

When we will reach our crowdfunding goal – thanks to all of you – we will give 5% of each product’s margin to build a Pencils of Promise school.

250 million children cannot read this text. Together we can change that step by step!

We were so empowered by Adam Braun’s story, about how he travelled all over the world and asked children what they wanted the most.  The answer was surprising: “a pencil”.

That answer made Adam work hard to fulfill the dream; a pencil symbolizing education. So, in 2008 Adam founded the Pencils of Promise organization and since then they have built over 360 schools in developing countries. The organization works transparently, just like we do, and that is why it naturally felt something we would love to support.

Also, their way of working is clever. They commit the local people to the school project so that they need to finance 10-20% of each school by themselves. Because they can’t afford to finance that, they will give their work effort for building the school which value will be the 10-20%.

Be inspired and read the whole story how one can make a huge difference. 

 

Final note

 

We want to make sure you’ll enjoy our products. One of the most important things is that you’ll get your correct size. That is why we kindly ask you to take your own measurements and compare them carefully to our size picture.

We love being punctual and the production schedule estimate is based on the discussions with our suppliers. If we do highly exceed our goal, there might be some short delay on shipping - but in that case we will inform you immediately about timing. In that case, we will ship your items based on the order we have received your purchase.
story_txt:
We are very happy you found our campaign page!If you want to be part of a positive change and help us setting new standards for Fashion, you can participate by pre-ordering one or more of our garments or illustrations.Even though Indiegogo offers a simple donation option (Back it button), we kindly ask you to not use that, because donations are not a legal option according to the Finnish law. Thank you for your understanding!
iluut’s first collectioniluut’s first collection is inspired by a soft and minimal approach to the brand’s Scandinavian roots. It embraces classical and timeless pieces with a playful twist to its prints and detailing to give it a fresh and modern approach. The pieces are very relaxed with a modern silhouette that fits well to various body types. They are great pieces to have time and time again from summer to transitional weather because of its breathable and sustainable fabrics.The collection contains a relaxed lightweight denim shirt dress and a modern shirt in three colours (one white, two printed) and three sizes (S, M, L). Nathalie wears the Cotton-Tencel shirt dress​ Nathalie wears the Linen-cotton dotted shirt​ Nathalie wears the Linen-cotton square shirt​ Nathalie wears the Linen-cotton white shirt​  Cotton-Tencel shirt dress  Linen-cotton white shirt  Linen-cotton square shirt  Linen-cotton dotted shirt​  IllustrationsWe cherish the beautiful design work and now you have a special chance to buy our sketches! Lovely interior elements to decorate your home or as a gift. Our storyiluut was born from our Finnish founder, Elina (29), and her dream about a more sustainable fashion industry. She felt that our generation needed new fashion standards: beautiful and affordable clothes should be possible to make without compromising the working conditions and our environment. Pretty ambitious dream, isn’t it? Elina wanted to challenge herself and make it happen. So she shared a video on YouTube where she was looking for warm-hearted, international professionals to join the project.Italian, internationally well-known print designer, Silvia (30), who has designed for established brands such as Zara, Topshop and Adidas, saw the video and sent an email to Elina. The young women started Skyping and noticed they shared the same vision about ethically and environmentally sustainable produced garments, designed for the modern woman.The pieces fell into place when they found a fashion designer, Vj (25), living in London, who shared the same thoughts about sustainability and a value-led fashion industry. Vj has worked for both luxury and premium brands such as Simone Rocha and Self-Portrait Studio and currently designing dresses for Marks&Spencer.Every now and then we meet face to face to have inspiring workshops or visit our partners, but our daily work is mostly done online using different innovative tools. For sharing inspiration we use Pinterest, for quick updates Whatsapp, for organizing and planning the work Meistertask and so on.If you would love to know more about us, please feel free to email us at info@iluut.com.We would love to hear from you! We believe in♥ Full traceability. We tell and show through our social media where every step of the production cycle is made because you have the right to know that. Transparent working decreases fashion’s biggest ethical and environmental problems like child labor, unsecured working conditions, dangerous chemicals and industrial pollution/impact.♥ Constant learning. We constantly learn everyday while meeting inspiring and driven people. Receiving your comments also help us further developing our products whilst reading inspiring articles and books.  Learning and growing is super important because we want to achieve the best outcome for all of us.♥ Low environmental impact. We try our very best finding materials that are eco-friendly and manufacturers who pay attention into water consumption and using green energy. Getting a lot of waste is one of the biggest environmental problems in fashion. That is why when cutting our fabrics, the leftovers will be used for making ethically produced, beautiful carpets. Also, our initial customers will be European women, so the clothes are made locally in Europe too! This greatly reduces both the carbon footprint and the environmental impact of iluut products!♥ High quality. When both the manufacturing and the quality of the materials are outstanding, the product will last and will stay as one of your favorite pieces for a long time. We are committed to make timeless clothes!♥ Affordable & fair pricing. Everyone in the production cycle needs to get paid fairly. This does not mean that sustainable fashion should only be available at a luxury price range, instead it should be available for everyone. That is why we have worked very hard to to offer high quality products at affordable prices.♥ Your power. You have a key role in making a positive change in the fashion industry. By buying sustainable made clothes you support better working conditions and lower environmental impact.♥ Your uniqueness. We cherish women’s variety and differences by investing time in making garments that fit well to as many body types as possible.♥ Giving back. Our success will only be possible through your trust in us and in our products. A share of the profits we will receive will be invested to bring back something good to our future generations. We would like these profits to be profoundly beneficial for the education of children in developing countries and give them a chance to create future innovations. That’s why 5% of each product’s margin will go to help building a PoP school! Please check out their link here page to know more about them.
Looking for the right suppliers and couple of words about pricing                           The biggest surprise along the way has been how hard it has been finding the right suppliers. Unfortunately, there are many certificated companies that offer only a couple of certificated products. We wanted to find partners, especially in fabric production, who are really committed into sustainable production all the way! After spending one and a half years finding actively great quality fabrics, we found an Italian family owned company, Albini Group, who produces high quality shirt fabrics and uses green energy in their mills. Their know-how and passion is beyond expectations! That, of course, also shows in the price; we learned that most of their fabrics are over 10€ per meter - far more expensive than the fabrics coming from Asia (they cost normally 1-4 € per meter). We learned that Albini is well known for its high standards and quality. Because we only want to offer the best for you, Albini’s fabrics were our choice for the first collection. Even though they are specialised in shirt fabrics, we were fortunate to find a beautiful, cotton-Tencel fabric for our shirt dress too.            We talked a lot about printing. The biggest problem in the industry is the huge amount of water waste, and there are still many old printing machines that consume a lot of energy and have a high environmental impact. That is why we researched extensively to find GSL, an Italian printing company who uses the latest generation of energy efficient printers and water based inks. All our prints are hand drawn, and designed for a crisp, original yet timeless look.In the clothing production the sewing is also very crucial in terms of the final product. We visited many ateliers before finding the ones we felt happy to co-operate with. We produced the sample items that you can see in the pictures in Turku, Finland, by lovely seamstresses. The production in Finland is very expensive and to be able to keep the final products’ price affordable, we decided to make the final production in Estonia.The atelier is two years old and it was grounded for high quality workmanship. There are seven seamstresses working in the atelier and they are all paid 40% above the Estonian average seamstress salary. For us this specific aspect was crucial, because we want to ensure that the workers are fairly paid for their work.          So, the choices we are making are not the cheapest. Great quality has a price. But that should not be too high. That is why we are cooperating directly with companies. The Intermediaries would take their share and that would show in the final price. We have worked very hard to ensure high quality without compromising our vision for offering beautiful, affordable, sustainable clothes. We want you to be very happy with the value you’ll get for your money!Production InformationShirt dressMaterial & origin: 65% cotton  (Egypt),   35% Tencel lyocell  (Austria)Fabric made by: Albiate Milano Spinning: ICA, Italy Weaving, Dyeing: Albini, Italy Finishing: TRT, ItalyWashing: Varr, EstoniaReason why this material is chosen:Innovative sustainable fiber (Tencel lyocell)  combined with a natural fiber, cotton. This material feels very soft and very comfortable on the skin. ShirtMaterial & origin: 63% linen (Normandy, France), 37% cotton (Egypt)Fabric made by: Cotonificio AlbiniSkutching: Terre de Lin, France Spinning: Linificio, Lithuania Weaving: Albini, Czech Republic Dyeing & Finishing: Albini, Italy Fabric printed by: GSL, Italy  Printed fabric finished by: Seride, ItalyReason why this material is chosen:  The majority  of this fabric is linen, grown in  Normandy, France, which has a very low water consumption. Samples & ProductionSample sewn in: Framila ompelimo, Finland   Production takes place in: I-Studio OÜ, Tartu, EstoniaPattern made by: Iti Tigas Making one garment needs many peopleThis summer we travelled over 7.000 km across Europe to meet the people involved in the production. open our web shop by the end of 2016
We are raising 15 000€ to make this happen. If we will exceed our target, we will be able to start the organic woolen garments production and invest in researching further innovative materials for the spring 2017 collection. Other ways you can helpWe do not see iluut just as a brand, but mainly as a project of awareness towards sustainability in which we warmly welcome each European woman to be part of!There are many ways you can participate:

So, in 2008 Adam founded the Pencils of Promise organization and since then they have built over 360 schools in developing countries. The organization works transparently, just like we do, and that is why it naturally felt something we would love to support.Also, their way of working is clever. They commit the local people to the school project so that they need to finance 10-20% of each school by themselves. Because they can’t afford to finance that, they will give their work effort for building the school which value will be the 10-20%.Be inspired and read the whole story how one can make a huge difference.  Final note We want to make sure you’ll enjoy our products. One of the most important things is that you’ll get your correct size. That is why we kindly ask you to take your own measurements and compare them carefully to our size picture.We love being punctual and the production schedule estimate is based on the discussions with our suppliers. story:
The Pre-Order campaign at Indiegogo came to an end! Don't worry, the Bobby Bizz is now available at the XD Design shop! 

(Click on the link above or go to: www.xd-design.com/Bobby-backpack) 

Our support team is ready for your questions via our online chat or by email! 

Bobby Bizz, the Best Business Briefcase and Backpack 

Keep your belongings safe and make your commute all that more comfortable with our latest generation of the Bobby Anti-Theft backpack line.  

For many of us, worrying about getting pick-pocketed while carrying our backpack can be an unpleasant experience. Even something as simple as enjoying a warm cup of coffee at a terrace can result in your bag being seized from you all in the blink of an eye.  

This is exactly why we strive to protect your luggage from theft. We want nothing more than for our clients to travel safely, comfortably and without having to be concerned about unwanted incidents.  

Whether traveling far or near, by bike, by foot or public transport, the Bobby Bizz is the perfect traveling sidekick.  

From hidden zippers to an integrated anti-theft lock, the Bobby Bizz guarantees to cause pocket-pickers to scratch their heads in confusion and be totally unable to take or even reach your personal possessions.

With the Bobby Bizz you not only roam in style but it also has the ability to go from backpack to briefcase in a matter of seconds! Perfectly suited for any occasion.  

Live more and worry less!

PATENT & COPYRIGHT

Copyright by Xindao BV, Rijswijk (The Netherlands). Xindao BV. is the brand owner of XD Design.

All rights reserved. No part of this work, nor of the information laid down herein and/or derivable here from and/or developed in connection herewith, may be reproduced or used in any form or by any means without the prior written permission of Xindao.

Worldwide Design & Utility Patent are pending.

 

 

Frequently Asked Questions

I really like the Bobby Bizz, but am actually interested in the Original and/or Compact Bobby. Where can I purchase this?

Both models are sold online with worldwide shipment, you can find the links with more information as below:
Original Bobby Backpack: www.xd-design.com/bobby-backpack
Bobby Compact: www.xd-design.com/bobby-compact

Is there a power bank included in the backpack?

No, the backpack will be delivered without the power bank.

There is a simple connection inside the backpack that makes sure that you can easily connect all power banks that are on the market (by USB plug)

This way the power bank will never be outdated and you can keep using new models to charge your devices, because this backpack will last for years!

What are the shipping costs?

We offer free shipping for deliveries to EU, US, CA, MEX, AUS, JP, MY, HK, SG, TW
For other countries, a small surcharge can apply. Simply click on the pledge and select your delivery country, you will automatically see what the shipment costs are for your selected country.

Will my laptop fit?

The Bobby Bizz has a special pocket to keep your Laptop safe and secure during your travels. This pocket is big enough for all laptops with the size 15,6”, however some 17” models can also fit.

Below are the dimensions of the laptop compartment, please check these with the dimensions of your own laptop to see if your model will fit:

36 cm (H) x 29 cm (L) x 3 cm (D)

Will my tablet fit?

The dimensions of the tablet slot are: 270 x 290 mm

What are the measurements of the backpack?

310 x 445 x 100 mm (width x length x depth)

What is the content of the backpack?

The Bobby backpack will hold 10L.

What is the weight of the backpack?

The weight of the backpack empty is 1300 gr.

What are the dimensions of the compartments inside the backpack?

Please find below all the separate dimensions.
Laptop compartment:
Fits a 17”laptop
29 x 36 x 3 cm (Width x length x depth)

Tablet compartment:
27 x 29 mm
Fits most commonly used tablets like the iPad and Samsung tablets.

Patch pocket:
29 x 19 cm

Elastic band:
3,8 cm

Hook with loop:
Total: 4,5 cm
Hook: 2,5 cm

Mesh phone pocket:
12 x 16,4 cm (width x length)

Mesh mouse pocket:
12 x 16,4 cm (width x length)

Mesh pocket with zipper:
24 x 12,5 cm (width x length)

Pocket on shoulder strap:
15 x 6 cm (height x length)

Is the Backpack 100% waterproof?

The backpack is water repellent, but not waterproof.

This means that in normal rain conditions, you should be safe and all your belongings will stay dry. However the bag is not intended to protect your belongings when thrown in a pool :) or to be in a full rain pour for about an hour.

We have a separate rain cover available on this page that you can pledge for. Simply select the pledge with the rain cover or add 5 euro (per rain cover) to your pledge to add.

The standard version does not come with the extra rain cover.

What are the specs of the security cable?

Length: 44 cm
Thickness: 2mm

What weight can the bag hold?

20 kg

*This is the limit we tested. It might still hold weight up to 30kg, but this is not tested by us as we do not think the bag will be filled with belongings over 20 kg.

Is the Backpack washing machine proof?

The backpack is not washing machine proof. However, since the whole backpack is made from water repellent material, the backpack is already better protected against dirt and stains attaching to the fabric.
Furthermore, it is easily washable with a wet cloth or wipe.

Will there be other colors?

Not at this moment, we feel that the black really suits the Bobby Bizz. Also adding extra colors will put a strain on our production process, which could cause delays.

What payment methods do you accept?

For this project we can only accept payment by Credit Card, no other payments methods.
If there is a problem with the payment with your CC, please contact the customer support team of Kickstarter, as they are in charge of collecting the payments.

Can I pay extra to get an earlier delivery?

This is unfortunately not possible. It is not a matter of extra costs, but a matter of making sure that we ship out all the backpacks in the most efficient way as possible.

We unfortunately cannot make acceptations to this process as it will delay all the other shipments.

Will I have to pay duties/VAT to receive my order?

We will do our upmost best to prevent this from happening, but any applicable duties/VAT are the sole responsibility of the backer, and not our team.

We have absolutely no control over the additional duties/VAT that may or may not be charged in your country. If you are unsure whether or not you will be charged duties/VAT at the time of receiving your perk, please get in touch with your local post office.

There is also a handy tool online available to calculate these costs. Please note that this is an external online partner, so we cannot be held accountable for differences between the actual cost and what is mentioned on this website: http://www.dutycalculator.com/new-import-duty-a....

The bags will be shipped from China, this will help you to calculate the costs.

What is the refund policy?

Due to the nature of Kickstarter as a crowdfunding platform, we cannot offer refunds to backers once the project ends.

Once the campaign ends, your pledges are immediately turned into a hard production order, this because we do not want to let anybody down on the delivery time. Therefore we cannot offer refunds once the campaign has ended.

However if you experience any quality problems, we are here to help in multiple ways! You can send us a mail at bobby@xd-design.com, chat live with our team at www.xd-design.com or send us a private message here on Indiegogo. We will be here to help solve your problem!

What if something is wrong with my backpack once receiving it?

In the very exceptional case of this happening, we will of course offer you the best service to find a suitable solution for you. We are available through mail: bobby@xd-design.com, live chat at www.xd-design.com or through the private messages here on Indiegogo. We will be here to help solve your problem!

Where can I fill in my delivery address?

At the end of the project we will send out a survey to all our backers. In this survey we will collect all needed data such as your delivery address.
We will also send out a mail to all backers right before we will send out all the packages to make sure this delivery address is still up to date.

Will we receive a tracking number for our shipment?

All backers will receive a personal tracking number with which they can trace their shipment.

Can I pick up my delivery?

This is unfortunately not possible; our entire delivery process is automated to create as much efficiency as possible. This in order to make sure that all backers will receive their package on time (or even earlier than expected). A manual pick-up will disrupt this process and is therefore not possible.

Will the zippers be strong enough to hold the lock?

The reinforced metal zippers are much stronger than regular zipper pullers. They have been created to keep your lock tight and to make sure that nobody can easily brake your zippers and take the backpack.

We will do our upmost best to prevent this from happening, but any applicable duties/VAT are the sole responsibility of the backer, and not our team.
We have absolutely no control over the additional duties/VAT that may or may not be charged in your country. If you are unsure whether or not you will be charged duties/VAT at the time of receiving your perk, please get in touch with your local post office.
There is also a handy tool online available to calculate these costs. Please note that this is an external online partner, so we cannot be held accountable for differences between the actual cost and what is mentioned on this website: http://www.dutycalculator.com/new-import-duty-a....
The bags will be shipped from China, this will help you to calculate the costs.
What is the refund policy?
Due to the nature of Kickstarter as a crowdfunding platform, we cannot offer refunds to backers once the project ends.
Once the campaign ends, your pledges are immediately turned into a hard production order, this because we do not want to let anybody down on the delivery time. Therefore we cannot offer refunds once the campaign has ended.
However if you experience any quality problems, we are here to help in multiple ways! You can send us a mail at bobby@xd-design.com, chat live with our team at www.xd-design.com or send us a private message here on Indiegogo. We will be here to help solve your problem!
What if something is wrong with my backpack once receiving it?
In the very exceptional case of this happening, we will of course offer you the best service to find a suitable solution for you. We are available through mail: bobby@xd-design.com, live chat at www.xd-design.com or through the private messages here on Indiegogo. We will be here to help solve your problem!
Where can I fill in my delivery address?
At the end of the project we will send out a survey to all our backers. In this survey we will collect all needed data such as your delivery address.We will also send out a mail to all backers right before we will send out all the packages to make sure this delivery address is still up to date.
Will we receive a tracking number for our shipment?
All backers will receive a personal tracking number with which they can trace their shipment.
Can I pick up my delivery?
This is unfortunately not possible; our entire delivery process is automated to create as much efficiency as possible. This in order to make sure that all backers will receive their package on time (or even earlier than expected). A manual pick-up will disrupt this process and is therefore not possible.
Will the zippers be strong enough to hold the lock?
The reinforced metal zippers are much stronger than regular zipper pullers. They have been created to keep your lock tight and to make sure that nobody can easily brake your zippers and take the backpack.

story:
Let me briefly introduce myself. I am Vassiliki-Zafiria Ypsilanti and for more than 15 years I have been working as a Business Architect and a Project Manager for a large public organization. In 2018, I decided to quit my job in order to follow my heart… MANTILITY!

As an art enthusiast myself and being friends with many artists and designers, I often feel disappointed by the challenges they face in gaining exposure, networking and monetization. Meanwhile, as a fashion lover I am attracted by fashion items that could reflect the hard work put into it by the artisan. I strongly believe in conscientious shopping and that means, for me, the items that are accessible and make you feel good, long after the initial decision of purchase.  

With a team of friends coming from different leads of life, we started MANTILITY with a mission (we call it “The MANTILITY movement”) in order to create an eclectic online silk scarves gallery that provides a platform of expression to artists and offers worldwide meticulously crafted scarves in accessible prices. We view our scarves as the noble messengers of silk, canvases for different artists to narrate stories and feelings. Wearing a MANTILITY scarf offers not only the unique touch of a 100% high quality silk artefact, but also brings you closer to the exclusive artistic expression of the designer providing pleasure through your senses. 

 

 

  • Partnerships with artists – We have already partnered with 11 both emerging as well as established artists from all over Greece to start this campaign. These are not just artists picked up randomly, but people we respect and value their work and share our MANTILITY values with. We offer them a platform of exhibiting their art and a way to monetize it. Each designer is rewarded either on a basis of a fixed contract or on % of sales based on their own decision. By reaching our stretch goals we will be adding new artists and new designs in our eclectic online scarf gallery (please see our stretch goals).
  • True quality – Greece has one of the longest and most important traditions in Sericulture and Silk processing in Europe. We have invested 2 years in testing different silk qualities, scarf dimensions, color differentiations, manufacturing/processing possibilities, packaging and labelling. Not only have we partnered with the leading silk goods producer in Greece (3rd generation family business) but we have also invested an important part of our (limited) budget to produce numerous scarf prototypes in all different designs in order to improve the final product to what we consider “true MANTILITY quality” (please also see FAQ for the list of high quality of raw materials used). 
  • Supply chain - Luxury brands usually markup their costs by a minimum of 400% due to middlemen and overhead expenses. Thanks to our direct-to-consumer approach, we skip the industry’s markups (wholesalers and distributors) and do our best to pass these savings to you. In addition, this helps us offer higher rewards to our partner designers in relation to industry standards. 
  • Customer experience – We have already mentioned that we believe in purchasing choices that make you feel good also on the long term. This is not only about the product but also about the whole customer journey. We will do whatever it takes for you to be completely satisfied with your whole customer experience, from communicating to shipping challenges to anything that comes up.

 

Every MANTILITY Scarf, after being twill-woven, printed, cut, washed and ironed, is machine and hand sewed in the traditional way.​

Please browse our MANTILITY GALLERY below, choose the design you like, support your favourite designer and become a MANTILITY Collector. Become a MANTILITY Dreamer!

 

For our Indiegogo supporters we have designed exclusive rewards packs; MANTILITY scarves with 20% - 40% discount before they are officially launched on the market. In addition, we offer unique MANTILITY perks related to experience like the illustration of your favorite lyrics on a single silk scarf!   

 

In MANTILITY we strongly believe that crowdfunding is a fair and democratic way of funding new ideas.  So, we kindly ask your support. We pledge for $19000 in order to start MANTILITY. These funds (besides bringing you value added products), will help us lower our cost production and enhance our capability for new designs and new product dimensions. As a result, this lower cost structure, will further improve our ability to reward and bring more artists into our movement.

 

If we are lucky enough to see our goal being overtaken by your support, we also have a bigger plan of enhancing our multidimensional & multicultural artistic collectivity by bringing more artists and more designs into our MANTILITY movement. Our stretch goals include a social project for empowering refugees through design co-creation and also a collective design project using the “Exquisite Corpse”, the Surrealist Drawing Game.

 

  

For us, this campaign is the first step for recreating “a new artistic worldwide silk road”. That will mean extending our MANTILITY movement and collaborating with artists all over the world offering a platform for expression, exposure and monetization to them and accessible luxury fashion items to our customers.

 

 

We aspire and try to:

  • create social value through an extroverted collective
  • become a medium of the accessible luxury movement
  • place design as an essential element of both products and processes
  • approach aesthetics as a way of life
  • be open, fair, honest, and authentic
  • have a good time
  • learn
  • get to know new talents

 

 

MANTILITY has been a major part of our life for more than two years, while also working in our full-time jobs to make it a reality. From the beginning of this incredible rollercoaster we realized that this was a massive challenging project. We wanted to offer a product that we would be proud of, a distinguished everyday fashion accessory, based on our MANTILITY values and authentic concept:  Exposure of new talented artists | artful and accessible luxury fashion. Eventually, Vassilliki quitted her (high security) job one year ago to support the project full time and thus make it possible for us to achieve this great outcome. 

 

Experience: Business architect in 2 successful design-based business ventures, 15 years project management experience

Education: Cultural Organisations Management MSc, Southeast European Studies MSc, Political Science Bachelor

Trivia: 36 years old, speaks 4 languages, design & art enthusiast, blog writer, travels globally to experience locally, marketing manager in TEDx local events.          

Summary: Academic in the field of business management (HRM, business strategy, entrepreneurship) with consulting experience. Always seeking interesting new ideas and business practices that can inspire people and organizations to change, evolve and create value.

 

 

 

 

 

 

We have made sure our suppliers are fully aware of our needs and quality standards and we have already produced numerous prototypes using different silk weaves, designs, colors and dimensions.  We understand though, that there is always a small risk of them being late to deliver in case of larger than expected orders.  

Another potential risk regards shipment worldwide. Shipping will be insured, but if anything happens to a shipment it will take us additional time to remake and re-ship the products.  In any case, we will be communicating frequently and openly with our backers regarding the manufacturing progress and shipping status. We will do an update every 1-2 weeks after the project is completed.

Finally, our “200 signed pieces per artwork” policy may also be a challenge during our campaign.  There is no mechanism of restricting the quantity of the designs through Indiegogo perks (only the whole perk!) so our backers in an extreme case may order more than 200 pieces of the same artwork in a very short time, before our team excludes the specific artwork from our perks. In that case we will prioritise orders based on timing and we will be communicating with the rest of our backers offering them either a change in the chosen artwork or a refund. 

 

Check our FAQ at the top of the page or send us an email to hello@mantility.com. We are more than happy to help!

story:
Why, hello there!


HI! My name is Brittani Bumb and I am a fashion designer on a serious mission... to change the world of fashion! Now, I know I am only one person, but I am out to make as big of a positive impact in this industry as I can. As Wangari Maatha said, "I will be a humming bird; I will do the best I can."

I am an extremely dedicated gal who is doing everything I can to bring Transparency & Sustainability to my freelance business (which I hope to one day make into a full-fledged business, fingers crossed!) Currently, I work heavily in Upcycled fashion, i.e. I take used garments that have been cast aside for various reasons and I bring new life to them. Everything deserves a second chance, especially our clothing!

I have been presented with an amazing opportunity to travel to Costa Rica to learn more about Ethical Fashion and Artisan craftsmanship. This is super exciting for a lot of reasons, one being that I've never even had the chance to travel outside the United States!


Funding Break Down

You might be asking, "Where is my money going?" Well, here is the breakdown:

$750-- Cost of transportation while in Costa Rica, Breakfast for a week, & Workshops with the local Artisans

$400-500-- Cost of Airfare (if I get it quick!)

$350-- Housing

$400-- Dinner for the week, Exploring the nearby Cities, extra activities, fees, etc.

The Impact

By going on this trip, I hope to come back with a greater knowledge of how our fast fashion mindset effects the dying art brought to us by artisans around the world. I hope to learn about even MORE ways I can implement sustainable practices into my business by way of natural dyes, hand weaving, and Ethical sourcing practices. We even get the chance to give back to the community at the end of our trip! By allowing me to travel all the way to Costa Rica, my impact in this crazy, fast paced industry will be even bigger than it currently is.

Risks & Challenges

There are always challenges that need to be overcome in a venture like this. Of course, by going against the beaten path, I am already being met with obstacles. I just realized recently that  not many people know about Ethical or Sustainable fashion! Just getting the word out that I am a supporter of both Ethical and Sustainable Fashion has been a challenge, but one that I have absolutely loved tackling! I really enjoy informing people of what it is I do and how it helps the world in the long run. Information goes a long way and if I can show just one person what it is I am doing and how it helps the world, then I am happy. Especially since fashion design is generally met with negativity & criticism for its impact socially and economically.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not every one can donate, but if you can spread the word, I'd be so so appreciative! Like I said, information goes a long way and if I can inspire you to pass this on, maybe we can help in making a difference together! Thanks so much for your time :)
