Contact us with if you have any questions!(a) Charming Chevron + Cleopatra's Treasure(b) Charming Chevron + Circles of Repletion(c) Charming Chevron + Oval Ornaments(d) Charming Chevron + Terrific Trapezoids(e) Charming Chevron + Tempting Triangles 5) Contessa Swansonia IISecond verse, same as the first! This second part of the $50 range is just as easy as the first part; Just match a Petite Dome cuff to any one of five pairs of earrings!(a) Petite Dome + Cleopatra's Treasure(b) Petite Dome + Circles of Repletion(c) Petite Dome + Oval Ornaments(d) Petite Dome + Terrific Trapezoids(e) Petite Dome + Tempting Triangles 6) "Duchess Swantastic"The next three sets of earrings, below, are in the $85 range: (a) Lemon Drops!What could be more fun?There is one downside though; This is the ONLY pair! Better order now! (b) Spiny Oyster Shell!This is the only pair of these as well (c) Tiger-Eye and Sea FoamOnly one pair of these exists, also Next Up:7) "Princess Swan Lake I" Any pair of earrings in this collection may be had for only $125:(a) Genuine Kingman Turquoise in a Fire Patina with Fine Silver bezel and Bronze FiligreeThis is the only pair; when they're gone, they're gone! (b) Genuine Kingman Turquoise with Fine Silver bezel and Bronze Shell motifHere too, we have the only pair in existence; she who hesitates, has no earrings! (c) Genuine Kingman Turquoise with Fine Silver bezel and Bronze Leaf motifYou guessed it! This is the only pair! (d) Genuine Kingman Turquoise in Fire Patina with Fine Silver bezel and Bronze Shell motifOne pair only (e) "Spinners" - Genuine Kingman Turquoise in dark patina with Fine Silver bezelthe only one of its kind  Princess Swan Lake IIThe second half of our "Princess Swan Lake" Collection: Any pair of earrings here, may also be had for only $125:(a) Genuine Kingman Turquoise in dark patina with Fine Silver bezel and twin-leaf motifthere's only one pair (b) "Trapezoids"; Genuine Kingman turquoise with Fine Silver bezel and bronze filigreeone pair only (c) "Drops"; Genuine Kingman turquoise with Fine Silver bezel and bronze filigreein the end there can be only one! (d) "Ovals"; Genuine Kingman turquoise with Fine Silver bezel and bronze leaf motifyet another "singularity" (e) "Diamond"-shaped (please note, there are NO actual diamonds in this piece!), dark patina with bronze filigreeOne pair only And that, my friends, closes out both of our "Princess Swan Lake" collections.Also, please note, NO Princesses were harmed in the making of this jewelry!So... happy so far? Then let's step boldly into our next category which is the lovely 8) Empress SwanAll five pieces in this category may be had for a mere $250 each(There is only one of each) (a) An austere bronze band with Kentucky agate, fine silver bezel and copper twist detail (b) "Anticlastic" cuff with Kentucky agate, copper bezel (c) Dark patina, heavy rope twist and Kentucky agate (d) Genuine Kingman turquoise with bronze leaf motif (e) Bold, dark patina, heavy braid boarder, triangular Kentucky agate  9) Regnate Magnus Imperium
Our "Legacy" pieces. Each piece is one-of-a-kind and can be added to your collection for only $500 (a) Massive marbleized "blood" Kentucky agate on a super-comfy "anticlastic" bronze cuff.Sure to impress! (b) Our super-gnarly "hedgerow" braid with Kentucky agate and ornate leaf detaila bold piece that clearly speaks for itself! (c) "Gold-on-Gold", our signature "Nutmeg" patina on bronze with "Golden" Kentucky agate! A born winner! (d) Genuine Kingman turquoise on bronze with attractive leaf motiffrom the last turquoise mine in America! (e) A Triple Treat! Three matched stones; Kentucky Agate; on a gracefully tapered braceletThree times the fun! Now, you may be thinking: "Why is there only one of each piece? You guys are artisans! Can't you make more?"Yes, of course we can make more. But the nature (and some would say "the charm") of handmade pieces is that they are never exactly duplicatable; there will never be pieces of turquoise ( or Kentucky Agate) exactly like these pieces, and we'll never do metal work that exactly duplicates these pieces.With that in mind, if you've seen a piece anywhere on our IGG page that you like, and you think you'd like something similar, please contact us via email. We'll do our best to fulfill your wish. Thanks! 10) Design your own piece with us, online:
$1500An online consultation and design session hosted by Nora in which you can design your own piece! After your online session ends, we will proceed apace with the final layout and drawings which we will submit, within the next several weeks, for your approval. Pending approval, we'll begin work on the piece that you designed, and ship it to you ASAP!   11) Super Fan/Super Tour!*
Eleven! That's one more!$5000Meet Nora and Dale! Tour our studio and grounds. Enjoy a home cooked, gourmet meal with us!AND help design your own original art-piece which will be signed by us and shipped, free of charge, to you when it's finished.A photo of this fabulous piece will be displayed forever on our website along withYOUR portrait listing you as a "Designer" for Nora Swanson Arts!AND, when you're all done, enjoy a relaxing night's sleep at the historic Boone Tavern. We'll even tuck you in!Travel extra.*(Why is the Super Fan/Super Tour not available until December? For a very simple and good reason: When our IGG campaign ends, we will be scrambling madly to fill orders and make any additional items needed. As soon as that's done, the Art Show Season begins. We will then be traveling, five days a week, to Art Shows around the eastern half of the country, On the two days that we're home, we're either unloading the truck, making more pieces to sell, or loading the truck and preparing to leave for the next Art Show. That doesn't leave us a lot of time for entertaining and in any case, we wouldn't be much fun! The Art Show season ends in late November and then we'll have time to tidy up a bit and prepare to receive visitors! So, that's why we can't have you over until December. Sorry! On the plus side, winters are generally mild here and you can enjoy our fantastic wood-stove while we tour the studio and design your jewelry! We'll buy the beer! That's not so bad, eh?) EXTRA! EXTRA! NEW PERK ARRIVES TODAY! 12) Metal 'n' Stone*$350Our large-sized HEAVY hand-tooled "Fugly" bracelet, matched with our banded cuff/banded stone bracelet. The perfect his'n'her combo for any occasion!*Limited Edition   So, what else is new?Sometimes, we get asked, "Besides making jewelry, what else do you do?"We're glad you asked! Check out the video below to find out a bit more about us. This clip will give you more of a feel for our operation and how we like to do things. We're "old school"; smokin' hot metal and big hammers! We're definitely not building smart watches!If you like our work, you can click the BACK IT button at the top-right of the page to donate any amount for no perk.Oh! And the next video is a bit further down the page. Thanks!   Where does the money go?In our case, that's relatively easy to answer:A big chunk of our monthly expenses go to studio overhead including,

The mortgage: we own the studio, so someday, we'll be done paying for it! But for now, we have to keep paying or the bank won't let us use it anymore!

Utilities: Water and electricity; We heat with wood, but we use a lot of electricity for lighting; fans; (you need exhaust fans when you're welding and soldering so you don't poison yourself with the fumes!), power tools - drills, sanders, grinders and so on; the welder uses a lot of electricity; all of the jewelry gets washed thoroughly, multiple times - that uses a lot of water.

Raw materials: copper, bronze, silver, stones, wood

Expendables: solder, flux, welding rod, welding gas (argon), acetylene, sandpaper, glue, grinding wheels, cutting wheels, drill bits

Depreciation on tools: The major tools; the welder, the drill-press and other expensive items all wear out eventually, and so do pliers and sheers and files and angle-grinders and saws. Hammers never wear out, for some reason. "Depreciation" means you're setting aside a portion of the value of that tool over time, so when it comes time to buy a new one, you have the money.
The rest goes to:
Paying our part time helpers
Paying ourselves
We run a pretty tight ship here. Our "new" truck is five years old. We do nearly all of the maintenance on it ourselves. We cut and split wood rather than use gas or electricity for heat. "Wood warms you twice", remember! We cool the studio in the summer, using an ingenious device that I invented (without cooling, the studio interior reaches 120 degrees Fahrenheit in the summer!). That will be subject for a another crowdfunding campaign in the near future. Yeah, I know that's a tease! Deal with it! Or donate a buck and get on our mailing list!Picking up an extra $5000 for a shed is not going to be easy, but with your help, we can do it!  Stretch Goals:Assuming we exceed the goal set out for this campaign and we get a shed installed and we make more working room in our studio, the next step, which is our first "stretch goal", is to acquire a "brake". A brake is a sturdy, precision machine that will allow us to make accurate bends on large pieces of metal very quickly. A brake of the design we need to do the work we want to do costs about $9000; delivered and set up.Currently, we can do this type of bending by hammering, but hammering is a very slow and tedious process and extremely prone to error. With a brake, as long as one makes accurate measurements, the bending is nearly foolproof! This will speed up production; allowing most bending jobs to be done in minutes rather than days. This will allow us to greatly reduce costs (not to mention saving a lot of wear and tear on our many-decades-old wrists and elbows!). That's our first "stretch goal" for this campaign, and if we don't quite get there, we'll start a new campaign with new perks very soon. So, if we hit $14,000 that gets us a brake, and we've nearly reached another of our goals of being able to produce large wall-art pieces entirely "in-house". Ambitious? Yes! "Fortune favors the bold"; No one ever achieved a big, hairy audacious goal by staying home hiding under their bed! The third element, and our second "stretch goal" -- on the road to producing larger pieces in-house -- is a "cabinet table saw". A "cabinet table saw", which we will refer to as simply a "table saw" hereinafter, is a highly precise, large table saw used for making extremely accurate cuts in wood. Currently, we use a hand-saw with a guide; a method that is, again, very slow and prone to error. A table saw allows us to be quick and accurate -- speeding up the work and allowing us to make better art.A table saw adequate for our needs, delivered and set up, is about $5000. So, if we reach $19,000 we're adding the table saw to the mix and we're able to create the larger pieces we want to create. Again, everyone who contributes to this campaign is on the list to be notified when our larger art-pieces are begun.Don't forget to ask about our "Hidden Perk"! If you like our work, please back our project

story:
THE PROBLEM

You probably know about the dangers of ultraviolet (UV) light, but have you heard of blue light?

Where does Blue Light come from?

Blue light is ever-present in your environment – both outdoors and indoors. It is naturally produced by the sun, dispensed from fluorescent light bulbs and emitted by LEDs present in digital devices such as computer screens, tablets and smartphones.

What is Blue Light?

Blue light is part of visible light and close to UV on the light spectrum, comprising of wavelengths that range from 400 nm to 500 nm.

 

How can Blue Light harm you?

Our naked eyes are not designed for exposure to artificial blue light emitted from digital devices, since short-wavelength, high-energy blue light penetrates all the way into the retina. Excessive exposure to blue light can have adverse effects on our eye health, leading to side effects such as eyestrain, headaches and difficulty in sleeping; and its cumulative effect can cause damage to the retina.

 

Click on the link below to find out more about the harmful effects of blue light:

http://www.health.harvard.edu/staying-healthy/blue-light-has-a-dark-side

https://thevisioncouncil.org/content/blue-light-exposure-and-digital-eye-strain/adults

http://edition.cnn.com/2014/02/03/health/digital-eyestrain/

 

THE SOLUTION

BLUE LIGHT FILTER TECHNOLOGY

EXYRA glasses are specially designed to optimize vision when viewing content on digital screens. The precision-engineered EXYRA lenses absorb and reflect the high-energy bIue light that can otherwise strain your eyes. EXYRA lenses are made of an in-monomer material that blocks harmful blue and ultraviolet light. Since the material itself blocks blue light, the lens retains the property whenever it is in use. The lens also allows the healthier blue-turquoise light in, which helps in proper color perception and wakefulness.

ANTI-FATIGUE

Our eyes are not designed to stare at things up-close for long hours. Even if your normal vision does not require correction for everyday tasks, you may find that long hours spent viewing a computer screen can cause considerable eye fatigue. When staring at closer objects, the ciliary muscle in our eye spasms back and forth to adjust. This strains the eye and makes it tired. Our lenses increase the magnification of our sight, ensuring the ciliary muscle does not overwork. The concept behind the lens is not to add magnification (although a slightly enlarged image is presented), but to move the eye’s focal point closer without using the eye muscles for accommodation.

 

EXYRA Lens features:

  • Innovative Blue Light filter technology
  • UV++ protection
  • Increased visual contrast
  • Anti-fatigue
  • Anti-reflection
  • Anti-scratch

CLEAR LENSES AND STYLISH FRAME

We understand that your look, your style and what it says about you is an important part of your personal image. We have created a stylish brand for computer glasses, featuring clear lenses and beautifully designed frames. EXYRA glasses allow you to enjoy benefits such as less eyestrain, enhanced color contrast and better performance while working on your computer – all the while looking good doing it.

EXYRA LENS PERFORMANCE

Our lenses block almost 70% of harmful light on the spectrum of 380-440 nm.

Table of Wavelength (nm) vs Sample Transmission Data (%T)

EXYRA Glasses put to the test

In the following video, test was conducted with 405 nm blue light laser. And you can see how effective EXYRA lenses blocking blue light in comparisson to a normal lenses.

 

FRAME DESIGN

To add to the elegance of our  designs, we have handcrafted our frames with premium acetate and stainless steel hinges.  Currently, we have a collection of frames to accommodate different face shapes and different color selections to cater to your personal tastes.

Click Here For More Color Choices

www.exyraeyewear.com

 

Our want is to Meet Your Need

We want to reach out to as many people as we can, to create an informed awareness about our great product. Please share our story and our vision with the world. Your support will ensure that more and more people become conscious of the dangers of blue light and the incredible health benefits they can gain from the use of EXYRA glasses

And as an added bonus any backer who shares this project will receive Stylish EXYRA case! Thank you in advance! Click the share button at the top of the page! (then message us to let us know you have shared).

EXYRA Glasses case

Protect your pair with this stylish hard case.

  • Premium material.
  • Foldable, Hardcase.
  • Fits a different size of glasses.

HOW WILL THE FUNDS BE USED?

Every dollar goes into manufacturing and distribution

The funds from this campaign will go towards manufacturing and distribution costs. We have covered most of the initial costs of setting up the business including website hosting and product development. Further dollar funds will be directed towards the production process.

                   

We will keep you informed of the progress for the entire duration and provide detailed updates of where we are in the time frame. 

 

                                 Return Policy

We know that you will not have the chance to experience EXYRA glasses before your pledge. However, we are confident that our lens technology will make all the difference to your digital experience. In good faith, we offer 100% money-back guarantee against our products. Very simply, if for some reason the product does not meet your expectations, the glasses can be returned within a 30-day period.

Available now in non-prescription and prescription

Yes you can add prescription to your glasses, but at this early stage we can only offer Single Vision lenses correction for nearsightedness or farsightedness glasses, in power range from +6.00 to -8.00.  We need to charge for this separately. Special offer just AU$40! 

THE IDEA FOR EXYRA

My previous job involved intensive engineering design and modeling, which entailed staring at my computer screen for 10 hours or more in a typical workday. By the end of the day, my eyes would be sore and strained, occasionally accompanied by a blistering headache. Many of my colleagues suffered a similar experience on a frequent basis, as their jobs also involved prolonged computer use. 

I began researching the stress on my eyes, and I learned that digital eyestrain was a condition and not just an inherent part of day-to-day life. An extended study revealed that these complaints were linked to prolonged exposure to blue light, which is emitted from sources such as the screen of a digital device and artificial lighting.

There are glasses that are designed to reduce digital eyestrain during screen use, but current glasses in the market are plain and unattractive. With their yellow-orange tinted lenses and unappealing design, I was not comfortable wearing them in public or in an office environment. I came to realize the niche potential in this area; a concept that would allow countless people to moderate the effect of screen use on their eyes through a pair of affordable, stylish computer glasses. The EXYRA concept was born.

Our Vision

Our main focus is to create awareness of the consequences of an exponentially increasing exposure to digital screens on our eye health – and provide a solution to mitigate the impact. We specifically focus on blue light emissions from digital devices; and offer a product that does not compromise one’s daily professional look. We make beautiful, handcrafted acetate glasses to help you do what you do better, and look great while doing it.

But we are more than that. We are a network of smart, talented professionals who understand the need for connectivity and cooperation. We are fashion-voguish, digital warriors who design, finance and develop awesome concepts. We are a community of technology users who desire to build innovative products and services of tomorrow.

Our Want is to Meet Your Need 

We want to reach out to as many people as we can to create an informed awareness about our great product. Please share our story and our vision with the world. Your support will ensure that more and more people become conscious of the dangers of blue light and the incredible health benefits they can gain from the use of EXYRA glasses

And as an added bonus any backer who shares this project will receive lens cleaner spray! Thank you in advance! Click the share button at the top of the page! (then message us to let us know you have shared).

Risks and challenges

Countless hours of design, development, prototypes, samples, testing and the completion of the product are all behind us. Through this intensive process, we have reduced many risks and potential issues regarding product quality and reliability. Now EXYRA glasses are much more than a great idea!

The next step is to take EXYRA to the market, but producing eyeglasses are expensive. Even costlier is the acetate material used to create attractive frames and high-quality lenses with a blue light filter. Our main challenge is raising the funds up front for setting up production, shipping and holding inventories. As a small business, it is incredibly challenging to access the required funding. That is why we are asking you to contribute in any way you can. In addition, by getting in early and helping us out, we have some great rewards for you!

story:
Remain Inspired, Stimulate your Talent!

That is our core message to you. At some point in our lives, we all need a little push - that little reminder that we are more than capable of accomplishing so many great things and successfully pursuing and realizing our goals. That's precisely the raison d’etre of RistBandz. Our wristbands (and all future products) are here to reaffirm what you already know about yourself - that you are indeed capable of anything.

Every time you wear one of our wristbands, the printed message instantly reminds you to go out and do something awesome, not only for yourself but for others as well. That was the spark behind our slogan, "More Than Just a Wristband." Our mission is to be a constant source of affirmation, inspiration, and motivation for others. That's why we're inviting you to flex your R.I.S.T. - Remain Inspired and Stimulate your Talent.

 

 

We launched RistBandz only a few short months ago - 5 months to be precise. Those last few months have been a great learning experience for us in terms of what we're trying to achieve. The feedback has been excellent and the people who have come across our wristbands really love them.

We're humbled by all the positive responses and believe this is the perfect opportunity for us to continue growing. 

But we'd love to do that as a team - with you. We would love for you to be a part of this process and look forward to building something great together. 

We're currently undertaking a new reconstructive phase as a brand.

The purpose of this campaign is to help us expand our reach, increase our catalog of wristbands and redesign our platforms in such a manner that we can continue to serve you with more Inspirational and Motivational content for years to come.

Please read on to Learn about our Stories and how we plan on truly serving you.

 

 

Our wristbands are not meant to only decorate your wrists but also elevate your mindset.

The current set of designs are based on a few of the messages that have inspired us up until this point and continue to remain the driving force behind everything we seek to accomplish as a motivational & inspirational brand.

 We believe you can relate to them too. Choose a wristband that speaks directly to who you are and rock it with pride!

We're also proud to introduce our first line of apparel currently exclusive only to our campaign backers.

Holding true to our brand statement and our values, we designed the "ME" t-shirt and the "BE DFFRNT" sweatshirt with you in mind - stark reminders that inspiration comes from within and what makes you different makes you unique.

Represent yourself like no one else would.

ALL OUR PERKS INCLUDE FREE SHIPPING WITHIN THE U.S (EXCLUSIVE ONLY TO OUR INDIEGOGO BACKERS)

 

As we mentioned in the purpose section, the goal of this campaign is to continue growing this brand so we can continue to inspire you and others for years to come.

For us to successfully accomplish that goal we need to take into account our costs of operations and other administrative fees. The funds we receive from this campaign will help us alleviate some of those fees while we continue to ensure you get a quality product.

Here's summary on how we plan on using the funds:

  • Manufacturing/Growing our product inventory
  • Shipping & Delivery
  • Future Marketing campaigns
  •  Cost of operations (Business, Legal & Administrative)
  • Developing and expanding our content & product distribution channels

We also want to make you aware that our campaign will run for 30 days (Feb-March). Production will begin immediately after we receive the funds. Our estimated shipping date for all the products is early April. However if all runs smoothly, shipping might begin sooner than that. (Please also refer to our Risk & Challenges section further down the page.)

 

We plan on using this platform and our campaign as the launching pad to build our community. 

A community that includes you, us and other driven individuals out there who know they have a bigger purpose in life and are ready to take on any challenges that come their way.

A community that not only inspires one another but one that also helps you realize that despite whatever internal struggles you may be facing right now, deep down, you have the driving force within yourself to manifest your goals.

That's why we need your help.

We have a vision and big plans for the future but none of that will be possible without you. We're humbled and beyond blessed to even have this opportunity before us but we know we couldn't have made it this far without the help we got from others.

So we kindly ask that you help support our campaign. Pick a wristband, a t-shirt, a sweatshirt or any other perk you see fit for you as we strive together to build a community that will make a difference - one wristband at a time.

 

We've already worked with our manufacturers to ensure the highest quality products. These manufacturers have decades of experience. We are also fully prepared to carry out the entire project successfully and deliver all the products on time.

We already have systems in place and a small but excellent team ready in place to ensure everything runs smoothly.

We've already created a small sample size of our products available on our site (yet to officially re-launch) and tested all our shipping models to make sure everything is intact. 

That said, sometimes unforeseen events might occur during the manufacturing process. As you may understand, these might be circumstances out of our control. Even if it is only minimal there are certain common factors that might cause a slight delay. However, we promise to send you updates at every step throughout the process so you remain fully informed till your items get to you.

 

We'd obviously love for you to support our campaign. But we'd also appreciate it if you help us spread the word. We'd love it if you told even just one person about our campaign and how to support us.

Stay in touch with us on the socials as well.

EMAIL: info@ristbandz.com

INSTAGRAM: www.instagram.com/ristbandz

FACEBOOK: www.facebook.com/ristbandz 

 

Finally, we want to say Thank You. First to everyone who has supported us up until this point. The feedback, the critiques, the shoulders to cry on and the positive words of reinforcement were very timely and necessary. We are truly humbled.

Last but definitely not least, we want to Thank all our Indiegogo backers, i.e You. None of this is possible without your support. We are grateful to have you as a part of this campaign and even better as a part of the RistBandz community.

Thank you so much for your support.

#morethanjustawristband
story_txt:
Remain Inspired, Stimulate your Talent!
That is our core message to you. At some point in our lives, we all need a little push - that little reminder that we are more than capable of accomplishing so many great things and successfully pursuing and realizing our goals. That's precisely the raison d’etre of RistBandz. Our wristbands (and all future products) are here to reaffirm what you already know about yourself - that you are indeed capable of anything.
Every time you wear one of our wristbands, the printed message instantly reminds you to go out and do something awesome, not only for yourself but for others as well. That was the spark behind our slogan, "More Than Just a Wristband." Our mission is to be a constant source of affirmation, inspiration, and motivation for others. That's why we're inviting you to flex your R.I.S.T. - Remain Inspired and Stimulate your Talent.
 

 
We launched RistBandz only a few short months ago - 5 months to be precise. Those last few months have been a great learning experience for us in terms of what we're trying to achieve. The feedback has been excellent and the people who have come across our wristbands really love them.
We're humbled by all the positive responses and believe this is the perfect opportunity for us to continue growing. 
But we'd love to do that as a team - with you. We would love for you to be a part of this process and look forward to building something great together. 
We're currently undertaking a new reconstructive phase as a brand.
The purpose of this campaign is to help us expand our reach, increase our catalog of wristbands and redesign our platforms in such a manner that we can continue to serve you with more Inspirational and Motivational content for years to come.
Please read on to Learn about our Stories and how we plan on truly serving you.
 

 






Our wristbands are not meant to only decorate your wrists but also elevate your mindset.
The current set of designs are based on a few of the messages that have inspired us up until this point and continue to remain the driving force behind everything we seek to accomplish as a motivational & inspirational brand.
 We believe you can relate to them too. Choose a wristband that speaks directly to who you are and rock it with pride!






We're also proud to introduce our first line of apparel currently exclusive only to our campaign backers.
Holding true to our brand statement and our values, we designed the "ME" t-shirt and the "BE DFFRNT" sweatshirt with you in mind - stark reminders that inspiration comes from within and what makes you different makes you unique.
Represent yourself like no one else would.


ALL OUR PERKS INCLUDE FREE SHIPPING WITHIN THE U.S (EXCLUSIVE ONLY TO OUR INDIEGOGO BACKERS)

story:
Do you hate sorting and folding socks?  Me too!

My name is Jacob Dietle. I’m 14 years old, and this is the story about my new company, Snapz USA, which is bringing my designs to life.

I’m going to tell you about how I solved an age-old problem, how we’re going to benefit disadvantaged kids, how we’re launching this product at one of America's most famous retailers this holiday season, and how you can help, including how you can be part of my Advisory Board and meet all kinds of interesting entrepreneurs.

 

Sorting socks sucks!

Doing laundry is one of my weekly chores and most definitely my least favorite part is sorting socks. You put socks in the washing machine, then the dryer, then you have a big pile of socks to sort through and attempt to match them. Of course, it almost always turns out that the Sock Zombies have stolen one or two socks so you’re left with extras.

Back to sorting... Colors have to match. Patterns have to match. It takes a long time and is about the most boring, biggest waste of time I can think of.

I spend twenty minutes folding jeans, shirts and underwear, and then it takes me two or three times longer to sort and fold the socks.

Sorting socks sucks! Don’t you agree?

 

This is Snapz.

It’s bad enough with just my socks, but I have two brothers. That’s a lot of socks every week. So I figured there must be a better way to deal with this sock thing. If I could just figure out a way to keep the socks together while being washed and dried, afterwards, they would already be sorted and ready to put in the dresser.

I tried multiple ways of keepings socks together: safety pins, chip clips, paper clips, folding, rubber bands, but nothing worked.

Then it hit me: if I could find a small, super strong means to snap them together, I could just take them off, snap them together, toss in the wash, put in the drier, then ---viola!---they’d already be connected and ready to be put back in the drawer.

I told my Mom about my idea and she said we needed to talk to her friend Bill Townsend who is an entrepreneur and chairman of Amati Foundation, a nonprofit focused on helping young people. Bill’s companies have sold for over $7 billion so I trusted that he knew what he was doing when it came to launching a product. Bill loved my idea and said that if I wanted to start a company around it, he and my Mom would help guide me. I thought this was a great idea: after all, who says a 14 year old can’t start a company, especially if I get good advisors?  I’ll tell you about these advisors in a bit.


For now, let me tell you about Snapz!

I like to design things in an effort to make them better. I began learning about sock manufacturing. I worked with manufacturers around the world until I found one that could make what I believe to be the best feeling socks available. Then I worked with YKK, the famous American zipper and snap company to create the specialized snaps that hold my socks together. I got samples made, then we tested them, then we made changes, then we tested them again, until finally we had socks that we loved.

As you saw in my video, most socks are made of cotton, rubber and polyester which is cheap but doesn’t help with odor or wicking moisture away. I figured if I’m going to design socks and start a company around them, I don’t just want to make socks like everyone else; I want to make socks better.

I sought a way to make socks that would perform well but have environmental
benefits, too.  They have to be comfortable, long lasting, and whether they are dress socks or athletic socks, they have to control odor. Then I learned about bamboo and its anti-odor properties. I learned that viscose bamboo, when made from hard bamboo stalks, creates a cozy fiber that is soft and warm, yet helps wick moisture away, keeping your feet dry. Viscose bamboo material has a soft and buttery feel and can absorb 3-4 times as much moisture as cotton. That means less odor. This is what makes bamboo perfect for socks.

Bamboo has a lot of other benefits so I decided that my socks had to have bamboo in them and when we got the test samples in, my hunch proved right. These socks are really, really comfortable! Plus, at the end of the day, you don’t have to worry about taking your shoes off and your socks stinking like they would if only made from cotton.

Did you know that bamboo is ecologically friendly to our planet? 

  1. Bamboo requires no irrigation to grow because it thrives under natural rainfall.
  2. A stand of bamboo creates 35% more oxygen than an equivalent stand of trees while absorbing 5 times the greenhouse gases.
  3. It requires no chemical pesticides or fertilizers to grow because it naturally fights pests and lives great in many different natural settings, growing up to 47 inches in a single day once mature.
  4. Bamboo does not need replanted after harvest because, unlike trees, bamboo will regrow right from the cut.
  5. Due to the fact that bamboo roots stay in the ground when cut, it protects the soil from erosion and keeps it nutrient rich.

Bamboo is a marvelous green alternative to help preserve the environment!


Giving back to Americans in need.

We can all agree the environment is important, and most companies would say that sourcing bamboo is a good enough way to give back. But I don’t want Snapz USA to be “good enough;” I want it to be “exceptional!”

I thought if I could do something to help other kids, this would be even more fun to do and something my friends would want to help me build.

You know, lots of kids don’t have the basic necessities of a good pair of socks.

I learned this from talking to children’s charities. Something as simple as a pair of socks can make a difference in a disadvantaged kid’s life.

That is why I created the “Buy 3, Donate 1” program for Snaps USA. When consumers purchase a 3-pack of Snaps, whether in a retail store or online, they're not only getting a great sock that solves the whole sorting and folding mess, but they're helping put new socks on the feet of kids that may be economically disadvantaged, living in a homeless shelter, or just struggling to be able to put well-made clothes on their bodies. For every 3-pack sold, Snaps USA will donate another pair to disadvantaged kids.

Next, because I also love music, I decided to give 5% of the company profits to Amati Foundation so that can continue buying musical instruments for kids who can’t afford them. In return, they agreed to underwrite all our corporate entity formation. Amati Foundation doesn't buy crummy musical instruments for their recipients, they get really good instruments that young people can use from school to college and into their careers. By supporting them, we can help thousands of kids gain access to music education which has been proven to help with cognitive ability.

It's like we're creating "warm feet, warm minds" and I can picture it now…a kid dancing around the room in their Snaps socks while playing violin. It will be like Tom Cruise’s underwear dance in Risky Business, but with a Bach Serenade instead of Bob Seger!


A big launch for the holidays!

This campaign isn’t about a concept. The product is finished. It works great. It’s ready to go to market. I just need your help to get it there.

Snapz socks have been tested through over 500 washings in both household and industrial washers and driers. They are proven to work. Now they are ready to be manufactured. Best of all, I have a great partner whom we intend to launch with for the 2013 holiday season…the world famous retailer Fred Segal.

Fred Segal is an upscale Los Angeles, California based clothing retailer with two stores in Hollywood and Santa Monica. It has a long history of being ahead of trends: in 1960, Mr. Segal opened the world’s first jeans-only store. It grew to include other clothing, footwear and now restaurants and is expanding to Japan and Las Vegas.  They’ve been featured in many TV shows and movies including Entourage, Legally
Blonde, The L Word, White Oleander, Beverly Hills 90210, Dawson’s Creek, Clueless, Maid To Order, and Less Than Zero. Even the singer Pink has referenced Fred Segal in her songs.

I’m also meeting with major retailers to get them to sell Snapz after the launch at Fred Segal and envision selling these socks at places like Amazon.com, Sak’s, Barney’s, Macy’s, Kohl's, Target, Men’s Warehouse, JC Penney and specialty retailers around the world.

The more retailers we line up, the better, because my goal is that by the time I graduate high school, Snaps USA will have donated 1,000,000 pairs of socks to needy kids.


Why Snapz is on Indiegogo.

Bill and Mom recommended I put together a group of advisors to guide my business. They said I needed to find people who could pitch in with their time and talents to help me grow this. I agreed.

One of the things we discussed was how we would fund the company. My Mom and Bill paid for the start-up costs to get to this point. Bill likes his socks so much he offered to fund the whole company, but we discussed the value of earning and protecting the lessons that come with and are needed in making a company succeed. That’s when I realized I wouldn’t learn anything if he just wrote a check for $100,000. I wanted to learn what it was like to be an entrepreneur and part of that is learning how to raise funds to launch this product.

This campaign will give Snaps USA the funding required to go from samples to full scale production, including ordering materials, manufacturing, hiring salespeople, filing more patents, launching an e-commerce website, bringing Snapz to the masses and beginning to design more great products.

I picked Indiegogo because I like the concept of people pitching in to help create something in the fashion space, and with Snapz, when you pitch in, you not only help me launch the company, but you support our efforts to provide socks to disadvantaged children and musical instruments to deserving kids.


You can help me reach these goals.

We need $64,000 to ramp up production and go to market. My advisors said if we raise $100,000 or more via this campaign, they will contribute another $100,000 for new products. What a great challenge!

But right now, I need your help to raise $64,000 to get our first shipments done and start selling through Fred Segal and online. And if we hit $100,000, that's all the better!


Snapz advisors.

I have a great group of advisors that I have to tell you about.

First is the most important person in my life, my Mom, Lisa Lane Dietle. She’s an amazing woman! I got my desire to help others from her. She received a service award by Dependency Court Los Angeles, CA for her public service and is always looking for ways to help others. She has worked for P&G, Jockey, and started Agent of Change where she works with companies like Hillsides, Crystals Garment, Leland Zales, Chrislie Formulations. Mom is my rock and foundation and is always encouraging me to think big.

Bill Townsend is an entrepreneur, author, and, tech and advertising veteran. He has been involved in launching or managing some of the biggest names in the Internet including Lycos, GeoCities (now Yahoo!), Deja.com (now ebay and Google), and Newegg.com. He knows a lot about attracting customers, having been involved in several successful products including P90X, Tony Horton’s Ten Minute Trainer, TurboJam, Insanity, TeamBeachbody, Jeunesse Global, Carbonixx, GoCards, and Beyond The Wall retail stores.  He also has lots of experience in working in
Europe and Asia. Bill knows technology and the Internet so he’s going to be of great
help as we move into e-commerce and social media.

Shelley Sarmiento is the founder of Little White Fashion Truck which brings unique and different clothing products to consumers through her fleet of, you guessed it, little white fashion trucks which are marketed exclusively through social media. She was cofounder of the 103-store chain White House/Black Market, which was sold to the leading women’s retailer Chico’s. She also teaches at the Fashion Institute of Technology and is full of great ideas!

Brian Kelner is a veteran of the fashion and accessories industry.  For over 20 years he has been a sales representative for companies like Christian Dior men’s hosiery (or socks, as I call them), Isotoner gloves and slippers, and Docker/Levi small leather goods.  He is president of Kelner Merchandising Network (KMN), and Solebury  Software. KMN is a national third party store service company, specializing in men's and ladies accessories and furnishings, and Solebury Software is a Software as a Service (SAAS) company specializing in scheduling and reporting for Field Service Organizations. Brian knows more about the Department Store and Specialty Store channels of retail distribution than almost anybody in America so I’m really happy to have him be part of this.

Overseeing our budget---and your donation---is Katrina Yao, who is Sr. Director of Finance at the #2 pure play online retailer Newegg.com. She is a Certified Public Accountant and Certified Internal Auditor and will oversee finance and auditing at Snaps USA.  (by the way, Katrina has a son who also hates sorting socks.)

Can you believe a 14 year old has gotten such a great group of people together to help make this a success? You know what the secret is? I told them about the product and asked them to help. Brian said, "I can't believe I didn't think of this!" and Shelley said it was "brilliant!" I am very thankful for their help and expertise.


This is just the start.

So there you have it: the story of Snaps and how I went from 40 minutes of sock sorting to less than 5 minutes while creating a great feeling, long-lasting product that helps the environment while also helping clothe and support disadvantaged kids.

Now it is up to you. Please consider supporting my project and product. I think it’s a winner and by helping, you can be among the first to have the pleasure of wearing and washing---and not having to sort---Snapz.

You can help me promote this project, too. Will you please put a link to this campaign on your Facebook page or tweet it on Twitter.  Just paste this url:   http://igg.me/at/snapzsocks

Give Snaps a try. I thank you, our ecosystem thanks you, and tens of thousands of kids will thank you, too.

-- Jacob

 

 

 T H A N K   Y O U  ! ! !

 

 



*Terms and Conditions. If you are receiving a pair or pairs of Snapz socks through your participation in this program, you may donate or give the socks away, but you agree not to resell them without a reseller’s permit. By donating to this program you agree that you will not resell for any monetary value, any product(s) Snapz USA provides you. This must be done to avoid people putting Snapz on auction sites or other retail locations outside of the official Snapz USA retail and online sales channels, thereby damaging the brand's reputation.

 **Snapz For Life Terms and Conditions. Donor will receive 2 dozen (24) socks every year for life or for as long as Snapz USA is in business. Or you can choose a one-time shipment of 200 pairs of socks in black, blue, grey or a mix of colors. It is the responsibility of the donor to ensure Snapz USA has a current shipping address for the donor.

Advisory Board: Donor will be offered a position to serve on the Snapz USA Advisory Board, pursuant to all Advisory Board guidelines, to commence March 1, 2014 and end February 28, 2017, during which time donor will be eligible for any and all benefits the Advisory Board may be entitled, including, but not limited to, travel costs associated with meetings if attending in person.

***Details of donation of percentage of profits for Platinum and Gold Founder’s Circle Members. For Platinum Founder’s Club Members, we’ll donate 3% of net profits in Snapz USA to be split evenly among all the Platinum Founder’s Circle Members’ non-profit charities of their choice, in their name, or, if none are specified, we will split the percentage amongst the five charities shown below. For Gold Founder’s Club Members, we’ll donate 1% of net profits in Snapz USA to be split among all the Gold Founder’s Circle Members’ non-profit charities of their choice, in their name, or, if none are specified, we will split the percentage amongst the five charities shown below.

Please provide your charity name and shipping address, otherwise we will split the donation evenly across seven of our favorite charities:

   Watchful Shepherd (http://www.watchful.org) child protection

   Andy Pilgrim Foundation (http://www.andypilgrimfoundation.org) teen driving

   German Shepherd Rescue of Orange County (http://www.gsroc.org) animals

   National Park Trust (http://www.parktrust.org) ecology and nature

   Marine Corps' Toys For Tots (http://www.toysfortots.org) children

   Mazon (http://www.mazon.org) hunger

   Wounded Warrior Project (http://www.woundedwarriorproject) veterans and their families

This means Snapz USA will donate 9% of net profits to charity (this program and 5% to Amati Foundation), plus our donations of one pair of socks for every 3-pack sold, which in total will result in Snapz USA giving back approximately 25% of net profits help make America a better place. The 3% and 1% net profits donations listed above will be made annually for a period of ten years as long as the company is in business and operated by Snapz USA.

When consumers purchase a 3-pack of Snaps, whether in a retail store or online, they're not only getting a great sock that solves the whole sorting and folding mess, but they're helping put new socks on the feet of kids that may be economically disadvantaged, living in a homeless shelter, or just struggling to be able to put well-made clothes on their bodies. For every 3-pack sold, Snaps USA will donate another pair to disadvantaged kids.

Next, because I also love music, I decided to give 5% of the company profits to Amati Foundation so that can continue buying musical instruments for kids who can’t afford them. In return, they agreed to underwrite all our corporate entity formation. Amati Foundation doesn't buy crummy musical instruments for their recipients, they get really good instruments that young people can use from school to college and into their careers. By supporting them, we can help thousands of kids gain access to music education which has been proven to help with cognitive ability. 
It's like we're creating "warm feet, warm minds" and I can picture it now…a kid dancing around the room in their Snaps socks while playing violin. It will be like Tom Cruise’s underwear dance in Risky Business, but with a Bach Serenade instead of Bob Seger!

A big launch for the holidays!
This campaign isn’t about a concept. The product is finished. It works great. It’s ready to go to market. I just need your help to get it there.
Snapz socks have been tested through over 500 washings in both household and industrial washers and driers. They are proven to work. Now they are ready to be manufactured. Best of all, I have a great partner whom we intend to launch with for the 2013 holiday season…the world famous retailer Fred Segal.

Fred Segal is an upscale Los Angeles, California based clothing retailer with two stores in Hollywood and Santa Monica. It has a long history of being ahead of trends: in 1960, Mr. Segal opened the world’s first jeans-only store. It grew to include other clothing, footwear and now restaurants and is expanding to Japan and Las Vegas.  They’ve been featured in many TV shows and movies including Entourage, LegallyBlonde, The L Word, White Oleander, Beverly Hills 90210, Dawson’s Creek, Clueless, Maid To Order, and Less Than Zero. Even the singer Pink has referenced Fred Segal in her songs. 
I’m also meeting with major retailers to get them to sell Snapz after the launch at Fred Segal and envision selling these socks at places like Amazon.com, Sak’s, Barney’s, Macy’s, Kohl's, Target, Men’s Warehouse, JC Penney and specialty retailers around the world. 

The more retailers we line up, the better, because my goal is that by the time I graduate high school, Snaps USA will have donated 1,000,000 pairs of socks to needy kids.

Why Snapz is on Indiegogo.
Bill and Mom recommended I put together a group of advisors to guide my business. They said I needed to find people who could pitch in with their time and talents to help me grow this. I agreed.
One of the things we discussed was how we would fund the company. My Mom and Bill paid for the start-up costs to get to this point. Bill likes his socks so much he offered to fund the whole company, but we discussed the value of earning and protecting the lessons that come with and are needed in making a company succeed. That’s when I realized I wouldn’t learn anything if he just wrote a check for $100,000. I wanted to learn what it was like to be an entrepreneur and part of that is learning how to raise funds to launch this product. 
This campaign will give Snaps USA the funding required to go from samples to full scale production, including ordering materials, manufacturing, hiring salespeople, filing more patents, launching an e-commerce website, bringing Snapz to the masses and beginning to design more great products.
I picked Indiegogo because I like the concept of people pitching in to help create something in the fashion space, and with Snapz, when you pitch in, you not only help me launch the company, but you support our efforts to provide socks to disadvantaged children and musical instruments to deserving kids.


You can help me reach these goals. 
We need $64,000 to ramp up production and go to market. My advisors said if we raise $100,000 or more via this campaign, they will contribute another $100,000 for new products. What a great challenge!
But right now, I need your help to raise $64,000 to get our first shipments done and start selling through Fred Segal and online. And if we hit $100,000, that's all the better!

Snapz advisors.
I have a great group of advisors that I have to tell you about. 
First is the most important person in my life, my Mom, Lisa Lane Dietle. She’s an amazing woman! I got my desire to help others from her. She received a service award by Dependency Court Los Angeles, CA for her public service and is always looking for ways to help others. She has worked for P&G, Jockey, and started Agent of Change where she works with companies like Hillsides, Crystals Garment, Leland Zales, Chrislie Formulations. Mom is my rock and foundation and is always encouraging me to think big.
Bill Townsend is an entrepreneur, author, and, tech and advertising veteran. He has been involved in launching or managing some of the biggest names in the Internet including Lycos, GeoCities (now Yahoo!), Deja.com (now ebay and Google), and Newegg.com. He knows a lot about attracting customers, having been involved in several successful products including P90X, Tony Horton’s Ten Minute Trainer, TurboJam, Insanity, TeamBeachbody, Jeunesse Global, Carbonixx, GoCards, and Beyond The Wall retail stores.  He also has lots of experience in working inEurope and Asia. Bill knows technology and the Internet so he’s going to be of greathelp as we move into e-commerce and social media.
Shelley Sarmiento is the founder of Little White Fashion Truck which brings unique and different clothing products to consumers through her fleet of, you guessed it, little white fashion trucks which are marketed exclusively through social media. She was cofounder of the 103-store chain White House/Black Market, which was sold to the leading women’s retailer Chico’s. She also teaches at the Fashion Institute of Technology and is full of great ideas!
Brian Kelner is a veteran of the fashion and accessories industry.  For over 20 years he has been a sales representative for companies like Christian Dior men’s hosiery (or socks, as I call them), Isotoner gloves and slippers, and Docker/Levi small leather goods.  He is president of Kelner Merchandising Network (KMN), and Solebury  Software. KMN is a national third party store service company, specializing in men's and ladies accessories and furnishings, and Solebury Software is a Software as a Service (SAAS) company specializing in scheduling and reporting for Field Service Organizations. Brian knows more about the Department Store and Specialty Store channels of retail distribution than almost anybody in America so I’m really happy to have him be part of this. 
Overseeing our budget---and your donation---is Katrina Yao, who is Sr. Director of Finance at the #2 pure play online retailer Newegg.com. She is a Certified Public Accountant and Certified Internal Auditor and will oversee finance and auditing at Snaps USA.  (by the way, Katrina has a son who also hates sorting socks.)
Can you believe a 14 year old has gotten such a great group of people together to help make this a success? You know what the secret is? I told them about the product and asked them to help. Brian said, "I can't believe I didn't think of this!" and Shelley said it was "brilliant!" I am very thankful for their help and expertise. 

This is just the start.
So there you have it: the story of Snaps and how I went from 40 minutes of sock sorting to less than 5 minutes while creating a great feeling, long-lasting product that helps the environment while also helping clothe and support disadvantaged kids.
Now it is up to you. Please consider supporting my project and product. I think it’s a winner and by helping, you can be among the first to have the pleasure of wearing and washing---and not having to sort---Snapz.
You can help me promote this project, too. Will you please put a link to this campaign on your Facebook page or tweet it on Twitter.  Just paste this url:   http://igg.me/at/snapzsocks
Give Snaps a try. I thank you, our ecosystem thanks you, and tens of thousands of kids will thank you, too.
-- Jacob

 
 
 T H A N K   Y O U  ! ! !
 
 


*Terms and Conditions. If you are receiving a pair or pairs of Snapz socks through your participation in this program, you may donate or give the socks away, but you agree not to resell them without a reseller’s permit. By donating to this program you agree that you will not resell for any monetary value, any product(s) Snapz USA provides you. This must be done to avoid people putting Snapz on auction sites or other retail locations outside of the official Snapz USA retail and online sales channels, thereby damaging the brand's reputation.
 **Snapz For Life Terms and Conditions. Donor will receive 2 dozen (24) socks every year for life or for as long as Snapz USA is in business. Or you can choose a one-time shipment of 200 pairs of socks in black, blue, grey or a mix of colors. It is the responsibility of the donor to ensure Snapz USA has a current shipping address for the donor.
Advisory Board: Donor will be offered a position to serve on the Snapz USA Advisory Board, pursuant to all Advisory Board guidelines, to commence March 1, 2014 and end February 28, 2017, during which time donor will be eligible for any and all benefits the Advisory Board may be entitled, including, but not limited to, travel costs associated with meetings if attending in person.
***Details of donation of percentage of profits for Platinum and Gold Founder’s Circle Members. For Platinum Founder’s Club Members, we’ll donate 3% of net profits in Snapz USA to be split evenly among all the Platinum Founder’s Circle Members’ non-profit charities of their choice, in their name, or, if none are specified, we will split the percentage amongst the five charities shown below. For Gold Founder’s Club Members, we’ll donate 1% of net profits in Snapz USA to be split among all the Gold Founder’s Circle Members’ non-profit charities of their choice, in their name, or, if none are specified, we will split the percentage amongst the five charities shown below.
Please provide your charity name and shipping address, otherwise we will split the donation evenly across seven of our favorite charities:
   Watchful Shepherd (http://www.watchful.org) child protection
   Andy Pilgrim Foundation (http://www.andypilgrimfoundation.org) teen driving
   German Shepherd Rescue of Orange County (http://www.gsroc.org) animals
   National Park Trust (http://www.parktrust.org) ecology and nature
   Marine Corps' Toys For Tots (http://www.toysfortots.org) children
   Mazon (http://www.mazon.org) hunger
   Wounded Warrior Project (http://www.woundedwarriorproject) veterans and their families
This means Snapz USA will donate 9% of net profits to charity (this program and 5% to Amati Foundation), plus our donations of one pair of socks for every 3-pack sold, which in total will result in Snapz USA giving back approximately 25% of net profits help make America a better place. The 3% and 1% net profits donations listed above will be made annually for a period of ten years as long as the company is in business and operated by Snapz USA.

story:
Who am I and What are Soda Toppers?

Hello! My name is Jennifer Davis.  My education is in Finance and I have experience in Retail.  My husband and partner has many years experience in Manufacturing and Sales.

Our family just recently invested in a SodaStream.  We absolutely love the convenience of it, but our problem comes when we have two dark flavors in the fridge at the same time. I can't tell them apart, and usually our kids end up getting a sip of mom's diet cola.  I have come up with a great idea for a product to label the flavor in the bottle.  Soda Toppers are an easy to use base and magnet for the cap of the SodaStream bottles, and we hope to offer a Soda Topper for each flavor offered by SodaStream. 

I don't think I am the only mom out there that has come across this problem, so I am wanting to manufacture this product to its fullest potential.  With your help, we can start the process of bringing this solution to every SodaStream user out there. 


What We Need & What You Get

 

  •  We are asking for $30,000 to help get this product started.  It will be used to purchase the equipment necessary to create the molds and purchase initial material for the product. 

  •  Get in on the ground floor of Soda Toppers with your contribution. 

  •   If we are unable to reach our entire goal, all contributed funds will be used to further our goal of bringing this product to consumers. 



The Impact

  • There are several SodaStream users out there and there is always a question of "What flavor is in the bottle?"  That is where we come in...with Soda Toppers, you never have to worry about that again. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are able to contribute, thank you...we greatly appreciate your support. 

If you are not able to financially help out, please help us get the word out by sharing with everyone you know.  Indiegogo has provided great tools to share this campaign. 


Questions and/or Comments: 

Please let us know.  We are happy to answer any questions you may have.

story:
When I was a student I was poor, 

 I remember this, like it was yesterday, 

I bought only things I had to buy, Everything else is out of the question. 

In my heart I knew that for me it's a temporary situation, and yet the feeling burned within me. This sense of disability. An inability to achieve the things I want, thanks to that I understood the feelings of the needy.

 

In addition, during this period I was about to get married, so I decided to take one of my gowns from Yad Abraham  Foundation

 (which was quite new at the time). 

I chose a dress and I got it immediately , I have to say that they made ​​me feel like I was in the store  buying my wedding dress ...


For me it's closure, this is the opportunity for me to give what I have, andas a fashion designer, I want to contribute as much as Abraham handdresses, shoes, accessories, so that many brides who are now in a position where I was, will receive a free wedding dress.

We'll do it together, together we can change the world.

What you can do to make this happen?


Donate $ 1 or more 

( press the pink button that says - Contribute Now )

Spread the word to all your Friends in the social networking 

( this is near the top video,  press the button with the icon- Facebook, Twitter) 

If you want to help ,we will be happy to have you join to our team

 (Contact us by email - eti.refaeli1@gmail.com  )




Yes, it's a gift for everyone 



The picture was donated by the photographer - wallyir



When we reach the goal 27 k, I'll teach you, step by step how to make a fancy wedding /  evening dress with all the accessories, the model i will learn is for Miniitor model . 
I will teach you the tricks that seamstresses know, the little things that change everything. 

This can be a jewelry doll, a Barbie doll, or a large doll. 
  Imagine what you can do with it ... maybe sell maybe give a gift, maybe teach your daughter ...

So Which dress will you make ?

 
When we reach the goal I will send a large selection of dresses made ​​my last two collections, and will be voting, we will do the exact model of the dress, the same uniform, the same figure, in order to look like the original dress. 
You need to know basic sewing (machine or manual) and I'll teach you the rest. 
If both dresses will be in demand I will teach you to make the two dresses. 
The study will be from a video I make, and I will divide it into stages so that if you want to repeat a specific part, it will be easy.


And another bonus -

I will open a private group on Facebook  only for people who donated to the campaign, this group will meets for 2-3 hours for your questions, if there are a lot of questions, we will add another day to the meeting. 
I'll be there for you when you prepare your wedding dress

 
The video will be on air in January 2015 

So come on, let's make it happen:-)


 this is an example of a small part of  the collections :






Here are the rewards that you will get for your generous donation   
    The images here are for illustration only 





 And more


   

 

   

 And more





some of the images were free donated by website
 www.freedigitalphotos.net


I believe that everything that happens in life, 

happens for a reason and for me, 

the experience of being poor had led me to help people who have no money to get what they want. 

I believe that giving is the most expensive thing you can  get for yourself,

My vision is to build a large center that will fulfill all the needs of poor people.

                                       
              


When I get my reward ?

You will receive your reward In December 2014 


When we achieve the goal, where the extra  money goes ?

When we reach our goal, the money we receive will go to make 
more dresses 
  The more money we get, the more dresses i make for poor Brides


If we don't achieve the goal,
 where the money goes ?

If we have not reached the goal, I'll make dresses from the money that was donated


                                                 


If you believe what we believe, you can help us Spread the word : 


  • You can donate $ 1 or more
  • You can share this page on your Facebook (button is next to the video) 
  • You can share this page on your Twitter (button is next to the video) 
  • You can share this page with your friends on email, by copying the link  
  •  if you have another idea we want to hear from you by email - eti.refaeli1@gmail.com

You can donate $ 1 or more

story:
“We are designers, why don’t we design something for ourselves?” – We asked each other when we couldn’t find a stylish and functional bicycle basket for our everyday commute. 

As designers, and as bike riders, we imagined a unique carrying accessory that is more than just a regular basket. Besides being functional we wanted it to become an important part of our style too.

That’s how the PaperSpokes crates were born.

NOW WE NEED YOUR HELP THAT WE CAN START MANUFACTURING THE PRODUCTS!



We designed two customizable wooden bicycles crates that fit into the everyday need of the urban cyclers: one bigger sized, the ZIGZAG, and a smaller square shaped, the SPOTTY. They don’t just look amazingly beautiful, they are functional as well.

ZIGZAG is our bigger, rectangular crate with fixed shock cord. 

SPOTTY is our smaller, square shaped crate with rearrangeable shock cord. The position of the cord can be easily changed, the holes on the crate give wild range of possibility. 






Besides the high-quality materials we were keen on the details too, these make our crates real design products. The crates are registered design products in the European Union.



The PaperSpokes crates are made of locally sourced special wood that stands up to both the sun and the rain. No chemicals were used during manufacturing, the products are repairable and recyclable, and completely eco-friendly.




We wanted to add something extra that our product can offer. We wove a light-reflecting fiber in our elastic shock cords, thus they are perfect to help you with visibility at night.




The PaperSpokes crates are for everyday urban use: commute to work, go shopping, meet friends. 

The SPOTTY is ideal for those, who love the variability. Everything important fits in, and it’s still a lovable size. The ZIGZAG is for cyclists, who love classic design and carry larger items. Their shock cords can fasten any object into the crate, or even on the outside surface of it.


You can fix both of the crates onto your own bike rack, either you choose the front or the back.



You can fix the crates to your own bicycle luggage rack with our mounting device, which is included to the crates.

Which bicycle luggage racks will they fit?

You don’t have luggage rack on your bicycle? 
No problem, simply order one online, or choose one from your local bike shop.
 






(No luggage rack is included to the crates.)





We started to design our bicycle crates two years ago. First we studied existing solutions, and gathered a lot of new ideas. Then we experimented with functions and different materials, and developed designs of metal, wood, plastic and leather boxes, baskets and bags. More than 20 different product ideas were born, two of which we found to be worthy of implementation: two unusual wooden crates.

Since then we’ve kept experimenting with the right materials and technologies to make the wooden crates resistant to all kinds of weather. It took us a year to find the right technology assuring that no surface treatment is needed, the wood is resistant to the effects of the sunshine, and its water absorption is minimal, so it does not warp and keeps its original shape even after heavy rainfalls.



From the prototypes we learned, that we need to change many details. To make the crates waterproof we designed rain runoff holes to the bottom corners. We rounded the edges to make them less sensitive. Chamfered the holes to make the shock cords long lasting. We changed the original joints to loose tongue mitre to make the crates' structure stronger.





AGI is an architect and likes to experiment with new materials and unusual solutions. Meticulous attention to details characterizes her work. Find her on Instagram

ZSOFI is an architect. She has constant desire for discovering new ideas. She designed our crates and already has new PaperSpokes products in her mind. Find her on LinkedIn

VIRI is a designer and a businesswoman. She makes sure that everything works efficiently: running the company, pricing and designing the products. Find her on Twitter.




What are the inside dimensions?
ZIGZAG: 35.2 cm x 25.2 cm  // 13.86 x 9.92 inches (13" notebook fits in)
SPOTTY: 24.5 x 24.5 cm // 9.65 x 9.65 inches (9.7" tablet fits in)

How much do they weight?
The crates weight ca. 2 kg (4.4 pounds). We recommend these crates for standard city-bikes, rather than extra-light fixies.

Where do you ship?
We ship worldwide.

Are there different colours?
No, but due to the colour variation of the natural wood, there can be colour differences in the final products. 
The actual colour looks similar to this: 



What we do with your money?

The manufacturers need a minimum order from most of the components. There are special components where we need a unique tool and that cost €3000.  We would love to be able to do this ourselves, but the upfront costs are unrealistic for our small team.

Risks & Challenges

It's been almost 2 years since we started to work on this project. The crates’ developments are almost complete. The most important thing that still needs to be done is finalizing the accessories’ exact material specifications. We have great materials in our hands right now, but when we reach our goal we can go for even lighter and stronger solutions. The only risk we can foresee right now is a longer lead-time on the material which could potentially delay the delivery by 1 month, but so far we believe the shipping date in June can be met.

We wanted to add something extra that our product can offer. We wove a light-reflecting fiber in our elastic shock cords, thus they are perfect to help you with visibility at night.







The PaperSpokes crates are for everyday urban use: commute to work, go shopping, meet friends. 
The SPOTTY is ideal for those, who love the variability. Everything important fits in, and it’s still a lovable size. The ZIGZAG is for cyclists, who love classic design and carry larger items. Their shock cords can fasten any object into the crate, or even on the outside surface of it.




You can fix both of the crates onto your own bike rack, either you choose the front or the back.








You can fix the crates to your own bicycle luggage rack with our mounting device, which is included to the crates.

Which bicycle luggage racks will they fit?

You don’t have luggage rack on your bicycle? No problem, simply order one online, or choose one from your local bike shop.

 













(No luggage rack is included to the crates.)




We started to design our bicycle crates two years ago. First we studied existing solutions, and gathered a lot of new ideas. Then we experimented with functions and different materials, and developed designs of metal, wood, plastic and leather boxes, baskets and bags. More than 20 different product ideas were born, two of which we found to be worthy of implementation: two unusual wooden crates.
Since then we’ve kept experimenting with the right materials and technologies to make the wooden crates resistant to all kinds of weather. It took us a year to find the right technology assuring that no surface treatment is needed, the wood is resistant to the effects of the sunshine, and its water absorption is minimal, so it does not warp and keeps its original shape even after heavy rainfalls.


From the prototypes we learned, that we need to change many details. To make the crates waterproof we designed rain runoff holes to the bottom corners. We rounded the edges to make them less sensitive. Chamfered the holes to make the shock cords long lasting. We changed the original joints to loose tongue mitre to make the crates' structure stronger.











AGI is an architect and likes to experiment with new materials and unusual solutions. Meticulous attention to details characterizes her work. Find her on Instagram
ZSOFI is an architect. She has constant desire for discovering new ideas. She designed our crates and already has new PaperSpokes products in her mind. Find her on LinkedIn
VIRI is a designer and a businesswoman. She makes sure that everything works efficiently: running the company, pricing and designing the products. Find her on Twitter.





What are the inside dimensions?ZIGZAG: 35.2 cm x 25.2 cm  // 13.86 x 9.92 inches (13" notebook fits in)SPOTTY: 24.5 x 24.5 cm // 9.65 x 9.65 inches (9.7" tablet fits in)
How much do they weight?The crates weight ca. 2 kg (4.4 pounds). We recommend these crates for standard city-bikes, rather than extra-light fixies.
Where do you ship?We ship worldwide.
Are there different colours?No, but due to the colour variation of the natural wood, there can be colour differences in the final products. The actual colour looks similar to this: 










What we do with your money?
The manufacturers need a minimum order from most of the components. There are special components where we need a unique tool and that cost €3000.  We would love to be able to do this ourselves, but the upfront costs are unrealistic for our small team.

Risks & Challenges

It's been almost 2 years since we started to work on this project. The crates’ developments are almost complete. The most important thing that still needs to be done is finalizing the accessories’ exact material specifications. We have great materials in our hands right now, but when we reach our goal we can go for even lighter and stronger solutions. The only risk we can foresee right now is a longer lead-time on the material which could potentially delay the delivery by 1 month, but so far we believe the shipping date in June can be met.

story:
Hello, my name is Landon Grant and today I would like to introduce to you:

Fashionable and Affordable T-Shirts

I am a T-Shirt lover, if you see me on the streets 99 times out of 100 I will be sporting a generic T-Shirt from one of my favorite Skateboard / Shoe companies. I have never really cared too much about the actual meaning or branding of the shirts I wear, I prefer to look at the design and color of the shirt. 

The problem with most T-Shirts is that they are branded and become all very expensive because of this. In my opinion T-Shirts were meant to be inexpensive which is why they are designed in such a simple way. 

My goal is create simple and pleasant designs for T-Shirts and reach out to many different clothing stores to have them sell our product at an affordable price. 

You shouldn't have to pay a fortune to look good.

The T-Shirts will be available online for order as well but will naturally be more expensive due to shipping fees :( 
(Hopefully they will come to a store near you instead).

In case you were wondering the front of the shirt translates to "Give it to me" (In a polite way) and the back says "Thank you" 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are really interested in supporting us but cannot afford to do so directly you can share us on social media. Thank you so much!
