story:
The driving factor behind this project is the belief that simple design is high design, particularly when working in the developing world.

For the Love of Earthbags (F.L.O.E.) is an interactive design project that aims to prove that it’s possible to approach high-design in a manner that is tasteful, modern, and groundbreaking by using only the most basic materials, such as the dirt beneath our feet.

This project is an initiative led by architect Travis Hughbanks and supported by Edge of Seven (www.edgeofseven.org) and Architecture for Humanity Denver in partnership with the local community of Basa, Nepal. The final product will be a higher secondary school in the village of Basa, Nepal. The school is one of VERY few high schools in the region and will allow students to achieve a higher secondary education in a safe, environmentally friendly building close to home!

Edge of Seven is a nonprofit organization that generates awareness and volunteer support for projects that invest in education, health and economic opportunity for girls in developing countries. According to the World Bank, 30 percent of Nepalis live in poverty and this population is most concentrated in rural areas where people survive off of agriculture and subsistence farming. For Edge of Seven, earthbags offered an opportunity to improve rural educational infrastructure and combat poverty in the most low-cost, efficient and sustainable way possible.

How will the funding be spent? The money raised through this campaign will be used for supplies to create the earthbag school, educational tools, and the production of the graphic materials.

F.L.O.E.’s end goal is to elevate the practice of earthbag construction by producing several engaging and creative educational materials that will be used both to promote earthbag construction and teach local residents how to build with this method. The materials to be produced are an animated video and a graphic print manual.

These resources will be heavy on simple, culturally-neutral, step-by-step graphics so that they can be easily understood by anyone and easily translated into different languages. After production, they will be made available to the public for free on the web under Creative Commons licensing.

To gather content for the production of the F.L.O.E. materials, we will build a prototype earthbag building in rural Nepal that will be turned over to the local community upon completion for use as a higher secondary school. In addition to the educational materials we will produce for mass distribution, we will also inlay a plaque containing graphics that outline step-by-step instructions for earthbag construction in to one of the building’s walls so the structure itself will act as an educational resource.

What is earthbag construction?


Boiled down to its basics, earthbag construction uses readily-available polypropolene rice or cement bags filled with dirt as the primary building block. The bags are laid in courses, stacked like bricks, and a strip of barbed wire is used as the mortar between each course. When the walls are constructed, a layer of chicken wire is attached to the outside so that plaster can be applied.

While most people aren’t familiar with earthbag construction, those who are will probably conjure images of a “yurt-like” structure at its mention. The “yurt-like” structure may in fact be consistent with many past examples of earthbag construction, but the truth is that earthbags can be used to build sleek and modern buildings, too.

Why build with earthbags? What are the benefits?

The benefits to building with earthbags are:

â—      It’s environmentally-friendly, sustainable, and draws on locally-available materials: For most earthbag buildings, it’s possible to use the dirt and stone excavated from the building site as the filler for the earthbags. What you dig out of the earth, you put back into the building. Low-waste. Simple.

â—      It’s cheaper than traditional methods: The main building materials used in earthbag construction are polypropolene bags and dirt, both of which are extremely affordable. Using locally-harvested stone and dirt reduces material transportation costs. Because the building method is so simple, it requires practically no skilled labor. Anyone with minimal training can build with earthbags.

â—      It’s sturdy and earthquake-resistant: Just picture how a building made of 16-inch-wide bags filled with loose dirt would react during an earthquake in comparison to one built of stone and mortar. Where the latter would easily break apart during a tremor, earthbags have more flexibility and less rigidity and are better able to absorb shock.

Why Nepal?

We chose the Solukhumbu Region of Nepal for the prototype build, because it is a country with a need for better earthquake-resistant buildings. The Himalayas were rocked by a magnitude 6.9 earthquake in September 2011, which destroyed many community buildings and homes in the Everest Region of Nepal, highlighting the inadequacies in the country’s infrastructure. Nepal is a place that stands to benefit greatly from not only gaining knowledge of more disaster-proof building techniques, but also from gaining knowledge of cheaper building techniques.

About Edge of Seven

For more information on Edge of Seven, please visit:

www.edgeofseven.org

www.facebook.com/edgeof7

http://edgeofseven.wordpress.com/

http://www.flickr.com/photos/edgeofseven
story_txt:
The driving factor behind this project is the belief that simple design is high design, particularly when working in the developing world.
For the Love of Earthbags (F.L.O.E.) is an interactive design project that aims to prove that it’s possible to approach high-design in a manner that is tasteful, modern, and groundbreaking by using only the most basic materials, such as the dirt beneath our feet.
This project is an initiative led by architect Travis Hughbanks and supported by Edge of Seven (www.edgeofseven.org) and Architecture for Humanity Denver in partnership with the local community of Basa, Nepal. The final product will be a higher secondary school in the village of Basa, Nepal. The school is one of VERY few high schools in the region and will allow students to achieve a higher secondary education in a safe, environmentally friendly building close to home!
Edge of Seven is a nonprofit organization that generates awareness and volunteer support for projects that invest in education, health and economic opportunity for girls in developing countries. According to the World Bank, 30 percent of Nepalis live in poverty and this population is most concentrated in rural areas where people survive off of agriculture and subsistence farming. For Edge of Seven, earthbags offered an opportunity to improve rural educational infrastructure and combat poverty in the most low-cost, efficient and sustainable way possible.
How will the funding be spent? The money raised through this campaign will be used for supplies to create the earthbag school, educational tools, and the production of the graphic materials.
F.L.O.E.’s end goal is to elevate the practice of earthbag construction by producing several engaging and creative educational materials that will be used both to promote earthbag construction and teach local residents how to build with this method. The materials to be produced are an animated video and a graphic print manual.

These resources will be heavy on simple, culturally-neutral, step-by-step graphics so that they can be easily understood by anyone and easily translated into different languages. After production, they will be made available to the public for free on the web under Creative Commons licensing.

To gather content for the production of the F.L.O.E. materials, we will build a prototype earthbag building in rural Nepal that will be turned over to the local community upon completion for use as a higher secondary school. In addition to the educational materials we will produce for mass distribution, we will also inlay a plaque containing graphics that outline step-by-step instructions for earthbag construction in to one of the building’s walls so the structure itself will act as an educational resource.
What is earthbag construction?

Boiled down to its basics, earthbag construction uses readily-available polypropolene rice or cement bags filled with dirt as the primary building block. The bags are laid in courses, stacked like bricks, and a strip of barbed wire is used as the mortar between each course. When the walls are constructed, a layer of chicken wire is attached to the outside so that plaster can be applied.
While most people aren’t familiar with earthbag construction, those who are will probably conjure images of a “yurt-like” structure at its mention. The “yurt-like” structure may in fact be consistent with many past examples of earthbag construction, but the truth is that earthbags can be used to build sleek and modern buildings, too.

Why build with earthbags? What are the benefits?
The benefits to building with earthbags are:
â—      It’s environmentally-friendly, sustainable, and draws on locally-available materials: For most earthbag buildings, it’s possible to use the dirt and stone excavated from the building site as the filler for the earthbags. What you dig out of the earth, you put back into the building. Low-waste. Simple.
â—      It’s cheaper than traditional methods: The main building materials used in earthbag construction are polypropolene bags and dirt, both of which are extremely affordable. Using locally-harvested stone and dirt reduces material transportation costs. Because the building method is so simple, it requires practically no skilled labor. Anyone with minimal training can build with earthbags.
â—      It’s sturdy and earthquake-resistant: Just picture how a building made of 16-inch-wide bags filled with loose dirt would react during an earthquake in comparison to one built of stone and mortar. Where the latter would easily break apart during a tremor, earthbags have more flexibility and less rigidity and are better able to absorb shock.

Why Nepal?
We chose the Solukhumbu Region of Nepal for the prototype build, because it is a country with a need for better earthquake-resistant buildings. The Himalayas were rocked by a magnitude 6.9 earthquake in September 2011, which destroyed many community buildings and homes in the Everest Region of Nepal, highlighting the inadequacies in the country’s infrastructure. Nepal is a place that stands to benefit greatly from not only gaining knowledge of more disaster-proof building techniques, but also from gaining knowledge of cheaper building techniques.
About Edge of Seven
For more information on Edge of Seven, please visit:
www.edgeofseven.org
www.facebook.com/edgeof7
http://edgeofseven.wordpress.com/
http://www.flickr.com/photos/edgeofseven

story:
I am a mechanical Engineer    and I thought that as an Engineer the End-All Be-All would be to have a 3D Printer. So I set out to get one. I was so excited when I finally got it. But it was not long afterwards that I came to realize that instead of being a joy... It was a source of Frustration. Items I would build would be stuck to the build plate. I would have to use Chisels and knives and a mallet to pry what I had built off of the build plate. Often times I would damage the item I built or worse I would damage the build plate itself... On a really bad build I would damage both the build plate and the Item I built....

I am launching this project to help start a business to be able to offer 3D EeZ to the world of 3D Printer Users.  I need the money to get an MSDS sheet...  and to get items to manufacture larger quantities at a time... so I can better support the Users of the world. 

Click here : An Example of 3D EeZ in Action

I am also wanting to develop a Spray    on form of 3D EeZ.. Making the application all the EeZier for the end users... Pardon the Pun but i just had to do it.. :)

The fact is... it works and works well..... You Can reuse the 3 D EeZ as long as you have not peeled it from the build plate..I quite often get several builds from a single coating... I usually do not peel it off unless I have a build that is large or is having problems being removed...

I have even used it for a whole month...Only having to apply an addtional coat now and again...    making the 3D EeZ last all the longer... a Liter can last for as long as a year.. 

I was Inspired after getting a 3D Printer... I got the 3D Printer to augment my life after getting MS. As s mechanical Engineer... it only seemed natural to get a 3 D Printer... and it still doers... But now the frustration I encountered in the beginning is just a bad memory.. 3 d EeZ works .. and it helps fund my retirement    after having to go on Disability    from my MS... I am sure you will like it as well..

story:
It's simple! I consider a bow tie a unique and very special accessory. It has always been a symbol of solemnity, some kind of romanticism and sometimes even impudence. Not for nothing among its fans are the Playboy rabbit and the most charming spy - James Bond. 

    So why do they lose their relevance today? Sadly, but nowadays you can meet a man in a bow tie only in a photo! 

    I think that the reason lies in the lack of decent design variations. Although many accessories have been evolved and there were interesting modern matches and combinations of materials, but any of them apply to a bow tie. They seem to be stuck in time. Of course, you can meet attempts to modernize this accessory, but for some reasons most of them aren’t successful. 

    That's why I'm sure this is an excellent challenge for our team! Since we just love difficulties! Let's restore the popularity of this accessory! What is pleasant, our backers say that we are doing very well. The faithful fans of this accessory cannot be mistaken!

   This means that we are on the right track! Your warm words inspire us to new achievements! No doubt, this time we tried even more and what you will see next definitely won't leave anyone indifferent to the bow ties!

  EGGO is initially high-quality materials! After all, a good impression of a beautiful design can easily be spoiled by bad quality materials and performance. 

    One of our main materials is high-quality Italian leather. It is available in 8 colors: black, brown, beige, white, khaki, terra cotta, red and blue. We are highly convinced in its quality, since we are working with this material from the first project on Indiegogo and our backers give very positive references about this material! 

    Another very important element of our bow tie is the tweed fabric. We have spent about two months searching for the perfect combination of fabric and its texture with real leather! Eventually, we succeeded! And the result is worth it! 

    Finally, the most important - our bow tie is two-sided! Instead of one bow tie you will get two. You can change the side depending on your clothes, mood or just for a change. Cool, isn’t it?

    For your bow tie you can choose yourself the perfect combination of leather, fabric and patch! As we don’t know your preferences, we give you complete freedom of choice to create something individual!

    We have our own production, quite small for right now, but own, what is very important for us. It means we can implement the boldest decisions and be confident in the quality of each product!

 

    And of course everyone loves our branded packaging. It helps not only keep the bow tie intact during transportation, but it also can be a great gift to your family and friends! 

    It is thought that a bow tie is a male accessory. We consider it as being a mistake! Having looked at the photo below, you will be convinced of it. The EGGO bow tie is great both for men and women as well as children!

    Specially for the true fans of Indiegogo and bow tie lovers we have developed an incredibly cool product! It is literally unbelievable in materials, design, mechanism! Now you will see everything on you own. Look carefully!

 

    The EGGO limited edition is a complete set of accessories. It includes 4 bow ties with fastenings to them, 3 pocket squares, a premium wooden case with personalized engraving. But the most significant is the price of this miracle! Only $ 95 (according to our calculations, the total retail price could be $ 200)!

    Tastes differ. We don’t know your preferences, so we give you complete freedom of choice to create something perfect for yourself! First, you need to decide on the color of the leather. You can choose from black, brown, beige and white! 

  Have chosen the leather? Now you need to choose the type of fabric. Don’t worry! All of them match perfectly all colors of the leather.

    Finally, the most amazing thing! You can even choose the color of the strap for your bow tie. It can be black or white!

story:
AGENdA by July: Launching  
It all started when I searched for a new jacket that was well-made in more sustainable materials and realized that there are various options for casual clothing but not enough for more refined ones.

After earning B.A. and B.H.E at Ewha Womens' University in Korea, I moved to New York to further study fashion at the Fashion Institute of Technology. During my 15 years of career as a designer/ merchandiser, I came to learn about many environmental and social challenges that the industry is faced. The particular issue that I was concerned about was the amount of waste from fashion products. I started devoting time in researching and studying about causes of the issues I recognize and what I could do about them.

That is how I came along here. Sustainable fashion has been gaining interest but is still very limited in its variety. When I needed a new jacket, it was difficult to find one. In many regions in the world including America and Korea, fashion is being discarded at an increasingly amazing speed. In many cases, clothes' life is short because of its design and/or workmanship. As a designer, I felt a strong urgency that I have to design clothes that can withstand the time. 

AGENdA aims to create thoughtful and beautiful clothes for real women with sustainability and sensibility at heart. Through making well-made clothes that will be cherished for many years, I want to restore the spirit of tailoring and to be a part of the positive change.

The first product of AGENdA is the slouchy trench coat that can cover more sizes and shapes with limited resources. It is in the production stage now.

 

40K to Launch 
How the funding will be used 


It will go into the first production for AGENdA.

The Impact
Well-made clothes can last longer; thus, reducing waste.

Thoughtful Design: versatile and classic design, work well with various sizes, shapes, and looks. 
Sustainable Material: Tencel Blended Shell + Bemberg Cupro Lining from Japan 
Responsible Production: Total 300pc production, made in Korea with 100% quality check 

 

Risks & Challenges
I understand that this may not be the new technology-driven product that you were looking to fund. So I want to emphasize that you are supporting the very beginning of a uniquely positioned American brand focused on sustainable women's workwear. This funding is not about a single product production but a brand launching. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't fund, there are many ways that you can help. If you like what AGENdA's about, kindly share about it with your family and friends. You can share this campaign on your social media

story:
The KiwiCard is the world's thinnest Bluetooth tracker available at only 1.5mm thick. It is fully waterproof for those of us who sometimes throw our wallets in the washer. Our custom battery and design gives you 3 times the life as most trackers on the market. Our integrated TapSense technology allows you to simply tap your wallet to ring your phone and silence alarms.

But the KiwiCard is not just for wallets. If you can put a card inside it, you can track it.

KiwiCard connects with the KiwiTrackers app on your mobile phone to provide you with an array of item finding features.

The KiwiCard’s TapSense technology allows you to find your phone too! Simply give it a few firm taps and your phone will begin to ring. If your KiwiCard is inside a wallet, notebook, or outside pocket of a bag, just tap on the item and the KiwiCard will pick up the vibrations. You don't even need to pull your wallet out of your pocket!

The KiwiTrackers app is available for both iPhone and Android mobile devices and works with your KiwiCards and future KiwiTracker products (yes, a keychain version will be coming!)

Figuring out how to make the world's thinnest tracking device without compromising durability was not easy. The KiwiCard consists of many layers of material fused together to make a durable watertight enclosure. Our process is so unique and requires such precision that we cannot outsource it. Because of this and to support our local economy, KiwiCards will be created and packaged at our facility in the USA.

The KiwiCard’s custom, flexible battery holds 3 times more charge than the coin cell batteries typically used by most item tracking devices. The KiwiCard is water-tight, making it completely waterproof (IPX8 for the geeks like us) which means the batteries are not replaceable. Batteries are not something you need to worry about with our service model.

Let’s face it…you’re forgetful. This is why we offer the KiwiCard as a service. It’s peace of mind for you. When you purchase a service you get guaranteed KiwiCards so long as you keep your service active. That means free replacements if its lost or damaged, and when the battery is getting low you will receive a free replacement automatically. When it’s time to renew your service you can do it with a few quick clicks in the app. 

  • Dimensions: 85.60 × 53.98 × 1.5mm (3.370 × 2.125 × 0.059 in)
  • Battery Life: 3 years
  • Battery Type: Lithium-ion
  • Connectivity: Bluetooth Low Energy 4.0
  • Range: Bluetooth range, up to 100 feet. (Surroundings such as walls and furniture will affect range)
  • Waterproof Rating: IPX8 - Immersion up to 3 meters
  • Supported OS: iOS 9.3.1+ and Android 4.3+
  • Compatibility: Any iPhone released after the 4S and most Android phones (If your android is over 4 years old we recommend you use this app to see if you have BLE 4.0)

 

Design for the KiwiCard started in July of 2016 and we are currently on our third design iteration. We are waiting on an order of 200 units of our current revision circuit boards to be delivered by the end of March. These circuit boards will be programmed and used for our phase 1 beta tests and our Kickstarter beta tests. In designing the enclosure we have tested over 40 variants of plastics from various suppliers around the world. We currently have all the necessary equipment to create small quantities of production-grade units for our beta tests. We also have most of the necessary equipment for mass production as we only need to upgrade our programming station to mass produce KiwiCards at our facility.

Mikey decided he would leave his job as a research engineer at Georgia Tech Research Institute designing software and computer solutions for the United States Air Force. After a couple of weeks, he put in a month’s notice and quit his job. It was shortly after this that Charlie joined him part time. Charlie was still finishing up school and thus did not have much time, nor was he in the same city. Mikey was hard at work developing by hand the first prototype of the KiwiCard. When Gonzalo joined the team, Mikey already had a prototype. Soon after that, Charlie graduated and moved to Macon to work full-time.

Now, you may be wondering where the name 43Tech comes from. If you are a nerd, you might know that element 43 on the periodic tables is called Technetium (we make tech...get it?). If you are a super-nerd (like us), you may also know that it is the first manufactured, or man-made, element. The vision for the company is to create affordable and innovative technology solutions to everyday problems while supporting local urban development through financial investment and employment opportunities.

We would like to thank the Small Business Development Center (SBDC) for helping us get things straightened out and guiding us in a general direction. We would also like to thank Robert Betzel, who has given us great advice about the business. And lastly, we would like to thank Dr. Keith Johnson for believing in us and supporting us financially.

When Gonzalo joined the team, Mikey already had a prototype. Soon after that, Charlie graduated and moved to Macon to work full-time.Now, you may be wondering where the name 43Tech comes from. If you are a nerd, you might know that element 43 on the periodic tables is called Technetium (we make tech...get it?). If you are a super-nerd (like us), you may also know that it is the first manufactured, or man-made, element. The vision for the company is to create affordable and innovative technology solutions to everyday problems while supporting local urban development through financial investment and employment opportunities.We would like to thank the Small Business Development Center (SBDC) for helping us get things straightened out and guiding us in a general direction. We would also like to thank Robert Betzel, who has given us great advice about the business. And lastly, we would like to thank Dr. Keith Johnson for believing in us and supporting us financially.

story:
The colorway above is unavailable (Dawn)

Conventional wallet vs FLIKK wallet

 

 

Fits 8 cards, 2 sim cards, 1 ejector pin, and all currencies.

There isn’t any coin slot for FLIKK as it exemplifies the ‘go-coinless’ system. We designed the wallet to be slim and clutter-free. Our focus is on the card-drawing experience and convenience of commuting. (This colorway is unavailable)

 

FLIKK'S MISSION

To challenge the conventional interaction of everyday products with our design conviction - to design with newness, minimalism and strategic feature.

VISION

To give everyday products a new recognizable identity and novelty, while maintaining practicality, consequently setting an improved market benchmark.

Our Values

Practicality. Innovation. Strategic Thinking

 

We are finally here on this global platform to introduce FLIKK, after almost a year of rigorous iterations, involving countless prototypes and many rounds of user testing. We’ve worked tirelessly to bring our design and mechanism to perfection. Now, it is our hope to execute the production plan to get the fruit of our labor on your hand! Of course, for that, we’ll need your support! Back us today and help FLIKK walk into reality!

 

 

More pictures? Download our press kit or follow us on social media!

 

 

Find us at Flikkwallet@gmail.com

story:
From the creation of our brand, our goal was to create a watch with a perpertually floating, spinning bullet second hand.   However, we quickly learned that this idea required a lot more effort to create, due to the second-hand weight , balance, and the lack of power generated by the movement.

Because of these obstacles, we initially settled on using the bullet as the hour hand, which consequently became the Q-series in 2015.  Although satisfied with our release, we still dreamed of achieving our original goal, which we finally were able to do in 2019, after consulting with the industry's leading engineers.

The progression of the timeline goes as follows:

 

In 2015, we released the Q-series watch, then improving the second hand rotation, aesthetics, and crystal height- creating version 2 in 2017.  Taking our knowledge, we were able to create the R88 in 2019.  From the first prototype, we've vastly improved its lume distribution and bullet aesthetics. 

Because so much went into designing this piece, we made sure to add the best quality materials for every component used to build this watch.   
 

We will have 2 variations:

------------------------------------------------------------------

Model A: The R88 with bracelet:

Being an all stainless piece, it matches well with many different types of outfits: 

For the bracelet, we decided to go with Strapcode, the choice amongst the most hardcore hobbyists, ranging from fans of Seiko to Rolex.  For unbiased reviews, I'd recommend you checking out sites like Amazon and inputting "Strapcode" into the search field.

Here are some shots of the R88 on my 6.5" wrist! 

 My wife actually really likes the sizing for her as well

Exhibition view:

 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Model B: The AR-1 with (Fluororubber) FKM Strap:

FKM rubber (otherwise known as Fluororubber) is among the densest and highest quality types of rubber used in the industry, as it is durable, comfortable, and retains its qualities over time.  

It is resistant to dust, stretching, fading, etc and keeps its feel even after years of use.  

Also looks great on a vintage nato strap in our opinion:

 

 ------------------------------------------------------------------

The lume was upgraded multiple times through the prototyping process, to create a bright and even glow, with our signature crosshair pattern on the outer edges of the dial. We've applied multiple coats of C3 Super Luminova to create a beautiful glow in the dark pattern.

The crown will be marked with the limited edition "Recon R" Emblem- this particular piece will not sell over 88 pieces, no matter the demand:

At a 40.5mm casing size, the R88 was designed to be versatile- both dressy and sporty.  It's an eye-catcher in all lights, as the dial pops and the casing reflects brilliance from its multi-chamfered contrast: 

 Here is the special we're currently running:

My name is Dan Uchida, and I'm the owner of RVLVR.   I started my journey as a second amendment enthusiast, and being a watch lover and collector, I was able to combine  these two industries and form the brand RVLVR.  We are based out of Honolulu, Hawaii, and every piece will be inspected and shipped from here.

Thanks so much for taking the time to check out our story!  I will do my best to take care of any customer questions or concerns.  Check out our story at www.rvlvr.com, or you can reach me personally at anytime at dan@rvlvr.com

story:
The Manhattan Kids FW 2012 Project


The Manhattan Kids FOR The Manhattan Kids

A percentage of all products sold will be donated to New York City youth programs.  We are very excited to have established a project that will be able to communicate and gather supporters from around the country.


The Creators

The creators are not newcomers to the world of textile and board projects.  They have been involved in the street-couture scene for a long period.  From major brand collaborations, design, wholesale, buying, distribution, PR, and more, The Manhattan Kids are comprised of only the best of the best - all names are kept secret.  Suspense.


The Manhattan Kids Club

Every contributor and future patron receives exclusive access to The Manhattan Kids Club.  The club offers an inside, peer-to-peer network of the street couture and urban skateboarding scene.  Future benefits will include discounts to local youth and athletic programs.  Get involved and join the club.

 

Added Class

The Mixtape.  We have partnered up with a series of new and upcoming artists that will be representing our FW 2012 project.  You will be able to download the mixtape at the public release of FW 2012!

The Stickers.  Each product ships with a small set of high-quality stickers for yourstickering pleasure.   

 

Project Budget of $5,750 - Is this enough?

Our project budget revolves around supplies, printing, packaging, and shipping costs.  When producing high-quality products and packaging, details really do add up!  We have ensured that we have enough allowance for contribution rewards, funding fees, and any unexpected contingencies.


 

100% Premium Cotton Tee.  Superb fit, extremely durable, The Manhattan Kids do it well with high-quality printing services and one-of-a-kind product packaging.  Our labels are of the highest quality, keeping you comfortable in our quality.  You're Welcome. 

 

30% Maple / 70% Bamboo Premium Skateboard.  The skateboard industry is the leading cause of maple deforestation.  Our skateboard is not only lighter weight and stronger than traditional maple skateboards, it also provides an everlasting POP that you cannot find anywhere else.  

 

 

Laser Engraved Mark of Quality. We are not shipping knockoff skate decks with someone else's label.  We are shipping premium goods, guaranteed with our unique laser engraving on the top-side.  Welcome to the club.


Experienced Californian Board Manufacturer

We have developed a special and very exclusive one-on-one relationship over the course of three years with a top-notch board manufacturer of green alternatives.  These decks are proven, have been distributed, and sold to demanding skaters.  Our test skaters have even come back to us and are signed onto our new waiting list.


Premium Tee Color Option


We look forward to sharing our project of creations with your support!  Thanks so much!!

Follow our new project twitter @ManhattanKids for periodic inside looks at how we are progressing our project.

TheManhattanKids.com is under construction.  It will become available in the coming weeks!

story:
What is a My Staycation Box?

Whether you love to travel, want to give a thoughtful gift to a lonely grandparent, or watching a loved one fight cancer - the gift of a vacation would be great, right? What if you just can't drop everything to go on a vacation or buy a one way ticket for a friend or loved one?  My Staycation Box can help by bringing a unique vacation experience each month through 6-8 regionally handmade products sourced from and inspired by that month's destination!  The value of products in each box range from $5-10 each and touch on each of the 5 senses making for a unique subscription box unlike any other on the market.  Also each box includes free shipping!  

(Image of 1 of 2  prototype My Staycation Boxes) 

 The Story Behind My Staycation Box?

The idea for a travel-themed box happened early 2016 when the founder's mother, Carol, received the news that she had cancer... again. Already having endured harsh chemotherapy and radiation treatments, she, and her family, thought it was all behind her. Two weeks into doing rounds of radiation treatments, it was evident she needed a break to find the strength to keep fighting. That is when founder, Michelle Sholund, had the idea of "what if we could bring a vacation to her?". Quickly realizing there are countless others who too could benefit from an escape, such as going on a vacation like caregivers, busy moms, loved ones living in using homes, to travel enthusiasts on a shoe string budget.  As an artist herself, the founder also saw this as an opportunity to help fellow artists all over the world to get their handmade products in the hands of people who would truly enjoy learning about the culture of that box's destination theme yet do not have the means to do so on their own.  From the mix of these two needs, My Staycation Box was born.

(Image of Carol opening a prototype box - Hawaiian themed)

What will be in each subscription box?

Playing off the idea of a staycation, subscribers will get to explore popular travel destinations from the comfort of their own home via 6-8 handmade products inspired from that month's destination where all products touch on all 5 senses.  In any given box subscribers can experience popular travel destinations though cd's from local musicians, small batch handmade eco-friendly candles, soaps and jewelry from regional artisans, postcards from local photographers, non perishable food and drink mixes from artisanal regional makers as well as a guide book full of info and breath taking photos about that destination.  Additionally artisans are promoted via inserts itemizing the products in the box with their website address in each of the box to encourage subscribers to buy directly from the artist if they like what they experience in the box.

(Video:  unboxing the first box shipping this December, Jamaican themed!)

(image of the insert for the December Jamaica box)

How are we getting the products for the boxes?  

The founder, Michelle Sholund, has a lot of experience working with local artisans because she is an artisan as well as ran her own gift shop featuring work from local art and crafters .  Michelle is a candle maker where her own brand of eco-friendly palm wax candles called By the Bay Botanicals are unique in that they are named after and inspired by popular travel destinations and will be included in some of the My Staycation Box boxes.  Artisans like Michelle (the founder) have a hard time getting their locally made products in the hands of people also seeking handmade regional gifts due to lack of funds and only relying on word mouth advertising such as selling at art festivals, farmers markets, or their own website.  Michelle is able to utilize her current network of artists, internet research, as well as allow subscribers to suggest artists for future boxes too. 

What will we do with the funding?

Great question!

So far we have put in...  our own money to developing the prototype which includes the box design and getting it printed and shipped to us for approval, buying a variety of products to start working with artists as well as determine what can and cannot fit in future design themed boxes.  We also have a team that tests the products for quality and desirability.  Our own funds have been used for website design, expenses to create an explainitory video, and other miscellaneous expenses that has gone into test marketing the prototype too.  

(Image:  first concept design of the box determining what size we would need, designing the graphics on the box - taking the images of the postcards and logo design into consideration, etc.)

 

Now we need additional funding... to put towards purchasing the boxes in a volume that is cost effect to fill our first months box, securing the initial first months products, internet advertising expenses such as social media ads, expenses that involve marketing to influential product reviewers, etc.  plus any other miscellaneous expenses such as storage furniture and other office supplies.

If you help us, we'll help you by...

...offering a variety of progressive rewards for Indiegogo backers who are thinking about supporting our box launch.  Here we've created a variety of rewards which include handmade post cards with a handwritten thank you note signed with a lipstick kiss, a special unisex t-shirt designed by our own graphic artist where proceeds of the t-shirt reward will go to a local charity, as well as an early bird special for our first month's box that includes an extra product just for Indiegogo supporters. Many of our reward offerings are progressive as well as offer special recognition on our website sharing with the world that you are apart of our story too.

  

 

What are some of our risks and challenges?

Finding new artisans every month is a daunting task however we are already curating items for 4 months of box themes working with handmade artists and regional small businesses from destinations we are expecting to feature in our future box destination themes.  While our standard month to month box starts at $40 and may be pricey for some price breaks will help encourage others to try a 3 month and 6 month subscription options.  Shipping within the USA is also included in the price of the box and feel many subscribers will appreciate that. Additionally the typical value of each box will range from $40-50! Currently we are fine tuning the website to make sure the subscription experience is easy to understand and navigate. We are using state of the art apps and subscription service tools to help prevent issues such as shipping and credit card confusion.

Please share our campaign!

We understand you may not be able to contribute right now, but we want to make this box go viral and you can help us by sharing this campaign with others by:

  • Reach out to your friends and family - especially those on your favorite social media networks, sharing this campaign with them to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.  
  • Follow us on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter - @Mystaycationbox 
  • Visit our website - MyStaycationBox.com
  • Use Indiegogo share tools!
  • Have questions - email us at info@mystaycationbox.com 

10/21 Campaign Update!!!

Periodically we'll be keeping our followers/backers updated with news about our funding.  Here's our first video update!  22 more days to go!

story:
A Stylish Multi-Functional Leather Case

[R] is a stylish multi-functional leather case made with genuine high-end Japanese pigskin leather. It has a superb functionality combined with an urban taste and a touch of comfort and coziness. Designed in Tokyo, it is proudly a product Made in Japan.

With the flexibility and durability of pigskin, it can be used in an occasion such as sports and various active scenes. Easy to put things in order, [R] is a smart, good-looking, and handy all-in-one case for all types of occasion.  

[R]は、純正日本産ピッグスキンを使ったシンプルでスタイリッシュな薄型多機能ケースです。優れた機能性に加えておしゃれで、身につけて心地良いファッション性を大切にしています。デザイン、素材、縫製、そしてものづくりの心意気まで全て日本製です。

柔軟性と強度を持つ豚革だから、スポーツやアクティブなシーンでも活躍します。整理しやすく、スマートに、格好良く、男女を問わず、フォーマルにもカジュアルにもR一つでどこにでも行けるような財布を目指しました。

 

  />

 [ R ] for the Beauty of Roundness 

[R] is designed with a unique roundness to express its beauty of both elegance and usability. We created the form that looks distinct and yet maximizing the use of ease.

We put many ideas into the structural design:  to provide a smooth user experience and to keep its shape nicely.

デザインは[R]の名称の由来の一つでもある曲線美（the beauty of roundness）を生かし、今までにない優美な趣を表現しつつ、使い勝手を最大限に高めています。また、随所に細やかな配慮を施し、自然な動線と型崩れを起こさないデザインとなっています。

 Innovative water-repellent suede

[R] is using an innovative water-repellent suede, a unique and beautiful leather material processed by Sankei Sangyo, a seasoned tannery in Sumida, Tokyo with more than 85 years of history. 

The newly developed water-repellent suede keeps its soft touch and brilliant color while protecting from the water almost permanently. It's an innovative material never seen before, providing a combination of both elegance and durability.

外を包む美しいスエードは、85年以上の伝統と技術を伝える東京都墨田区の革工場である株式会社三恵産業が、独自に編み出した手法によって、その柔らかな手触り、鮮やかな発色と撥水性を両立させることに成功したもので、今までにない気品と耐久性を備えています。

Using tanned pigskin for inner compartment

We made the inner compartment with tanned pigskin, a leather dyed with natural coloring. It will gradually show a unique seasoning and charm as years pass by. 

内側の仕切りは、自然の着色料で染色したエコでナチュラルな「ヌメ革」を使用し、使うほどに味わいが出る個性豊かな仕様になっています。

 

A Thin Design: height =0.4 inch (1 cm)

The case is designed to be thin, a height of 0.4 inches (1 cm). It matches with all kinds of the scene in the daily life. It doesn't choose a style of cloth or dress, and it can be used for both formal and casual occasions.

奥行き1センチの薄さとデザインは、着ている服やスタイルを選ばず、あらゆる生活のシーンにマッチし、フォーマルでもカジュアルでも合わせてくれます。

ジャケットの内ポケットへ入れても、ジャケットのラインを崩さず、 ポケットに入れても、Rの曲線で動線を妨げません。

Various ideas are applied to prevent users from overloading the case. It's a light, compact, and multi-functional case for a short outing: fits well in a bag or a pocket.

過度にモノを入れることのないように随所に工夫があり、ちょっとしたお出かけに持ち歩いても重くなく、カバンの中に入れてもスッキリと収まるオールラウンド・プレーヤーです。

 Unique Inner Compartment

Inside the case is divided into three sections with a partition with various holders in the middle. Free spaces on both sides are designed to put smartphones and bills. Various holders in the middle section are used to put coins, cards, SD cards, and a key.

ケースの内部は、中心のポケット群を挟んで３つの部分に分かれています。両サイドは、スマートフォンや紙幣を出し入れできるようなフリースペースで、中心のポケット群は、小銭やカード、SDカードや鍵などを整理して収めることができるように様々な工夫が凝らされています。

 

 

ABOUT ROOP DESIGN

Roop is a Bengal word of "beauty." It is widely used for girl's name in South Asian countries. We named our new brand as we loved its charming sound and the meaning it represents. 

Roop（ループ）とは、ベンガル語で「美しい」を意味する言葉で、インドでは女の子の名前としても人気があるそうです。その素敵な言葉の響きと「R」という文字への私たちの特別の思いも重なって、Roop Designというお洒落な名前のブランドを立ち上げることにしました。

And we have a special feeling on the alphabet "R" which relates to words such as respect, reliance, and relationship. We treasure these words as they are the foundation of the culture we embrace: a long history of collaboration and mutual respect among small factories in Tokyo.

「R」の文字には、私たちが大切にしているたくさんの言葉が連なっています。お互いを敬う尊敬（respect）、信頼（reliance）、確かな関係（relationship）など。こうした言葉は、小さな町工場がお互いの技術、経験への敬意と信頼関係で協力しあう姿に重なりあい、私たちの心に深く響くのです。 

Smart & Multi-Functional

[R] is a multi-functional leather case which you can use as a wallet as well as a small bag to carry. Although the height is only 0.4 inches, it has plenty of capacity to contain things nicely.

You can put your iPhone, even a Plus series of iPhone, a passport, a key, ten cards, ten dollar bills, fifteen coins, and ten receipts and it will only be less than an inch. Carry [R] with you anytime and anywhere.

[R]は、薄型の多機能ケースで、わずか1 cmの薄さながら、十分な収納力を誇ります。

スマートフォン、パスポート、鍵、カードを１０枚、紙幣を１０枚、コインを１５枚、レシートを１０枚入れても、２cm程の厚みで、スマートにいつでもどこでも持ち運びができます。スマートフォンは、大型のiPhone6、7、8のPlusシリーズも余裕を持って収納できます。

 

Innovative Water-Repellent Suede

[R] is using a unique water-repellent pigskin suede developed by Sankei Sangyo, a traditional tannery in Sumida, Tokyo with more than 85 years of history. 

Suede is a favorite material for its pleasant touch and luxurious feeling, but it is weak to water as it gets stained and dirty when it gets wet. Previously, it was protected by coating the surface, but it was temporary treatment. This newly developed suede has its fibers soaked into the water-repellent agent in the coloring process so that the effect will be almost permanent.

Thanks to this innovative water-repellent suede, we are now able to produce all-weather suede leather case.

[R]は、東京都墨田区で85年以上の歴史を誇る三恵産業株式会社が開発した撥水スエードを外側に使用しています。

スエードは、心地良い肌さわりと高級感をもち、人気が高い素材ですが、水分が付着すると吸収し、シミになりやすく、汚れやすいという弱点を持ちます。従来、表面にコーティングすることで一時的に撥水性を持たせていましたが、本撥水スエードは、染色工程において繊維の奥深くまで撥水剤を染み込ませているため、撥水効果が半永久的に持続します。

これにより、スエードの利点を損なわず、メンテナンスが楽で、どんな天候でも外で使用できる多機能ケースを実現することができました。

 

Useful Inner compartment

The bottom of the coin space is stitched in a curved so that it is easy to take out the coins and see the inside. This curve prevents the space to be overloaded as well. The cardholder holds the cards vertically which allows the user to handle them without a hassle. We also add an "access tab" to secondary cardholder so that the user can take out the cards smoothly. 

小銭入れ部分の底は曲線で縫製を行い、使いやすさと、見やすさ、 底部分の膨らみを抑える設計にしています。カードの収納を縦にすることで、スムーズな出し入れを可能にしました。アクセスタブをつけ、カードの出し入れを簡単にするアイデアも取り入れています。

We will use tanned leather for the inner compartment. It keeps the beauty and the gloss of genuine leather. And the color will be seasoned as the time pass by. The color will be brown, a color specially ordered for [R]. 

内装には、ヌメ革を使用します。ベジタブルタンニンなめしを施し、革本来の美しさと光沢感、経年変化を味わえるもので、強度を持たせる為に型押しを施しています。色はRoop design特注のブラウンになります。

Fastener and Hand Stitches

We used a high-end YKK fastener and put hand stitches on places where the load is high. 

YKK製の高級ファスナーを使用し、負荷がかかりやすい箇所にはハンドステッチを施しました。

There are 2 colors,handle leather

Body color BLACK,NAVY,BROWN / Black leather
Body color NATURAL,GRAY,RED,KHAKI / Natural leather

ハンドルの引き手は、２色あり、
本体がBLACK,NAVY,BROWNには、ヌメ革のBLACKのレザー
本体がNATURAL,GRAY,RED,KHAKIには、ヌメ革のNATURALのレザーが付きます。

Protection on the corner

We put a specially polished metal part on the corner of the case to protect it from wearing out.

もっとも擦れやすいケースの角を保護するため、特別の研磨を施した金具を取り付けています。

There are 2 colors.Polished metal part.
Body color Black,Navy,Brown / Black metal
Body color  Natural,Gray,Red,Khaki / Brass metal
研磨加工を施した金具は、２色あります。
本体が、BLACK,NAVY,BROWNにはBLACK
NATURAL,GRAY,RED,KHAKIには真鍮ゴールドが付きます。


Special Rivet to reinforce the durability

To reinforce the durability, we used a special rivet to spots where the threads get loose. And to keep the case thin and make the friction minimum, we scraped the rivet's surface and made it as thin as possible.

ほつれが発生しやすい部分に、カシメを打ち強度を増しています。 薄さを維持することと表の革への影響を最小限に抑える為、カシメの表面を削り、厚みを抑える加工を施しています。

Sewn by seasoned craftsmen

[R] is sewn by seasoned craftsmen in Tokyo. Each one is handmade and produced with ultimate care and Japanese craftsmanship.

縫製は、墨田区で３０年以上の歴史を誇る、革を専門とする町工場で行なっています。 有名ブランドの革製品の修理なども多く手がける技術力、経験を持った信頼出来る工場です。

 

Sankei Sangyo Co., Ltd. is a pigskin tannery based in Sumida, Tokyo with more than 85 years of history. It has an integrated operation of tanning, coloring, and processing pigskin, accumulating profound skills and years of experience and trust in the industry. 

三恵産業株式会社は、東京都墨田区で85年以上の歴史を誇る豚革を専門にする革工場です。長年築き上げてきた技術と信頼をもとにピッグスキンの鞣し、染色・加工を一貫しており、その高い技術力は高く評価されています。

Pigskin is produced more than 100% in Japan. Sumida, Tokyo is the largest tannery cluster in Japan, producing 90% of the Japanese pigskin. Sankei Sangyo is the largest producer in the industry having a factory in Sumida as well as one in Himeji, Hyogo. 

豚革（ピッグスキン）は、日本国内で自給自足できる唯一の革素材です。東京都墨田区は、日本国内のピッグスキンの90%の生産量を誇る一大生産地であり、中でも三恵産業は墨田区の工場に加え、兵庫県姫路市にも工場を持地、最も多く豚革を生産しています。

Thanks to sophisticated skills and knowhows of Japanese tanneries, the quality of Japanese pigskin is known as a world's top class. As one of the leaders in the industry, Sankei Sangyo has continuously worked for better quality and endeavored for new development. 

The strength of the Sankei Sangyo is in the coloring and finishing. The variation, vividness, and stableness of the colors they can produce are amazing. 

日本の革工場の洗練された技術やノウハウによって、日本製のピッグスキンは世界の最高水準の品質を誇っています。中でも業界を先導する１社として、三恵産業はたゆまぬ品質改善と新製品開発に取り組み続けています。

同社が特に優れているのは染色と仕上げ加工です。染めることのできる色の多彩さ、鮮やかさ、そしてその品質を安定的に維持できる技術力は、他の追随を許さないものがあります。

 

 The water-repellent suede developed by the company is exceptionally innovative. It is challenging to conduct coloring and treat water-repellent at the same time. It requires a high skill of craftsmanship and years of experience.

The mastery craftsmen adjust the combination of coloring and water-repellent agent according to the weather and moisture in the factory, which is something no other factory can emulate.

同社が開発した撥水加工スエードは、特に画期的な技術です。染色と撥水加工を同時に行うことは非常に難しく、職人の技術と長年の経験によって、初めて実現できました。

天候や湿度などの諸条件に合わせながら、微妙に配合の調整を加えながら染色と撥水加工を行うもので、ここに他社が容易にマネのできない同社の強みがあります。

Roop Design is founded and operated by Miyoko and Takayuki Takagi, a husband and wife, a parent of three lovely children, and a resident of Katsushika, Tokyo.  Miyoko, a lifestyle designer, has become interested in creating/producing new lifestyle products to the global market combining Japanese craftsmanship and aesthetic. Together with her husband, a fashion designer, and producer, Roop Design is aiming to deliver a new concept and value of the future.

Roop Designを運営するのは、葛飾区に在住の高城家族です。ライフスタイルデザイナーであるMiyokoは、日本の優れた技術や感性を生かした製品をデザインしプロデュースすることに高い興味と関心を持っており、ファッションデザイナーでプロデユーサーでもある高城貴幸とともに、世界に新しいライフスタイルと価値を広げて行くことを目的に、家族で取り組んでいます。

TOKYO FABHUB is a strategic partner of Roop Design. TOKYO FABHUB works to produce new business in Japan and beyond with strategic alliance with small factories in Tokyo. It works with Roop Design to develop a global business to deliver its vision and products.

Webpage: www.tokyofabhub.com

TOKYO町工場HUBは、Roop Designのパートナーとして共に事業構築に取り組んでいます。東京の主に城東地域（足立区、葛飾区、墨田区など）の町工場と組み、国内外で新しいビジネスをプロデュースすることを目的に、様々な活動を展開しています。Roop Designのビジョンや製品を世界に展開するための戦略づくりとコミュニケーションを担当しています。

ホームページ：www.tokyo-fabhub.com

 

Roop Design has decided to challenge crowdfunding with Indiegogo to share the fascination of skill and products of small Japanese factories to the world. We would like to listen to the feedback as well.

We will use the funds to order a specially tanned leather for the inner compartment. And we will make a mold to reduce the price of the product so that more people can afford quality products made in Japan. 

Some of the finds will be used to develop a new website in English as well.

日本の小さな町工場の持ってる魅力を、世界へ発信したいと思います。日本も含め、世界の人々の反応もぜひ知りたいと考えています。

資金は、特注のヌメ革の調達に使用します。また、金型を作成し、工賃を抑えることで、単価を引き下げ、将来、より多くの方々に[R]をご購入いただけるようにしたいと思っています。

Roop designのホームページを作成し、英語版も作りたいと思います。

 

 

 

Remarks: The color and appearance of the leather may differ slightly from the photo shown above as characteristic of the pigskin is different from piece to piece.

It has a superb functionality combined with an urban taste and a touch of comfort and coziness. Designed in Tokyo, it is proudly a product Made in Japan.With the flexibility and durability of pigskin, it can be used in an occasion such as sports and various active scenes. Easy to put things in order, [R] is a smart, good-looking, and handy all-in-one case for all types of occasion.  [R]は、純正日本産ピッグスキンを使ったシンプルでスタイリッシュな薄型多機能ケースです。優れた機能性に加えておしゃれで、身につけて心地良いファッション性を大切にしています。デザイン、素材、縫製、そしてものづくりの心意気まで全て日本製です。柔軟性と強度を持つ豚革だから、スポーツやアクティブなシーンでも活躍します。整理しやすく、スマートに、格好良く、男女を問わず、フォーマルにもカジュアルにもR一つでどこにでも行けるような財布を目指しました。   />
 [ R ] for the Beauty of Roundness [R] is designed with a unique roundness to express its beauty of both elegance and usability. We created the form that looks distinct and yet maximizing the use of ease.We put many ideas into the structural design:  to provide a smooth user experience and to keep its shape nicely.デザインは[R]の名称の由来の一つでもある曲線美（the beauty of roundness）を生かし、今までにない優美な趣を表現しつつ、使い勝手を最大限に高めています。また、随所に細やかな配慮を施し、自然な動線と型崩れを起こさないデザインとなっています。 Innovative water-repellent suede[R] is using an innovative water-repellent suede, a unique and beautiful leather material processed by Sankei Sangyo, a seasoned tannery in Sumida, Tokyo with more than 85 years of history. The newly developed water-repellent suede keeps its soft touch and brilliant color while protecting from the water almost permanently. It keeps the beauty and the gloss of genuine leather. And the color will be seasoned as the time pass by. The color will be brown, a color specially ordered for [R]. 内装には、ヌメ革を使用します。ベジタブルタンニンなめしを施し、革本来の美しさと光沢感、経年変化を味わえるもので、強度を持たせる為に型押しを施しています。色はRoop design特注のブラウンになります。Fastener and Hand StitchesWe used a high-end YKK fastener and put hand stitches on places where the load is high. YKK製の高級ファスナーを使用し、負荷がかかりやすい箇所にはハンドステッチを施しました。There are 2 colors,handle leatherBody color BLACK,NAVY,BROWN / Black leatherBody color NATURAL,GRAY,RED,KHAKI / Natural leatherハンドルの引き手は、２色あり、本体がBLACK,NAVY,BROWNには、ヌメ革のBLACKのレザー本体がNATURAL,GRAY,RED,KHAKIには、ヌメ革のNATURALのレザーが付きます。Protection on the cornerWe put a specially polished metal part on the corner of the case to protect it from wearing out.もっとも擦れやすいケースの角を保護するため、特別の研磨を施した金具を取り付けています。There are 2 colors.Polished metal part.Body color Black,Navy,Brown / Black metalBody color  Natural,Gray,Red,Khaki / Brass metal研磨加工を施した金具は、２色あります。本体が、BLACK,NAVY,BROWNにはBLACKNATURAL,GRAY,RED,KHAKIには真鍮ゴールドが付きます。
Special Rivet to reinforce the durability
To reinforce the durability, we used a special rivet to spots where the threads get loose. And to keep the case thin and make the friction minimum, we scraped the rivet's surface and made it as thin as possible.ほつれが発生しやすい部分に、カシメを打ち強度を増しています。 薄さを維持することと表の革への影響を最小限に抑える為、カシメの表面を削り、厚みを抑える加工を施しています。Sewn by seasoned craftsmen[R] is sewn by seasoned craftsmen in Tokyo. Each one is handmade and produced with ultimate care and Japanese craftsmanship.縫製は、墨田区で３０年以上の歴史を誇る、革を専門とする町工場で行なっています。 有名ブランドの革製品の修理なども多く手がける技術力、経験を持った信頼出来る工場です。 Sankei Sangyo Co., Ltd. is a pigskin tannery based in Sumida, Tokyo with more than 85 years of history. It has an integrated operation of tanning, coloring, and processing pigskin, accumulating profound skills and years of experience and trust in the industry. 三恵産業株式会社は、東京都墨田区で85年以上の歴史を誇る豚革を専門にする革工場です。長年築き上げてきた技術と信頼をもとにピッグスキンの鞣し、染色・加工を一貫しており、その高い技術力は高く評価されています。Pigskin is produced more than 100% in Japan. Sumida, Tokyo is the largest tannery cluster in Japan, producing 90% of the Japanese pigskin. Sankei Sangyo is the largest producer in the industry having a factory in Sumida as well as one in Himeji, Hyogo. 豚革（ピッグスキン）は、日本国内で自給自足できる唯一の革素材です。東京都墨田区は、日本国内のピッグスキンの90%の生産量を誇る一大生産地であり、中でも三恵産業は墨田区の工場に加え、兵庫県姫路市にも工場を持地、最も多く豚革を生産しています。Thanks to sophisticated skills and knowhows of Japanese tanneries, the quality of Japanese pigskin is known as a world's top class. As one of the leaders in the industry, Sankei Sangyo has continuously worked for better quality and endeavored for new development. The strength of the Sankei Sangyo is in the coloring and finishing. The variation, vividness, and stableness of the colors they can produce are amazing. 日本の革工場の洗練された技術やノウハウによって、日本製のピッグスキンは世界の最高水準の品質を誇っています。中でも業界を先導する１社として、三恵産業はたゆまぬ品質改善と新製品開発に取り組み続けています。同社が特に優れているのは染色と仕上げ加工です。染めることのできる色の多彩さ、鮮やかさ、そしてその品質を安定的に維持できる技術力は、他の追随を許さないものがあります。  The water-repellent suede developed by the company is exceptionally innovative. It is challenging to conduct coloring and treat water-repellent at the same time. It requires a high skill of craftsmanship and years of experience.The mastery craftsmen adjust the combination of coloring and water-repellent agent according to the weather and moisture in the factory, which is something no other factory can emulate.同社が開発した撥水加工スエードは、特に画期的な技術です。染色と撥水加工を同時に行うことは非常に難しく、職人の技術と長年の経験によって、初めて実現できました。天候や湿度などの諸条件に合わせながら、微妙に配合の調整を加えながら染色と撥水加工を行うもので、ここに他社が容易にマネのできない同社の強みがあります。Roop Design is founded and operated by Miyoko and Takayuki Takagi, a husband and wife, a parent of three lovely children, and a resident of Katsushika, Tokyo.  Miyoko, a lifestyle designer, has become interested in creating/producing new lifestyle products to the global market combining Japanese craftsmanship and aesthetic. Together with her husband, a fashion designer, and producer, Roop Design is aiming to deliver a new concept and value of the future.Roop Designを運営するのは、葛飾区に在住の高城家族です。ライフスタイルデザイナーであるMiyokoは、日本の優れた技術や感性を生かした製品をデザインしプロデュースすることに高い興味と関心を持っており、ファッションデザイナーでプロデユーサーでもある高城貴幸とともに、世界に新しいライフスタイルと価値を広げて行くことを目的に、家族で取り組んでいます。TOKYO FABHUB is a strategic partner of Roop Design. TOKYO FABHUB works to produce new business in Japan and beyond with strategic alliance with small factories in Tokyo. It works with Roop Design to develop a global business to deliver its vision and products.Webpage: www.tokyofabhub.comTOKYO町工場HUBは、Roop Designのパートナーとして共に事業構築に取り組んでいます。東京の主に城東地域（足立区、葛飾区、墨田区など）の町工場と組み、国内外で新しいビジネスをプロデュースすることを目的に、様々な活動を展開しています。Roop Designのビジョンや製品を世界に展開するための戦略づくりとコミュニケーションを担当しています。ホームページ：www.tokyo-fabhub.com Roop Design has decided to challenge crowdfunding with Indiegogo to share the fascination of skill and products of small Japanese factories to the world. We would like to listen to the feedback as well.We will use the funds to order a specially tanned leather for the inner compartment. And we will make a mold to reduce the price of the product so that more people can afford quality products made in Japan. Some of the finds will be used to develop a new website in English as well.日本の小さな町工場の持ってる魅力を、世界へ発信したいと思います。日本も含め、世界の人々の反応もぜひ知りたいと考えています。資金は、特注のヌメ革の調達に使用します。また、金型を作成し、工賃を抑えることで、単価を引き下げ、将来、より多くの方々に[R]をご購入いただけるようにしたいと思っています。Roop designのホームページを作成し、英語版も作りたいと思います。   Remarks: The color and appearance of the leather may differ slightly from the photo shown above as characteristic of the pigskin is different from piece to piece.

story:
September 2016 Update: ThermalTech jackets are now available under the Narvik Works brand at narvikworks.com!

 

Wrap the sun's warmth around you with ThermalTech, a groundbreaking jacket that will increase your body temperature up to 20°F  in just two minutes using the energy of the sun without adding bulky layers! This is the biggest innovation to hit fashion in years! These amazing jackets will keep you warmer longer allowing you to do the things you love the most in the outdoors.

Never freeze for fashion ever again! ThermalTech jackets are breathable, waterproof and slim down the traditional bulky winter look. Stay toasty warm while you go about your normal outdoor activities such as shopping, walking around town, or running errands. We even have jackets that will keep away jack frost during activities such as hiking, jogging, camping and snowboarding, No matter the activity, our three different jackets have you covered!

 

 

 

ThermalTech fabric is easily embeddable into almost any clothing style and material, with the following key features:

 

 

 

You will be the first to wrap yourself up in the warmth of the sun with our jackets with ThermalTech built in! Available in both Men and Women cuts, we have the following jacket collections: Street (perfect for running errands around town or a night out on the town), Explorer (great for campers, hikers and fishing) and Extreme (ideal companion for snowboarding and skiing). Each style will be available in several popular colors and sizes S, M, L, XL and XXL. The jackets are also under a one year warranty.

 

 

Utilizing patented, lightweight energy absorbing fabric technology, ThermalTech fabric is designed to capture the sun’s ultraviolet rays (as well as energy from artificial light sources) and transform them into heat to warm wearers up to an additional 18F in a matter of minutes. 

 

 

The stainless steel mesh fabric threads are strong yet lightweight, lending to extended lifetime use, while it's paper-thin design reduces the additional weight that heat-storing materials typically bring to outerwear.

 We have created a line of light-weight, stylish, durable, and waterproof outerwear jackets with the ThermalTech smart fabric built in! Whether you're heading out into the woods, getting to an important meeting, or hanging out with your friends, jackets powered by ThermalTech will keep you warm and looking stylish while on the go!

 

 

 

 

 

STRETCH GOAL #1 - $50,000 USD - ADDITION OF INNER GLOVES AND BOTTLE HOLDER

 

If we meet our $50,000 goal, we will add inner gloves to the jacket perks*. The inner gloves feature a stretchy thumb-loop made with Spandex and Polyamide to keep your hands extra toasty. 

*Men-street jackets will not be not included this feature.

We will also include with every jacket a bottle holder to effortlessly hold your bottles (whatever you’re drinking) to leave your hands free. The bottle holder will consist of a wide elastic strip inside the jackets at the level of the handwarmer pockets to keep and prevent spillage. Fits most normal 17oz bottle sizes. (all jackets)

 

 

 

STRETCH GOAL #2 - $100,000 USD - ADDITION OF MOBILE CHARGER WITH EXTRA CUSTOM INNER JACKET POCKET

 

If we meet our $100,000 goal, everyone who buys a jacket will get a mobile charger integrated into the jackets so wearers can charge their phone while enjoying their outdoor activities. The ThermalTech jackets will have an extra pocket added within the cell phone pocket to keep it safe and secure from all movement. Please note that the mobile charger is not charged by the jacket and is a separate USB charger. 

 

Mobile charger pocket specs:

 

•80*35*5mm

•Weight: 80g

•Input 5V 1 A (DC)

•Output DC 5V 1 A

•Battery type: Polymer

•for IPhone MP3/MP4/Samsung/HTC

•Special pocket to carry on in thermaltech jackets.

 

ThermalTech was co-founded by Carlos Cortes Manica and Fatima Rocha Arguelles with the goal to "impact people's life positively through technology". We started out making solar technology for solar water heater industry and were always inventing new ways to use materials related to solar. 

 

 

 

ThermalTech's group of seven passionate engineers is lead by one of the best scientists in Mexico. She recently won the Mexico National Science Academy award! Her PHD thesis on solar coatings combined with the group's passion for finding new ways to harness the sun's energy is the basis for ThermalTech! 

 

Today ThermalTech is patented in over 10 Countries! We've been trying to find a good home for our technology for the last few years. Last year, everything changed when we were awarded first place over 1,000 contestants as Best Technological Start Up at the Global Entrepreneurship Summit in Morocco.

 

 

That helps us to meet incredible people including Dr. Jill Biden (Joe Biden's wife), Secretary Penny Prizker, and Small Business Director Maria Contreras-Sweet. It's through their encouragement and insistence that we take our "neat idea" and make it into a reality, which is why we started this campaign! 

 

 

 

What happens at night?
Tests have proven that in addition to harnessing energy from sunlight or artificial light, ThermalTech also has the ability to reflect your own body heat. This happens because of Infrared light, that cannot by seen by the human eye. The undetectable light can  be transformed into heat. So when the sun goes to bed, ThermalTech works as a shield between the environment and while your body turns UV and Infrared light into additional body heat.

Does it work on cloudy days?
Yes!

What sizes are available? 
Currently they are available in sizes S - XXL in Mens and Womens.

Are the jackets under warranty?
Yes there is a one year warranty.

How does the jacket prevent overheating?
The ThermalTech smart fabric prevents overheating by maintaining the temperature once the wearer reaches the optimal body temp. This is the same principal as how the body cools itself while exercising. At some point your body starts to expel and radiate the surplus of energy being created; the same happens with ThermalTech, its smart fabric technology understands when is time to expel energy once it had enough from the sun or artificial light.

Are they going to be machine washable or do they need to be dry-cleaned?Thermaltech is made of a finest stainless steel yarn which is thinner than two sheet of paper. It is machine washable, however for longer lasting jacket, advise not using bleach.Thermaltech has a long lifespan due its stainless steel material and its solar selective coating technology is not affected by being washed.

 

Do the jackets wrinkle when balled up?
We designed the jacket to travel with you anywhere -- on a long flight or packed in your backpack. The ThermalTech fabric is pliable and able to be squished and scrunched. 

Are the jackets waterproof?
We use different fabrics in each of our collection, however all of them have water proof properties. Jackets are best in the light rain or with melting snow while skiing or snowboarding. 

When do I choose my jacket color and size?
At the end of the campaign we will reach out to you where you will choose the color and size of the jacket you purchased.

How do I get in touch with your team?  
You can message us on here or email us at contact@thermaltechfabric.com.

How do I upgrade my perk?
https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles...

I’m having trouble claiming a perk. Who should I reach out to?
Email support@indiegogo.com.

I would like a refund. How do I do this?
https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/213172367

What is the exchange policy?

The final date to request an exchange is the 30th of November, 2016. As of November 15th , we will be unable to process returns and refunds.

story:
An All or Nothing project

About Project

Hey there! I'm Hannah/Haebi (hey-bee) of Studio Haebi. I've had these designs for enamel pins for some time now but was only able to make Usagi into a pin (She's already for sale in my shop, link below). I need your help in funding my Sailor Emoji collection so that all of them can become enamel pins!

Update: Here are the Finished Enamel Pins!

Thank you so much for the support you have given this campaign! Here is a photo of the Sailor Emojis set which has been sent and already received by the backers!

 

Shipping Process and Proof:

The campaign pledges were shipped out too the backers last January 8, 2018, as advised/announced in Update #7 of this campaign page. 

Photo on left: Bubble mailers with pins ready for transfer to courier
Photo on center: Bubble mailers with pin pledges being weighed and marked by the post office clerk.
Photo on right: Design at the back of the bubble mailers

Disclaimer

I do not own any of the Sailor Moon characters. These characters are owned by Naoko Takeuchi. These designs are my fan art of Sailor Moon characters drawn in my art style. 

Find Me

For other updates, or if you are interested in seeing what I have so far, you can find me on:

  • IG: @studiohaebi
  • Shop: studiohaebi.storenvy.com

story:
• A performance jacket that blocks out harsh winds and rain while providing essential warmth.
  • A jacket with a stylish and trendy trench coat design that matches both business and casual looks.
  • A jacket that can be worn in 3 seasons (featuring a detachable inner jacket)
  • A jacket made from eco-friendly fabrics.
  • A jacket with multiple and spacious pockets.

Zerod comes in 3 colors – 

  • Honey
  • Black Navy
  •  Fog Grey [Unlocked]
  •  Charcoal [Unlocked]

 

 

 

 

Zerod is laminated with a soft-shell (outer fabric), TPU/membrane (in between) and fleece (inner fabric) to block out harsh winds and rain while providing essential warmth.

TPU (membrane)：WP/MP 20,000/20,000 (JIS)

We are using an Eco Bionic coating (PFC Free coating) which repels water with no added chemicals. (PFCs are frequently used as durable water-repellent (DWR), which actually contain fluorocarbons or PFCs that have been shown to be a hormone disruptor.)

PFC Free Coating + Membrane = keeps you dry for over an hour, even in heavy rain.

 

We have also made the outer shell extremely soft to make it both look and feel like a trench coat.

 

 

FABRIC INDEX 

[40D%88%nylon12%spandex weave fabric +TPU +100%poly polar fleece] 

Actually, we are the first design team to add another 2.5 layers within the same jacket as a lining, making the Zerod a unique 3+2.5 layer jacket.

We are not the first ones to apply graphene technology to a jacket. However, we are definitely the first one to bring it to the market at the lowest price.

 

OK, this is not a magic! The light bulb presentation demonstrates the membrane, which is made from graphene.

 

 

Although Graphene is highly conductive, the graphene membrane is 100% safe. It’s the perfect solution to protect against electrostatic discharges (Anti-Static), especially in cold and dry weather.

 

 

 

Graphene is one of the natural methods used to regulate skin temperature and increase it [in chilly/cold temperatures] or decrease it [in warm/hot temperatures] by an average of 2°C. It does this by evenly spreading heat from the warmer parts of your body like your chest and back to the other colder parts. It'll make you "feel warmer" in chilly/cold temperatures while you'll "feel cooler" in warm/hot temperature.  

Sweat contains bacteria that quickly grows and makes the clothes smell. Inherently, graphene is bacteriostatic, which means bacteria can’t grow or reproduce on its surface, giving Zerod anti-bacteria and anti-odor properties.

FABRIC INDEX

[50D 100 %polyester Interlock double fabric+Graphene TPU]  

In total, Zerod has 10 pockets, allowing users to carry extra items and making it very convenient to wear:

The removable hood adds extra protection during bad weather and can be easily taken off to transform Zerod into a trench coat.

We also designed the hood zip to make it “invisible” to give more of a trench coat look when you wear Zerod with the stand-up collar without the hood. (You can’t see the zipper on the collar).

To bring extra warmth, Zerod comes with a detachable inner down jacket which you can easily zip on or off the Zerod, or even wear it separately.

We have elegantly designed the inner jacket, from the inside to the outside, so that it outperforms most of the ultra-light jackets on the market.

 

100% Animal Free & Eco-friendly

 

“THERMOLITE® T-Down EcoMade insulation provides the Active-Outdoor industry with a compelling new generation of recycled synthetic fiber engineered for down replacement. THERMOLITE® T-Down EcoMade insulation is GRS approved and made from 100% recycled PET fiber.”

Warmer & Better

Waterproof & Down Proof

This may sound crazy, but we have even integrated the PFC Free Coating, the (20k/20k) Membrane, into the inner jacket to make it water-resistant, waterproof and down-proof.

Moreover, the whole jacket is seam taping.

FABRIC INDEX

400T Nylon Taffeta+TPU+Thermalite EcoMade

Labels Speaks Louder Than Words 

Indeed! What you see is what you get. 

  •  Bluesign approved [Highest level of consumer safety]

- Produced with a minimum impact on people and the environment;

- Made from approved chemical products and raw material.

  • REPREVE

- MADE FROM RECYCLED PLASTIC BOTTLES

  •  THERMOLITE EcoMade 

- Insulation that is made from a minimum of 35% recycled resources such as plastic bottles.

Sizing Info

  • Please take measures with a slim fit/regular fit t-shirt, or something you normally wear under a jacket. DO NOT wear a jacket while you are measuring.
  • The sizing chart is for your body measures [not the jacket measures].

Tips

  • Slim Fit: Add 2'' to your body measures [Chest, Waist and Hips].
  • Regular Fit: Add 4'' to your body measures [Chest, Waist and Hips].
  • Loose Fit: Add 6'' to your body measures [Chest, Waist and Hips].

How to Measure [Chest/Bust, Waist, Hips and Sleeve]

- Sleeve: Comfortably bend your arm [about 90 degrees] and measure from the shoulder [along the outer side of your arm] to the wrist.   

For the rest of measures, there is nothing particular. You can check with any YouTube videos if you have any questions. Make sure your tape measure is straight and snug around the body. DO NOT pull it tight [We are not selling underwear :-) ].

- Chest / Bust

- Waist

- Hips

Jacket Length 

 WASH & CARE INSTRUCTIONS

TEAM

At Texlab, we partner with the world’s leading textile suppliers and integrate cutting-edge technology into our superbly designed products. The Zerod idea actually originated from the wardrobe of Kevin, who’s an entrepreneur as well as an outdoor enthusiast. He had half filled up his wardrobe with trench coat jackets, which he used for business, and half with performance jackets which were for his hobbies and daily use. The problem was that his trench coats couldn’t handle the extra cold, or heavy rain, when he was out for business, whereas, in the meantime, the performance jackets did not match the suit and tie look and made him look unprofessional. We were also inspired by the detachable liners of the performance jackets and integrated that design into the Zerod, making it a performance jacket with a trench coat look, and which can be worn in Spring, Fall and Winter.

This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1000+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $430M raised between them.

Zerod Demonstration Video

 If you have any questions, feel free to take a look at the demonstration video or check out the FAQs. Thanks for your support!
story_txt:
A performance jacket that blocks out harsh winds and rain while providing essential warmth.
A jacket with a stylish and trendy trench coat design that matches both business and casual looks.
A jacket that can be worn in 3 seasons (featuring a detachable inner jacket)
A jacket made from eco-friendly fabrics.
A jacket with multiple and spacious pockets.

 
 
 Zerod comes in 3 colors – 
Honey
Black Navy
 Fog Grey [Unlocked]
 Charcoal [Unlocked]
  
  
  
 Zerod is laminated with a soft-shell (outer fabric), TPU/membrane (in between) and fleece (inner fabric) to block out harsh winds and rain while providing essential warmth.TPU (membrane)：WP/MP 20,000/20,000 (JIS)
 
 We are using an Eco Bionic coating (PFC Free coating) which repels water with no added chemicals. (PFCs are frequently used as durable water-repellent (DWR), which actually contain fluorocarbons or PFCs that have been shown to be a hormone disruptor.)PFC Free Coating + Membrane = keeps you dry for over an hour, even in heavy rain.

 
We have also made the outer shell extremely soft to make it both look and feel like a trench coat.  FABRIC INDEX [40D%88%nylon12%spandex weave fabric +TPU +100%poly polar fleece] 
 Actually, we are the first design team to add another 2.5 layers within the same jacket as a lining, making the Zerod a unique 3+2.5 layer jacket.
 We are not the first ones to apply graphene technology to a jacket. However, we are definitely the first one to bring it to the market at the lowest price. OK, this is not a magic! The light bulb presentation demonstrates the membrane, which is made from graphene.  Although Graphene is highly conductive, the graphene membrane is 100% safe. It’s the perfect solution to protect against electrostatic discharges (Anti-Static), especially in cold and dry weather.  
  Graphene is one of the natural methods used to regulate skin temperature and increase it [in chilly/cold temperatures] or decrease it [in warm/hot temperatures] by an average of 2°C. It does this by evenly spreading heat from the warmer parts of your body like your chest and back to the other colder parts. It'll make you "feel warmer" in chilly/cold temperatures while you'll "feel cooler" in warm/hot temperature.  
 
 
 Sweat contains bacteria that quickly grows and makes the clothes smell. Inherently, graphene is bacteriostatic, which means bacteria can’t grow or reproduce on its surface, giving Zerod anti-bacteria and anti-odor properties.
 FABRIC INDEX[50D 100 %polyester Interlock double fabric+Graphene TPU]  
 
 In total, Zerod has 10 pockets, allowing users to carry extra items and making it very convenient to wear:
 
 
 
 The removable hood adds extra protection during bad weather and can be easily taken off to transform Zerod into a trench coat.
 
 We also designed the hood zip to make it “invisible” to give more of a trench coat look when you wear Zerod with the stand-up collar without the hood. (You can’t see the zipper on the collar).
 
 
 To bring extra warmth, Zerod comes with a detachable inner down jacket which you can easily zip on or off the Zerod, or even wear it separately.
 
 We have elegantly designed the inner jacket, from the inside to the outside, so that it outperforms most of the ultra-light jackets on the market.
  100% Animal Free & Eco-friendly “THERMOLITE® T-Down EcoMade insulation provides the Active-Outdoor industry with a compelling new generation of recycled synthetic fiber engineered for down replacement. THERMOLITE® T-Down EcoMade insulation is GRS approved and made from 100% recycled PET fiber.”
 Warmer & BetterWaterproof & Down ProofThis may sound crazy, but we have even integrated the PFC Free Coating, the (20k/20k) Membrane, into the inner jacket to make it water-resistant, waterproof and down-proof.Moreover, the whole jacket is seam taping.
 
 FABRIC INDEX400T Nylon Taffeta+TPU+Thermalite EcoMadeLabels Speaks Louder Than Words Indeed! What you see is what you get.  Bluesign approved [Highest level of consumer safety]- Produced with a minimum impact on people and the environment;- Made from approved chemical products and raw material.REPREVE- MADE FROM RECYCLED PLASTIC BOTTLES THERMOLITE EcoMade - Insulation that is made from a minimum of 35% recycled resources such as plastic bottles.

The sizing chart is for your body measures [not the jacket measures].
Tips
Slim Fit: Add 2'' to your body measures [Chest, Waist and Hips].
Regular Fit: Add 4'' to your body measures [Chest, Waist and Hips].
Loose Fit: Add 6'' to your body measures [Chest, Waist and Hips].
