story:
About

You can buy the NESSH Jacket now at www.darkpeakgear.com

Our team spent 18 months sourcing one of the best lightweight jacket materials around. Our NESSH™ 10D Ripstop Nylon is super-light, with a tight weave that offers excellent wind resistance and down proofing. Additionally, we use the same fabric on both the outer and inner shells. Many well-known brands skimp on quality by using a lower quality fabric on the jacket’s inner shell…we don’t.

Down or Synthetic - which to choose? We knew that one insulation just wouldn't cover all the bases. Down is super warm and packable, but doesn't perform well when wet. Synthetic has excellent wet-weather performance, but isn't as packable or lightweight as Down. So instead we decided to do something radical, by offering the exact same jacket, with two different insulation options. 850 Fill Power Goose Down - OR - 3M FL700 Synthetic insulation.

Down clothing ranges in Fill Power (FP) from 550FP up to 900FP. Higher Fill Power Down traps more insulating air pockets than lower quality down (e.g. 550FP). Very few brands choose to use Down with very high Fill Power ratings, due to its considerable cost. The NESSH Jacket uses 850 Fill Power Down to provide industry-leading insulation.

All Down used in Dark Peak jackets has been certified by the Responsible Down Standard (RDS), ensuring that Down comes from animals that have not been subjected to any unnecessary harm. We pride ourselves on reinforcing this outlook.

For those who are allergic to, or prefer to avoid, Down, we also offer the same jacket filled instead with premium 3M Featherless (FL700) Synthetic Insulation - considered the best synthetic, Down-like insulation on the market.

The NESSH jacket features a form-fitting design with innovative Verti-Stretch™ vertical side baffles. These baffles expand or contract to better fit your physique and give you more flexibility when layering under the jacket.

It's got plenty of pockets and features wrist gaiters/mitts that prevent drafts and help keep your hands warm (use them or don’t, they tuck away when not in use). It also has a longer length than other brands, with an extended lower back (drop-back), giving more protection than other jackets in its class.

The versatile 2-way YKK zipper allows you to unzip the jacket from the top or bottom. Perfect for wearing over bulky items (like a climbing harness), the NESSH jacket can unzip slightly when you’re sitting down, so it will never bunch up on you.

And of course, it folds into it's own pocket for easy storage!

Did you know that when buying a jacket from a well-known brand, you pay 6-8 times what it actually costs to manufacture? Why? These brands have bloated marketing budgets, distributors and retailers who all take their piece.

By cutting out traditional retail middlemen and only selling directly to you, we can give you a world class jacket, at wholesale pricing and use some of our profits to give a jacket to someone who’s homeless.

Don't want a hooded jacket? No problem - Every color option in the range is also available in a hoodless version. You'll be given the option to select color and whether your NESSH jacket is hooded or hoodless via a survey after the campaign has ended.

At Dark Peak, we’re passionate about great products, but we also believe it’s not enough for a business to simply strive for profit, benefiting only a handful of shareholders.

As a business, we have an opportunity to improve society, to give back and help bring issues to the forefront of people’s minds. Which is why we decided to adopt a One Sold, One Given model, by promising that for every jacket we sell, we’ll donate another jacket to a person affected by homelessness, in the country you live in. Help us help the vulnerable in your home country.

We’ve received some great question about how our One Sold, One Given promise works, here are some answers:

Q: Is the jacket you give the same as the NESSH jacket?

A: No. For many reasons the NESSH jacket is not suitable for the needs of someone without permanent shelter. Knowing this we’re working with charities and directly with homeless people to develop a different jacket, designed to be as warm and as hard wearing as possible. It’s cut longer in the body to stop drafts, and has a deep drawstring hood. We have selected a water resistant, hardwearing polyester shell combined with synthetic insulation fill that retains insulating properties when wet. One of these jackets will be donated for every NESSH jacket sold.

Q: Is the jacket you donate branded with a Dark Peak logo?

A: No. The jacket we give is unbranded. This reduces it’s intrinsic value and reduces the temptation for someone to sell it, instead of wear it.

Q: Will the jacket being given on my behalf, go to someone in my home country?

A: Yes! We are working with charities worldwide and wherever possible we will donate the jacket on your behalf, to a charity in your home country.

Q: If I return my jacket for a refund, will you still give a jacket away?

A: No. Unfortunately, we can only give a jacket for every jacket sold. If you return your jacket for a refund, we cannot then afford to also give a jacket away.

Q: How do you donate the jackets?

A: We work with charities in different countries to provide bulk donation of jackets to homeless shelters, who will then distribute them to people in need.

Q: Can I personally sign up to receive a donated jacket?

A: No. Unfortunately we are not able to donate to individuals at this time. After our campaign ends our website will have a link to charities we partner with.

One Warm Coat is a US national non-profit organization that works to provide a free, warm coat to any person in need. They support individuals, groups, companies and organizations across the U.S. by providing the tools and resources needed to hold a successful coat drive, collecting lightly used coats for donation to people in need. In 2017/18 season they helped arrange donation of over 600,000 coats to people in need across the U.S. and 7 other countries. 

We are excited to continue building relationships with charities around the world in your home country. If you are associated with a charity or shelter, who have need for the jackets we'll donate, please get in touch.

We spent 2 years making one of the best insulated mid-layers in the world. Testing every last material and refining every last feature, until it was ready for you.

We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make the NESSH Jacket a reality.

We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, so even if you can’t give a dollar or purchase a NESSH Jacket, if you’re a supporter of what we stand for, you can help us spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Instagram and anywhere else you can think of!

 

Risks and challenges

We've been devloping and manufacturing sports equipment for the past 15 years. We've got our manufacturer, our colours are selected, tested and approved.

Of course there are always certain risks that can arise at any moment during a project like this which could delay production. That being said, we’re confident in our ability to produce this product in the timescale provided above and have taken all the necessary measures to do so. We just need your help to bring everything to fruition.

We’re completely prepared to bring the NESSH Jacket to your closets, and we have the manpower to make it happen, but if anything comes up along the way, you’ll be the first to know.
story_txt:
About
You can buy the NESSH Jacket now at www.darkpeakgear.com



 




 


Our team spent 18 months sourcing one of the best lightweight jacket materials around. Our NESSH™ 10D Ripstop Nylon is super-light, with a tight weave that offers excellent wind resistance and down proofing. Additionally, we use the same fabric on both the outer and inner shells. Many well-known brands skimp on quality by using a lower quality fabric on the jacket’s inner shell…we don’t.

Down or Synthetic - which to choose? We knew that one insulation just wouldn't cover all the bases. Down is super warm and packable, but doesn't perform well when wet. Synthetic has excellent wet-weather performance, but isn't as packable or lightweight as Down. So instead we decided to do something radical, by offering the exact same jacket, with two different insulation options. 850 Fill Power Goose Down - OR - 3M FL700 Synthetic insulation.

Down clothing ranges in Fill Power (FP) from 550FP up to 900FP. Higher Fill Power Down traps more insulating air pockets than lower quality down (e.g. 550FP). Very few brands choose to use Down with very high Fill Power ratings, due to its considerable cost. The NESSH Jacket uses 850 Fill Power Down to provide industry-leading insulation.
All Down used in Dark Peak jackets has been certified by the Responsible Down Standard (RDS), ensuring that Down comes from animals that have not been subjected to any unnecessary harm. We pride ourselves on reinforcing this outlook.

For those who are allergic to, or prefer to avoid, Down, we also offer the same jacket filled instead with premium 3M Featherless (FL700) Synthetic Insulation - considered the best synthetic, Down-like insulation on the market.


The NESSH jacket features a form-fitting design with innovative Verti-Stretch™ vertical side baffles. These baffles expand or contract to better fit your physique and give you more flexibility when layering under the jacket.
It's got plenty of pockets and features wrist gaiters/mitts that prevent drafts and help keep your hands warm (use them or don’t, they tuck away when not in use). It also has a longer length than other brands, with an extended lower back (drop-back), giving more protection than other jackets in its class.
The versatile 2-way YKK zipper allows you to unzip the jacket from the top or bottom. Perfect for wearing over bulky items (like a climbing harness), the NESSH jacket can unzip slightly when you’re sitting down, so it will never bunch up on you.
And of course, it folds into it's own pocket for easy storage!


Did you know that when buying a jacket from a well-known brand, you pay 6-8 times what it actually costs to manufacture? Why? These brands have bloated marketing budgets, distributors and retailers who all take their piece.

By cutting out traditional retail middlemen and only selling directly to you, we can give you a world class jacket, at wholesale pricing and use some of our profits to give a jacket to someone who’s homeless.

We've use a combination of 5 fabric colors to create our range. Each jacket color (excluding Black) has a different color inner shell, which compliments the outer shell color. Additionally some inner shell colors vary depending on the gender of the jacket. You'll find more detail on each below:

 

 

 

 

 
Don't want a hooded jacket? No problem - Every color option in the range is also available in a hoodless version. You'll be given the option to select color and whether your NESSH jacket is hooded or hoodless via a survey after the campaign has ended.

 

At Dark Peak, we’re passionate about great products, but we also believe it’s not enough for a business to simply strive for profit, benefiting only a handful of shareholders.
As a business, we have an opportunity to improve society, to give back and help bring issues to the forefront of people’s minds. Which is why we decided to adopt a One Sold, One Given model, by promising that for every jacket we sell, we’ll donate another jacket to a person affected by homelessness, in the country you live in. Help us help the vulnerable in your home country.

We’ve received some great question about how our One Sold, One Given promise works, here are some answers:
Q: Is the jacket you give the same as the NESSH jacket?
A: No. For many reasons the NESSH jacket is not suitable for the needs of someone without permanent shelter. Knowing this we’re working with charities and directly with homeless people to develop a different jacket, designed to be as warm and as hard wearing as possible. It’s cut longer in the body to stop drafts, and has a deep drawstring hood. We have selected a water resistant, hardwearing polyester shell combined with synthetic insulation fill that retains insulating properties when wet. One of these jackets will be donated for every NESSH jacket sold.
Q: Is the jacket you donate branded with a Dark Peak logo? 
A: No. The jacket we give is unbranded. This reduces it’s intrinsic value and reduces the temptation for someone to sell it, instead of wear it.
Q: Will the jacket being given on my behalf, go to someone in my home country? 
A: Yes! We are working with charities worldwide and wherever possible we will donate the jacket on your behalf, to a charity in your home country.
Q: If I return my jacket for a refund, will you still give a jacket away? 
A: No. Unfortunately, we can only give a jacket for every jacket sold. If you return your jacket for a refund, we cannot then afford to also give a jacket away.
Q: How do you donate the jackets? 
A: We work with charities in different countries to provide bulk donation of jackets to homeless shelters, who will then distribute them to people in need.
Q: Can I personally sign up to receive a donated jacket? 
A: No. Unfortunately we are not able to donate to individuals at this time. After our campaign ends our website will have a link to charities we partner with.
 

One Warm Coat is a US national non-profit organization that works to provide a free, warm coat to any person in need. They support individuals, groups, companies and organizations across the U.S. by providing the tools and resources needed to hold a successful coat drive, collecting lightly used coats for donation to people in need. In 2017/18 season they helped arrange donation of over 600,000 coats to people in need across the U.S. and 7 other countries. 
We are excited to continue building relationships with charities around the world in your home country. If you are associated with a charity or shelter, who have need for the jackets we'll donate, please get in touch.

 

We spent 2 years making one of the best insulated mid-layers in the world. Testing every last material and refining every last feature, until it was ready for you.



 
 Get Your Project Funded Today!
  

We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make the NESSH Jacket a reality.
We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, so even if you can’t give a dollar or purchase a NESSH Jacket, if you’re a supporter of what we stand for, you can help us spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Instagram and anywhere else you can think of!
 
 
 
 


 
Risks and challenges
We've been devloping and manufacturing sports equipment for the past 15 years. We've got our manufacturer, our colours are selected, tested and approved.
Of course there are always certain risks that can arise at any moment during a project like this which could delay production. That being said, we’re confident in our ability to produce this product in the timescale provided above and have taken all the necessary measures to do so. We just need your help to bring everything to fruition.
We’re completely prepared to bring the NESSH Jacket to your closets, and we have the manpower to make it happen, but if anything comes up along the way, you’ll be the first to know.

story:
It seems like every time a new actor takes on the role of the Doctor some fans raise an outcry about the choice. Ultimately it's the same character, regenerated. It's still the same guy.

When people raised the same hue and cry over Peter Capaldi taking on the role of the 12th Doctor, the response came from deep within: "Some people regenerate. Get over it!" This came followed by the thought: “Hey, that should be a t-shirt!"”

Thus, a T-shirt design was conceived. You can get yours here, beautifully screen printed in three colors on shirts in a variety of sizes and colors. Click here for info on style, size and color choices in men's shirts. Click here for info on style, size and color choices in ladies' shirts.

Decide how many shirts you want, plug in your email/registration and we'll send you a link so you can make your selections. All profits go to the TARDIS Tea Society to assist them in bringing their wonderful room party to science fiction conventions. See below for the links to the sort of conventions they do.

We are based in the United States. If you need your shirts shipped internationally, we request that you please contribute an extra $10 above your perk level so we don't lose money on your order due to the higher cost of shipping internationally.

If you have questions or special requests, e-mail me: sharla.stremski@gmail.com

story:
The Chili Lions Pop Warner Youth Football and Cheerleading Little Scholars program is a not-forprofit
organization for over 45 years. It supports over 300 football and cheerleading participants
between the ages of 5 and 15 in our community each year.
Recently, our Mitey Mite Cheerleading Squad (Ages 7-9) were selected to be the Eastern Region
Pop Warner representative to exhibition at the 2012 Pop Warner National Cheer and Dance
Championships at the ESPN Wide World of Sports Complex in Lake Buena Vista, Florida on
Saturday, December 1, 2012.

Our goal as an organization is to raise enough funds to offset the expenses for our rostered participants which are estimated to cost each participant around $1,000 each.

Our fundraising agenda is packed full of various events including bake sales, pasta dinner, wine
tasting, pancake breakfast, bowling fundraiser and can drive amongst other events. We are reaching
out to our community businesses and leaders such as you for monetary donations and or goods or
services in kind that may facilitate any of our above events. All monies received will only go
directly to offset the costs of this wonderful opportunity for this squad.

As an organization we could not be any more thrilled that the Chili Lions were selected out of the hundreds of cheer squads in the entire Eastern Region. We look forward to representing our community, Western New York, Monroe County and the entire Eastern Region to the best of our abilities. This will be the first time in our 48 years of existence that the Chili Lions will have a cheer squad down in Florida for the Pop Warner National Championships.We cannot make this dream happen for these kids without the support of people and businesses like you. Please become a part of these young girls journey!!

story:
Why XProtect?

The Xprotect is not just a accessory for the ipad but a necessity. There is no case on the market that can offer protection like "X", while still allowing you to use all of your ipad's functions.

Perfect for using in the kitchen.

                                                         Our story:

This concept started when we noticed the limitations of the iPad. Here I have this powerful machine but I am afraid to take it anywhere. Why should the iPad be limited to on land only? Why should you have to worry about going near water or dusty areas? Well, you don't anymore!

So we put our heads together and many prototypes and designs later, we have Xprotect. We have spent countless hours making sure we did not limit the iPad at all with this case. We have 1 of each color created right now and all three have been tested 30 feet underwater for 30 minutes, with not a drop of water in the case after testing. With our Beta model, we need your support to make this a reality in stores across America.

How could you benefit from Xprotect?

1. Taking underwater photo's and video with your iPad.

2. Go to the beach and put all of your valuables in the case (The shoe is no longer the go to place.)

3. Hiking and camping in bad weather.

4. Reading in the bath tub.

5. Playing games in the pool.

6. Bring it to the water park and keep your money and phone in the case.

7. Cooking in the kitchen.

8. Let your kids play with out worrying about food or fingerprints on the screen.

9. Any dusty environment.

10. Out on a boat, ( it floats). 

The rear headphone hook up W/ headphones

                                    

Perfect for the pool

                                                 Xprotect Stats

1. High quality material in waterproof PVC provides complete protection

2. 100% waterproof material

3. Access all of the iPad's features through the case

4. Clear front case allows you to see the entire screen

5. Precision molded smart case for maximum protection

6. IP68 under water rating. ( Highest rating you can have for a under water case.)

Choose from any of the three colors.

                            

The rear window allows you to still have access to the camera.

          

Absolutely no worry about water again, it floats

                                        Our timeline for Xprotect

September 15, 2012

We will order from our manufacturer the first run of Pvc and rubber molds.

September 25, 2012

Our electronic department will start with the Auxiliary hook-ups and testing of connections.

October 1, 2012

Assembly of the first line of Xprotect cases.

October 5, 2012

Underwater testing begins on cases.

October 25 - 29, 2012

First shipment goes out to the early bird's who believed in "X".

November 20 - 24, 2012

Shipment goes out to the rest of the pledgers.

December 1, 2012

Assembly of first public offering for Xprotect.

story:
The era of the free shopping bag is over.

The Problem – Always forgetting to bring a reusable shopping bag and discounts/coupons to the store

How many times has this happened to you: You go to checkout at the grocery store, only to realize you don't have your reusable bag. You also forgot to bring that special offer, discount, reward, coupon, club card, or gift card that would have saved you money. It would take too much time, effort, and money to go home and come back, so now you're forced to pay for the bag AND pay more for your groceries. Your forgetfulness is not only bad for the environment: It’s also bad for your wallet.


Shopping Bag Solutions - Shopping bags made in America

The Solution - A reusable bag that saves you money

Shopping Bag Solutions has created the first reusable bag service that also saves you money, solving two problems with one bag. The service is based on patent pending clear external pockets that hold all of your special offers, discounts, rewards, coupons, club cards, or gift cards. Along with receiving this groundbreaking, domestically produced bag, you’ll also have access to money saving incentives at ShoppingBagSolutions.com.

On average in 2013, SBS Alpha Testers saved between $2-3 on top of traditional loyalty savings when using our initial prototype bag, and they were able to do so because the incentives helped them remember to bring their bag to the store. Help launch Shopping Bag Solutions and join our community to see how well it works for you.  

Pad your wallet, while supporting the environment, our economy and our veterans!

How It Works

As your reward for supporting our launch, you'll receive an American made SBS bag and one-year access to our Incentives Gallery. You can select incentives and print them at home, just as you would print airline boarding passes or concert tickets. Slide your printouts into your SBS bag pockets and any time you receive a direct mail offer, gift card, or coupon at checkout, add those to your incentives stash. Place the bag either in a visible location at home or next to your printer/workstation, as a simple reminder.

Domestically Manufactured by US Veterans: Knowing that you support this project and our business model means we can pay a living wage and give our domestic bag manufacturing partner, Green VetsLA, a chance against cheap foreign imports. Moreover, if you use the SBS bag to organize your other paper and plastic bags, it becomes a great way to support stores with recycling programs. 

Featured in:



*EXHIBITOR #20987 FOR MAKERS FAIRE 2014 * 

NASA design the future 2014


FedEx top 100 Small Business Competition



2013 Alpha Test Feedback

We've had 50 users in an alpha test since 2013. Here is some of their feedback:

"A similar bag at Whole Foods is going for $4.99 and doesn't stand up to your bag."

"Can I buy another one?"

"The clerks at the store always give me compliments and ask where I got your bag."

"I found some old gift cards, put them in your bag and actually was able to spend!"

"I never knew about digital coupons before: Now I do and will not give up this new behavior."

"I used to just throw out the Redplum mailer, Valpak envelope, etc.. Now I put them in my bag and actually use the offers."

"I love having a way to remember my shopping bag without having to install another useless app!"

Core Design Values


The Shopping Bag Solutions indiegogo Reward Bag. A clerk says this works better than a smart phone app!

We started our design process by looking at the core values we shared:

1. Promote multi-function bag use, recycling, and reusable bags

2. Produce our bags domestically

3. Drive engagement with savings


Early test of the very first SBS bag at Walgreens.


Early prototype of the SBS Bag.

Later prototype of the SBS bag

Quality Stitching that will last


Risks and challenges

$20 is asking a lot: Why aren't SBS bags cheaper?  
When you factor in the SBS savings to be had and the bag fees in certain cities, the SBS bag easily pays for itself - and then some! In addition, as SBS grows, we aim to reduce costs through scale and production efficiencies. 

That said, there are indeed legitimate productions costs factored into the price. SBS community members are investing in more than just their own bank accounts by buying a bag and using the incentives gallery. They are also supporting the environment, our economy, and our veterans. 

The price also includes estimated fulfillment and shipping costs of $5-8 dollars per bag, which many Indiegogo direct-to-consumer companies forget to take into account.

NOT Made in China 
Over 90% of the reusable bag market is dominated by foreign imports, and the domestic alternatives are fighting a commodity price war. Call it "fair trade" or wrap it up in whatever cause you want, but even the rare companies that do offer domestic options still make most of their profit by manufacturing abroad, as well. Rather than pursue this option, we are attempting to pioneer new value-added features and services to give the domestic industry an edge. 

The restoration of American/Domestic manufacturing depends upon creating products right here and employing people living right here, even when it costs more. SBS is starting with the bags you use every week – And we don't just want to sell you one bag one time. We want to be the company providing you bags and savings, year after year. Think of a subscription service: Once a year, we will ask you to support this effort by buying another bag for yourself or to give as a gift.

Why Printed Vs. Mobile SBS Bag Incentives? 
Isn’t mobile the way to go? Not this time – or at least, not yet. For all our technological advancements, printed incentives still dominate. In fact, 99% of the coupon market is printed out on paper. To quote one industry insider, “Paperless coupon formats are currently dependent upon unique point of sale (POS) system enablement, and they require a change in consumer planning or shopping behavior to engage the consumer compared to other forms of coupon media.” 

New technologies are emerging every day that might change the way we shop, checkout, and purchase; but unless we grow pouches, we’ll always need bags to carry things.

Production

First indiegogo Bag Production Run: July 2014 

When we meet our goal, Shopping Bag Solutions will partner with GreenVets Los Angeles to manufacture our first production run of 1000 SBS bags. GreenVets is a non-profit vocational rehabilitation program that works closely with the West Los Angeles V. A. Hospital to provide job training for returning veterans. Both injured and non-injured Veterans are offered a wide variety of training through this program. Every part of their manufacturing process is done locally in Los Angeles, CA. 

The business model of GreenVets can be replicated to VA Hospitals across America - With your support, it can happen.

Second indiegogo Bag Production Run: September 2014 
We’d be thrilled to exceed our goal! And in that event, we are prepared to scale our production to meet the demand.

In fact, 99% of the coupon market is printed out on paper. To quote one industry insider, “Paperless coupon formats are currently dependent upon unique point of sale (POS) system enablement, and they require a change in consumer planning or shopping behavior to engage the consumer compared to other forms of coupon media.” New technologies are emerging every day that might change the way we shop, checkout, and purchase; but unless we grow pouches, we’ll always need bags to carry things.ProductionFirst indiegogo Bag Production Run: July 2014 When we meet our goal, Shopping Bag Solutions will partner with GreenVets Los Angeles to manufacture our first production run of 1000 SBS bags. GreenVets is a non-profit vocational rehabilitation program that works closely with the West Los Angeles V. A. Hospital to provide job training for returning veterans. Both injured and non-injured Veterans are offered a wide variety of training through this program. Every part of their manufacturing process is done locally in Los Angeles, CA. The business model of GreenVets can be replicated to VA Hospitals across America - With your support, it can happen.Second indiegogo Bag Production Run: September 2014 We’d be thrilled to exceed our goal! And in that event, we are prepared to scale our production to meet the demand.

story:
We did it!  Over $2,000 raised!  THANK YOU to everyone who pitched in to make this campaign a success.  Now I'll pay 4% to Indiegogo instead of 9%, saving over $160.  If you still want to be a part of this campaign, that's great-  I still have much to invest in the business.  I will invest in getting better photographs made so that I will get into more shows, or maybe even buy a camera so I can take better photos myself.  Or, I may invest in fabulous fabrics so I can increase inventory.  Leave a comment of how you'd prefer the money to be spent and I'll take your advice into consideration. 

Where will the money go, exactly?

Indiegogo gets a 4% cut for their work in creating the website.   So that leaves about $1,929.

I am budgeting about $200 of that for perk fulfillment, (fabric, shipping, etc.) So that leaves about  $1,729 for the actual project.  Here's how it will be distributed.

$800-Gridwalls and legs, waterfall racks, half-mannaquins, and shelves/bins

$300-silver lamé fabric for walls and ceilings, lights, a durable mirror and case, a rug and materials for a new dressing room.

$629-towards a new, more durable canopy. 

I've been enjoying brilliant colors and unique clothes since I was a young child. I created a clothing line designed for real women, influenced by my grandmother's handmade dresses, the vintage dresses my mother collected, my own thrift store finds, and my amazing collection of never-used vintage fabrics. Comfort and practicality are wedded with flattering style and unique design.           
Adding clothes for men and kids has created the satisfaction of truly having something for everyone. Each piece from Lush Life is made in a limited production run or is one-of-a-kind, allowing everyone to enjoy the luxury of a rare piece of clothing at a reasonable price.  I love spreading joy, positive self-image and creative vision through my work.  It's time to reach more people with Lush Life beauty.
With a wide-array of colorful designs, customers are often overwhelmed by choices.  Creating an eye-catching display that allows an easy shopping experience will draw people into the booth and encourage them to spend more time shopping.  I will purchase a grid display, waterfall racks, and, with enough funds, a professional grade canopy.   Additional funds will go towards other


display improvements, such as fabric for curtains, lighting, rugs, mirror, etc.  
Lush Life has been operating as a one-woman cabin industry for almost ten years now, and it's time to grow.  Motivated by a desire to have a positive impact on society, my dream is to create a worker-owned business that demonstrates how  an ethically-run business can be financially successful. Improving the display is a first step to increasing sales and moving the business to the point of creating jobs.

story:
Buy LunaR now!

www.lunar-smartwatch.com

 

 

 

 

Introducing LunaR, the world's first solar powered smartwatch.

LunaR combines intelligent functionality and a timeless aesthetic with breakthrough solar technology. Designed with travelers, outdoor enthusiasts and watch aficionados in mind, LunaR is a modern, self-sustaining and functional wearable that will keep you connected, informed and on time––without the need to plug in and recharge.

 

  

 

As seen on

 


 

 

Designing LunaR

The LunaR team has put endless hours and effort into designing LunaR and optimizing its solar-harvesting capabilities. We’ve made countless prototypes. Tested. Refined. Redesigned. And finally reached a result that satisfied our thirst to redefine the smartwatch landscape.  

As Chief Designer, Gavin has been responsible for the design ethics and optimized comfort of LunaR. Known for an aversion to the word “no,” he helped the team push boundaries farther than they thought possible and reach goals that seemed unattainable.

 

 

 

 

Indoor and outdoor charging

Our days revolve around the sun, but we don’t always stop when it sets. Like us, LunaR can rely on both natural and artificial light. With a daily exposure of as little as 1 hour (>10k LUX), LunaR's solar panel can harvest enough power to deliver infinite battery life. You can easily check your watch’s current light-harvesting levels through the LunaR app.

  

  

A clear breakthrough in solar technology  

LunaR’s exclusive transparent solar panel was pioneered by Sunpartner, a leading solar technology company from France. Coined WYSIPS® (What You See Is Photovoltaic Surface), this innovative technology harvests energy from a variety of light sources while still delivering allowing clear visibility through the panel.

 

 

Recharge with your watch

Like LunaR, we also run on sunshine. Vitamin D is essential for strong bones and a healthy immune system. It has also been shown to reduce the risk of depression, multiple sclerosis, heart disease and the flu. LunaR lets you set your own daily sunshine exposure goals. Your LunaR app will keep you notified about your progression.


LunaR was thoughtfully designed to enhance travel, outdoor activity, and everyday experiences without ever causing the inconvenience of a low-battery or dying device.

 

 

Dual time zone

LunaR keeps you on time, wherever you are. With its built-in world clock function, LunaR easily reports the time for your current and home locations. This means you can display two time zones on one (analog) watch, keeping you seamlessly in sync with friends, family and colleagues.

 

 

Your local time is automatically updated according to GPS by the app. No GPS available? Just select the city of your choice and the correct time will be reflected on your watch.

 

 

 

Sunrise / sunset tracking

Maximize your daylight hours, monitor light-centric activities like hiking and surfing, outwit your jet lag and more. LunaR features integrated sunrise and sunset technology, providing accurate data for your current location through both LunaR embedded LEDs and on the dashboard page of the LunaR app.

 

  

 

App integration

 

 

LunaR's embedded LED array and vibration technology integrates with all of your apps, providing discreet, at-a-glance notifications so you don't have to upset the flow of your daily activities to stay connected, informed and on schedule.

 

 

 

 

Buy LunaR now!

www.lunar-smartwatch.com

 

 

 

 

Activity tracking

LunaR's accelerometer “feels” your movements, providing feedback and making it easy to reach movement objectives. Set a goal and check in on your daily progress through the app or LunaR’s patented LED dial technology. LunaR will give you a vibrating and visual LED notification when you beat your goal for the day.

 

 

LunaR will give you a vibrating and a visual LED notification when you beat your goal for the day. Another way LunaR helps you keep moving!

 

 

 

Sleep monitoring

 

Our research shows that healthy sleep is as important as physical exertion—that’s why LunaR gives you feedback on your waking activities AND your sleep. 

LunaR analyzes sleep health with a refined algorithm that tracks deep sleep, light sleep and time awake, evaluating data so you can easily understand and optimize your sleep habits. 

With bedtime integration, the LunaR app will alert you when it’s time for bed, automatically putting LunaR in sleep-tracking mode. At your designated wakeup time, you’ll be notified by a gentle vibration alarm.

 

 

Water resistance

With waterproofing up to 5ATM (50 meters), you don’t need to worry about LunaR getting splashed, soaked or dunked. You can even swim with it.

 

   

 

More insights on Solar Charging

      

 

 

 

 

LunaR in Business

 

  

 

 

 

 

What's in the box
 

   

   

 

Time-centric features.

Timeless good looks. Each element of LunaR’s design—from the classically inspired dial and sleek case to these contemporary straps—was chosen with excruciating care, always keeping our user’s lifestyle and personal style top-of-mind.

 

 

 

 

 

Like what you see?

Customization is easy. After backing, you’ll receive a link to confirm your shipping address and choose any additional accessories to further personalize your LunaR smartwatch.

The transaction will take place within the survey. So there is no need to adjust your pledge amount.
 

 

 

 

With a simple interface and intuitive functionality, the Lunar app makes it easy to see and analyze all data aggregated by the watch. 

 

 

The LunaR app will be available for Android and iOS, accompanied by a team of developers dedicated to its ongoing evolution and improvement.

  • Download LunaR for iOS
  • Download LunaR for Android

 

 

 

Movement: Japanese; MIYOTA SUPER GL26 
Casing: 316L 
Thickness: 13.3mm
Diameter: 41mm 
Weight: 60 grams
Glass: Sapphire Coated Glass or Sapphire Crystal Glass (delivery in 2018) 
Water resistance: 5ATM
Nylon strap: Length: 26cm (including buckle); Width: 2cm; Thickness: +/- 1mm 

Battery type: Rechargeable Li-polymer 110mAh
Bluetooth: BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) 4.0
Chipset: Nordic BLE
Sensors: MEMS 3-axis accelerometer

Works with: iOS 10 (and higher) and Android 4.3 (and higher)
Health: compatible with Apple Healthkit and Google Health 

 

   

 

 

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

Our vision for LunaR has always been to produce a smartwatch with both classic styling and leading technology. There have been big challenges in bringing LunaR to life and for nearly three years our team has been working long hours to refine and optimize the design, technology, production and logistics for LunaR.

We know there will be minor tweaks in the final production and our materials. 

We’ve worked diligently with our partners for many months to fine tune every aspect of LunaR and identify and eliminate any areas of weakness which may cause issues with performance, durability and user satisfaction. We’ve invested an enormous amount of time and our own finances on research, development, sourcing, prototyping and testing. We’re in the final stages of this and we need your help to get over the last hump and make LunaR a reality.

Even the best efforts sometimes hit a snag. We are committed to transparency on all aspects of our product, project and its delivery to you. So, if for some reason we run into an issue or have a delay, we will let all of our backers know immediately and solve the problem as fast as humanly possible.

Terms and Conditions
Please note that an external provider is acting as our undisclosed agent on our behalf for the global distribution of LunaR.

Please check our entire terms and conditions, privacy policy and warranty at http://www.lunar-smartwatch.com/legal

story:
What would you say if the jeans you are wearing right now were not only a fashionable cut and made of premium denim, but also hand-sewn to your exact measures? All this at no extra costs for marketing, thanks to Indiegogo’s crowdfunding. Sounds exciting? Read on! With jeans today you will find a lot of common problems: uninspiring designs, limited choices of materials, unflattering cuts, and quite simply jeans that don’t sit well. The solution to any of these issues usually comes at great expense for the buyer. Jean the Tailor jeans turn all these problems into their strong points. Here’s how:

 

Made to your Measures

Jean the Tailor produces individual cuts for individual people. That means the jeans are sewn specifically for you — not just in some groups of “forms”, but by your exact measures — it’s a perfect fit! We achieve this by drawing an individual cut for every single pair that we create, and cutting them all out of denim one by one.

 

The Best in Denim

For Jean the Tailor jeans we use the best in denim — great quality cotton from Europe, and for our premium line for the true denim lover the best of selvedge from Japan’s Kuroki mills. We met with Mr. Kuroki in Paris, and hand-picked the tastiest produce from his factory to satisfy even the most capricious aficionados of raw selvedge denim.

“...for the true denim lover the best of selvedge from Japan’s Kuroki mills...”

 

The Models

The designs for our models aim to be versatile as well as functional. For Indiegogo we offer three types of models: a classic jeans look, a selvedge straight-cut, and a classy trouser-jeans model. Each variation comes both in men’s and women’s versions.

Classic
Jeans Look

  

Selvedge
Straight-Cut

  

Classy
Trouser-Jeans

The Classic
High quality European denim, available in stiff (100% cotton) or stretch (2% elastane) denim variants. The classic model looks good with almost anything you can imagine — be it a casual outfit for everyday wear or a night out in the club — the perfect fit is always in style.

Selvedge straight-cut
The best in selvedge denim for the true denim aficionado. The eternal straight cut, made of Japanese 14.5 oz selvedge denim straight from Japan’s Kuroki mills comes with an ornamental strip of denim self-edge on the 5th pocket.

TrouserJeans
A real class of its own — the authentic trouser look, except in denim. Complete with trouser crease lines and trouser pockets. Available in stiff (100% cotton) or stretch (2% elastane) denim. Perfect for a more sophisticated look with a shirt or blouse.

 

True gender equality

Jean the Tailor offers a true rarity — women’s straight cut selvedge jeans. You won’t easily find this type of cut in any shops at all, let alone made of selvedge. The difficulty in creating this cut is to preserve the original selvedge lining of the denim, which shows on the hem of the jeans. We solve this problem when creating the individual cut, making sure than the straight cut sits well even on the curviest forms.

 

Made in Europe

For Jean theTailor jeans the production cannot be outsourced to countries specialized in mass-production. Our way of creating jeans requires a close cooperation between the processes of designing, drafting, cutting, and sewing. In addition, we begin creating your jeans only after we receive your measurements, and this means the production of each pair needs to start ASAP. By keeping the production local we also ensure that you get your jeans faster.

 

Avoiding extra costs

Our jeans are not being sold in any retail stores, not only because we just can’t do that (we need your measures to create the cut, remember?), but this also helps us avoid all the mark-up costs retailers usually charge.

 

Tailor made

Jean Tailor jeans are also tailor made, which means they are each produced individually, by one master assembling them, and not on an assembly belt, by parts. This is a rare practice nowadays, but it assures that the quality of our jeans rises.

 

Customizable

With the extended goal we aim to offer you the ability to customize the ingredients for your jeans. Already now, through Indiegogo, we provide a choice in thread colors, button/rivets designs, and washing options. By reaching the extended goal we will make a wider variety of washes, different denims and pocket linings, back-pocket designs, and custom laser engravings available as well.

 

 



Updates

Keychain:

as per the denim perk, this keychain of denim will be yours!

 

Denim keyholder:

the denim protection perk is this nice little denim pocket to keep your sharp keys safely tucked in. You can choose to have it either with a backpocket design, or with a Jean Tailor logo.

 

Selvedge keyholder:

the self edge perk gives you a keyholder with a stylish selvedge rim - available in both male (14.5oz 100% cotton denim) or female (12oz 2% stretch denim) variants, either with a backpocket design, or the Jean Tailor logo.

 

 

 

How It Works?

So you’ve ordered a pair of jeans from the perks, and the deadline of the project arrives. What now?

Step 1: The measurements

We will send you a survey, in which we ask you for your measures and options. In terms of size you can:

— Choose a standard size, or a standard size with options (say, extra long legs)

— Take the measures from a pair of jeans that you like, and use those

— Take your own measures (towards the end of the project we will post a video with instructions on how to take your measures)

— Get your measures taken by a tailor.

Step 2: The Cut

Our skilled patternmakers will create your individual cut from your measures. Yes, this is all done individually, and the way we make it possible is through clever use of algorithms in patterns, and experience in making individual cuts.


Step 3: The manufacturing & Delivering

Now the jeans are cut out of the denim, and everything is individually assembled, with one master working per jeans.

After they’re done and measured, they are sent off to post-processing — washing and riveting.

Your jeans are ready and you will receive them per mail.

We can ship all around the world.

 

 

 

 

 

Our Goals

At €14k, our essential goal is to set up our own production and start creating made to measure jeans by ourselves.

We Invest In:
— sewing machines;
— hiring people;
— materials;
— quality control;
— web programming;

You Get:
— production of made to measure jeans;
— some customization options (threads, rivets);
— some washes (raw, soft, stone);
— a website for orders;

 

At our extended goal of €35k, we aim to upgrade the website so it can provide full customization to your jeans. We also add more washes, different denim and pocket lining types, and custom laser engravings.

We Invest In:
— web programming;
— jeans design;
— materials;
— development and testing;

You Get:
— production of made to measure jeans;
— full customization options;
— 6 different washes;
— laser options;
— customization of your jeans on the website;

 

By reaching the $65k we believe we’d have enough momentum to go all the way, and make the Jean Tailor project bloom the way we really think it should. Crazy customizations, outlandish designs by new and upcoming designers, and exciting new materials await.

We Invest In:
— Jean Tailor designer initiative (to help new designers get a foothold in the industry through us);
— hiring people;
— materials;
— development and testing;

You Get:
— production of made to measure jeans;
— crazy new designs of jeans;
— an extra array in denim selection (hemp denim, rare japanese selvedge, etc);
— colored denim (the whole gamut of colors);
— extra customizations (patterned pocket linings, etc.);
— quality improvements (edging on inside seams, strengthening of materials, etc.)

 

 

 

Our Story

We're focused on developing great jeans: we think this is important, as people wear them a lot of the time. We aim to improve on every aspect of the product, and yet keep the price affordable. The jeans you see here on Indiegogo represent our first line of products, which reflect our high standards and ideals when it comes to design and development.

We are a team of enthusiastic professionals coming from very different backgrounds, each of us filling essential roles in the project. Meet the team!

Ilya Bulichev Fashion designer with specialization in jeans. Ilya has been working with fashion and jeans for most of his life. He has more than 10 years of experience specifically with denim, and runs his small fashion atelier in his home city of Riga. Ilya is the one who knows everything about jeans styles, technology and design.

Yanis Lubins As the original author of the idea behind the project, with over 10 years experience in sales and marketing, Yanis is the guy you contact if you want to cooperate with us through our partner program.

Boris Lytvinenko Solving the problems of logistics, Boris makes sure we have all the great denim ingredients to work with, and takes care of the delivery of your jeans.

Sergey Potapov Running a smooth and lean manufacturing process of your made to measure orders is a tricky task, and Sergey ensures the intricate workings behind this process result in a great end-product for you.

Roman Sidoroff (from lab9.pro) Our graphics guru. Roman is a world class graphics designer with over 15 years of experience. He is behind all our visual presentation material and marketing consultant. All the cool graphics you see (logo, labels, website, banners, etc.) were designed and executed by Roman.

 

 

 

Questions?

How will the measurements be taken?

There are several options available to you when it comes to shaping your jeans the way you want.

Barring the option of going to one of our partner ateliers, the best choice will always be to visit a professional tailor who will take your measurements for you. Just make sure to explain to them that this will be for jeans, not trousers, and mention whatever wishes you might have regarding the shape of the jeans.

If you already have a pair that you have spent a lot of time on wearing-in and find it sits great on you, you can simply take the measures off that pair, and we will make you an identical one in size.

Towards the end of the campaign we will also be posting detailed instructions on how to take your measurements by yourself, should you decide to do that.

You can also simply choose a standard size from a standard size table, or choose a standard size and add your own modifications, etc...

Remember, we are open to discussing all the details once we start accepting your orders, and will make sure you will find an option that will be tailor made for you.

 

How soon can I get my jeans?

We will start the production of your jeans right after the campaign ends, which will be in the first half of October. Depending on the queue of orders the production of your jeans can take anywhere from 2 to 6 weeks. The Early Bird perks will of course be treated with priority.

After your jeans are done, we send them to you straight away. Factoring in whatever time is necessary to ship them to your location, you should receive your jeans in 1-2 months after the campaign ends.

 

What if they don't fit?

Anything can happen, so if by any chance we mess up and send you jeans that are absolutely off the measures you have provided, we will make you some new ones. 

However it can also happen that you lose/gain some weight in the meantime, which we unfortunately cannot account for. Therefore if you plan to go on a diet or to bulk up in the near future, please consider that when sending us your measures, and factor in any differences that may occur.

 

What are the shipping options?

For both the jeans and the smaller perks, such as the keychain or the keyholder we can ship globally, however you will need to calculate in around 2-10€ for shipping, depending on your location.

Since we are located in Latvia, EU, shipping across Europe is easier and therefore cheaper.
story_txt:
What would you say if the jeans you are wearing right now were not only a fashionable cut and made of premium denim, but also hand-sewn to your exact measures? All this at no extra costs for marketing, thanks to Indiegogo’s crowdfunding. Sounds exciting? Read on! With jeans today you will find a lot of common problems: uninspiring designs, limited choices of materials, unflattering cuts, and quite simply jeans that don’t sit well. The solution to any of these issues usually comes at great expense for the buyer. Jean the Tailor jeans turn all these problems into their strong points. Here’s how:
 
Made to your Measures
Jean the Tailor produces individual cuts for individual people. That means the jeans are sewn specifically for you — not just in some groups of “forms”, but by your exact measures — it’s a perfect fit! We achieve this by drawing an individual cut for every single pair that we create, and cutting them all out of denim one by one.

 
The Best in Denim
For Jean the Tailor jeans we use the best in denim — great quality cotton from Europe, and for our premium line for the true denim lover the best of selvedge from Japan’s Kuroki mills. We met with Mr. Kuroki in Paris, and hand-picked the tastiest produce from his factory to satisfy even the most capricious aficionados of raw selvedge denim.
“...for the true denim lover the best of selvedge from Japan’s Kuroki mills...”
 
The Models
The designs for our models aim to be versatile as well as functional. For Indiegogo we offer three types of models: a classic jeans look, a selvedge straight-cut, and a classy trouser-jeans model. Each variation comes both in men’s and women’s versions.



ClassicJeans Look

 

SelvedgeStraight-Cut

 

ClassyTrouser-Jeans



The ClassicHigh quality European denim, available in stiff (100% cotton) or stretch (2% elastane) denim variants. The classic model looks good with almost anything you can imagine — be it a casual outfit for everyday wear or a night out in the club — the perfect fit is always in style.
Selvedge straight-cutThe best in selvedge denim for the true denim aficionado. The eternal straight cut, made of Japanese 14.5 oz selvedge denim straight from Japan’s Kuroki mills comes with an ornamental strip of denim self-edge on the 5th pocket.
TrouserJeansA real class of its own — the authentic trouser look, except in denim. Complete with trouser crease lines and trouser pockets. Available in stiff (100% cotton) or stretch (2% elastane) denim. Perfect for a more sophisticated look with a shirt or blouse.
 
True gender equality
Jean the Tailor offers a true rarity — women’s straight cut selvedge jeans. You won’t easily find this type of cut in any shops at all, let alone made of selvedge. The difficulty in creating this cut is to preserve the original selvedge lining of the denim, which shows on the hem of the jeans. We solve this problem when creating the individual cut, making sure than the straight cut sits well even on the curviest forms.

 
Made in Europe
For Jean theTailor jeans the production cannot be outsourced to countries specialized in mass-production. Our way of creating jeans requires a close cooperation between the processes of designing, drafting, cutting, and sewing. In addition, we begin creating your jeans only after we receive your measurements, and this means the production of each pair needs to start ASAP. By keeping the production local we also ensure that you get your jeans faster.
 
Avoiding extra costs
Our jeans are not being sold in any retail stores, not only because we just can’t do that (we need your measures to create the cut, remember?), but this also helps us avoid all the mark-up costs retailers usually charge.
 
Tailor made
Jean Tailor jeans are also tailor made, which means they are each produced individually, by one master assembling them, and not on an assembly belt, by parts. This is a rare practice nowadays, but it assures that the quality of our jeans rises.
 
Customizable
With the extended goal we aim to offer you the ability to customize the ingredients for your jeans. Already now, through Indiegogo, we provide a choice in thread colors, button/rivets designs, and washing options. By reaching the extended goal we will make a wider variety of washes, different denims and pocket linings, back-pocket designs, and custom laser engravings available as well.
 

 


Updates
Keychain:
as per the denim perk, this keychain of denim will be yours!

 
Denim keyholder:
the denim protection perk is this nice little denim pocket to keep your sharp keys safely tucked in. You can choose to have it either with a backpocket design, or with a Jean Tailor logo.

 
Selvedge keyholder:
the self edge perk gives you a keyholder with a stylish selvedge rim - available in both male (14.5oz 100% cotton denim) or female (12oz 2% stretch denim) variants, either with a backpocket design, or the Jean Tailor logo.

 
 
 
How It Works?
So you’ve ordered a pair of jeans from the perks, and the deadline of the project arrives. What now?


Step 1: The measurements
We will send you a survey, in which we ask you for your measures and options. In terms of size you can:
— Choose a standard size, or a standard size with options (say, extra long legs)  — Take the measures from a pair of jeans that you like, and use those  — Take your own measures (towards the end of the project we will post a video with instructions on how to take your measures)  — Get your measures taken by a tailor.



Step 2: The Cut
Our skilled patternmakers will create your individual cut from your measures. Yes, this is all done individually, and the way we make it possible is through clever use of algorithms in patterns, and experience in making individual cuts.



Step 3: The manufacturing & Delivering
Now the jeans are cut out of the denim, and everything is individually assembled, with one master working per jeans.  After they’re done and measured, they are sent off to post-processing — washing and riveting.  Your jeans are ready and you will receive them per mail. We can ship all around the world.
 

 

 
 
 
Our Goals

At €14k, our essential goal is to set up our own production and start creating made to measure jeans by ourselves. We Invest In: — sewing machines; — hiring people; — materials; — quality control; — web programming;You Get: — production of made to measure jeans; — some customization options (threads, rivets); — some washes (raw, soft, stone); — a website for orders;
 

At our extended goal of €35k, we aim to upgrade the website so it can provide full customization to your jeans. We also add more washes, different denim and pocket lining types, and custom laser engravings. We Invest In: — web programming; — jeans design; — materials; — development and testing;You Get: — production of made to measure jeans; — full customization options; — 6 different washes; — laser options; — customization of your jeans on the website;
 

By reaching the $65k we believe we’d have enough momentum to go all the way, and make the Jean Tailor project bloom the way we really think it should. Crazy customizations, outlandish designs by new and upcoming designers, and exciting new materials await. We Invest In: — Jean Tailor designer initiative (to help new designers get a foothold in the industry through us); — hiring people; — materials; — development and testing;You Get: — production of made to measure jeans; — crazy new designs of jeans; — an extra array in denim selection (hemp denim, rare japanese selvedge, etc); — colored denim (the whole gamut of colors); — extra customizations (patterned pocket linings, etc.); — quality improvements (edging on inside seams, strengthening of materials, etc.)
 
 
 
Our Story

We're focused on developing great jeans: we think this is important, as people wear them a lot of the time. We aim to improve on every aspect of the product, and yet keep the price affordable. The jeans you see here on Indiegogo represent our first line of products, which reflect our high standards and ideals when it comes to design and development. We are a team of enthusiastic professionals coming from very different backgrounds, each of us filling essential roles in the project. Meet the team! 
Ilya Bulichev Fashion designer with specialization in jeans. Ilya has been working with fashion and jeans for most of his life. He has more than 10 years of experience specifically with denim, and runs his small fashion atelier in his home city of Riga. Ilya is the one who knows everything about jeans styles, technology and design. 
Yanis Lubins As the original author of the idea behind the project, with over 10 years experience in sales and marketing, Yanis is the guy you contact if you want to cooperate with us through our partner program. 
Boris Lytvinenko Solving the problems of logistics, Boris makes sure we have all the great denim ingredients to work with, and takes care of the delivery of your jeans. 
Sergey Potapov Running a smooth and lean manufacturing process of your made to measure orders is a tricky task, and Sergey ensures the intricate workings behind this process result in a great end-product for you. 
Roman Sidoroff (from lab9.pro) Our graphics guru. Roman is a world class graphics designer with over 15 years of experience. He is behind all our visual presentation material and marketing consultant. All the cool graphics you see (logo, labels, website, banners, etc.) were designed and executed by Roman.

story:
Short Summary

Sigma Alpha Iota is a music business fraternity. The Eta Mu Chapter is made up of strong women at the colligate level currently attending University of Hartford's Hartt School of Music. Many of our sisters have family members currently living with Alzheimer's. The Alzheimer's Association was the perfect place for our chapter to focus our fundraising efforts, and we need your help. 

The Impact

More than 5 million Americans have Alzheimer's. The Alzheimer's Association is dedicated to supporting those living with Alzheimer's and to finding a way to manage and ultimately prevent the disease.   

Ways You Can Help

Spread Awareness!  
Donate here! 
and 
Attend our Benefit For Life Concert on February 8th at 7pm in Lincoln Theater at the University of Hartford in Connecticut!

story:
Carrington Case: Help Us CarryEverything!

The Story

Carrington Case began about 1 year ago, when we set out to design luxury tech accessories that were suited for the modern professional. Gone are the days of over sized brief cases and frumpy messenger bags. Our products are designed to make the modern day professional's daily life easier.  We believe that valuable accessories keep you prepared, efficient and balanced or as we like to say, it helps you #carryeverything.

Then we saw a piece of bathroom art that totally shifted our "why"? (if you've seen the TED video by Simon Sinek, you'll understand what we mean)

That's when we decided that creating tech accessories that #carryeverything means so much more than just luxury sleek design. In that moment we committed a portion of all proceeds to encouraging young people to pursue an education in the fields of science and/or technology--the very industries that create the products that we design our cases to support and protect.  


All of our cases are made from 100% Premium Italian calf leather that looks and feels amazing.  We wanted to design cases that are both highly fashionable and functional at the same time.

Carrington iPhone 5S/5C Wallet Sleeve

We designed this iPhone sleeve because we were tired of searching for our wallet and our phone every time we needed to leave the house.  The Carrington iPhone Wallet Sleeve is the perfect tech accessory for the efficient professional.  The sleeve come in 3 colors: Black, Brown and Moon Dust Grey.

Brown

Moon Dust Grey

Black


Carrington iPad Mini Sleeve

Our iPad Mini Sleeve is the perfect minimalist case.  With built in card slots you can carry everything you need for a quick power lunch or just a day of shopping in the city. 

Brown

Moon Dust Grey


Black

Carrington 10" Tablet Sleeve

We really love this sleeve--and you will too. We designed it for the modern professional who has minimalist tendencies.  Whether its a day in the city, a quick business trip, a board meeting or a regular day at the office, our 10" Tablet Sleeve will keep you prepared.  


Brown

Moon Dust Grey

Black

Your Support

We really need your support to launch our first full line of mobile tech sleeves.  We are raising funding for the manufacturing, packaging, shipping cost and logistics of our Carrington Case Sleeves.  With your help, we can take this next step in delivering premium luxury sleeves.  Although, our cases will enhance your look, it does hurt that you support will also help us promote education in science and technology. Thank you so much for your support! #carryeverything

If you're unable to contribute, you still can support.  Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Then use the Indiegogo share tool to share our campaign with everyone you know--and we mean everyone! 

Manufacturing

Carrington Cases are meticulously crafted from 100% full grain genuine Italian calf leather.  We have established great partnership with our manufacturer and have full confidence that they will deliver the highest quality cases on we are successfully funded.  Our packaging material is designed and ready for printing.  Now, with your help we can get out the first production run of our new line!  Your pledge will go directly into the production and final assembly cost of the cases, allowing us to meet the minimum order quantity.  We are always open to suggestions on how we can make our products add even more value to you.  Please send us your feedback, it will be greatly appreciated. 

Risks and Challenges

The challenges of our first line of sleeves will be getting the word out and convincing backers to participate.  With so many great projects to choose from, we hope ours will stand apart form the rest.  To reach as many people as possible, we are asking our friends, families, bloggers and followers to help spread the word.
